G1070.desc: [G1070] γελάω geláō - of uncertain affinity; to laugh (as a sign of joy or satisfaction); laugh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1253.desc: [G1253] διάκρισις diákrisis - from G1252 (διακρίνω); judicial estimation; discern(-ing), disputation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1193.desc: [G1193] δερμάτινος dermátinos - from G1192 (δέρμα); made of hide; leathern, of a skin [BLB] [BibleHub]

G372.desc: [G372] ἀνάπαυσις anápausis - from G373 (ἀναπαύω); intermission; by implication, recreation; rest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G963.desc: [G963] Βηθανία Bēthanía - of Chaldee origin; date-house; Beth-any, a place in Palestine; Bethany [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5009.desc: [G5009] ταμεῖον tameîon - neuter contraction of a presumed derivative of (a dispenser or distributor; akin to , to cut); a dispensary or magazine, i.e. a chamber on the ground-floor or interior of an Oriental house (generally used for storage or privacy, a spot for retirement); secret chamber, closet, storehouse [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5270.desc: [G5270] ὑποκάτω hypokátō - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G2736 (κάτω); down under, i.e. beneath; under [BLB] [BibleHub]

G229.desc: [G229] ἀλήθω alḗthō - from the same as G224 (ἄλευρον); to grind; grind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3011.desc: [G3011] λειτουργός leitourgós - from a derivative of G2992 (λαός) and G2041 (ἔργον); a public servant, i.e. a functionary in the Temple or Gospel, or (genitive case) a worshipper (of God) or benefactor (of man); minister(-ed) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3703.desc: [G3703] ὀπώρα opṓra - apparently from the base of G3796 (ὀψέ) and G5610 (ὥρα); properly, even-tide of the (summer) season (dog-days), i.e. (by implication) ripe fruit; fruit [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3044.desc: [G3044] Λίνος Línos - perhaps from G3043 (λίνον); Linus, a Christian; Linus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2519.desc: [G2519] καθηγητής kathēgētḗs - from a compound of G2596 (κατά) and G2233 (ἡγέομαι); a guide, i.e. (figuratively) a teacher; master [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2671.desc: [G2671] κατάρα katára - from G2596 (κατά) (intensive) and G685 (ἀρά); imprecation, execration; curse(-d, ing) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2994.desc: [G2994] Λαοδικεύς Laodikeús - from G2993 (Λαοδίκεια); a Laodicean, i.e. inhabitant of Laodicia; Laodicean [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1161.desc: [G1161] δέ dé - a primary particle (adversative or continuative); but, and, etc.; also, and, but, moreover, now (often unexpressed in English) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4626.desc: [G4626] σκάπτω skáptō - apparently a primary verb; to dig; dig [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1565.desc: [G1565] ἐκεῖνος ekeînos - from G1563 (ἐκεῖ); that one (or (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed; he, it, the other (same), selfsame, that (same, very), X their, X them, they, this, those [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1953.desc: [G1953] ἐπιλησμονή epilēsmonḗ - from a derivative of G1950 (ἐπιλανθάνομαι); negligence; X forgetful [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4722.desc: [G4722] στέγω stégō - from G4721 (στέγη); to roof over, i.e. (figuratively) to cover with silence (endure patiently); (for-)bear, suffer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3174.desc: [G3174] μέγεθος mégethos - from G3173 (μέγας); magnitude (figuratively); greatness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2090.desc: [G2090] ἑτοιμάζω hetoimázō - from G2092 (ἕτοιμος); to prepare; prepare, provide, make ready [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1611.desc: [G1611] ἔκστασις ékstasis - from G1839 (ἐξίστημι); a displacement of the mind, i.e. bewilderment, "ecstasy"; + be amazed, amazement, astonishment, trance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2752.desc: [G2752] κέλευμα kéleuma - from G2753 (κελεύω); a cry of incitement; shout [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3317.desc: [G3317] μεσονύκτιον mesonýktion - neuter of compound of G3319 (μέσος) and G3571 (νύξ); midnight (especially as a watch); midnight [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3499.desc: [G3499] νεκρόω nekróō - from G3498 (νεκρός); to deaden, i.e. (figuratively) to subdue; be dead, mortify [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2582.desc: [G2582] Κανδάκη Kandákē - of foreign origin; Candacè, an Egyptian queen; Candace [BLB] [BibleHub]

G108.desc: [G108] Ἄζωτος Ázōtos - of Hebrew origin (H0795); Azotus (i.e. Ashdod), a place in Palestine; Azotus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5531.desc: [G5531] χράω chráō - probably the same as the base of G5530 (χράομαι); to loan; lend [BLB] [BibleHub]

G821.desc: [G821] ἀτιμόω atimóō - from G820 (ἄτιμος); used like G818 (ἀτιμάζω), to maltreat; handle shamefully [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3461.desc: [G3461] μυριάς myriás - from G3463 (μύριοι); a ten-thousand; by extension, a "myriad" or indefinite number; ten thousand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G900.desc: [G900] βαθύνω bathýnō - from G901 (βαθύς); to deepen; deep [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2808.desc: [G2808] κλείω kleíō - a primary verb; to close (literally or figuratively); shut (up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3492.desc: [G3492] ναύτης naútēs - from G3491 (ναῦς); a boatman, i.e. seaman; sailor, shipman [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2731.desc: [G2731] κατοίκησις katoíkēsis - from G2730 (κατοικέω); residence (properly, the act; but by implication, concretely, the mansion); dwelling [BLB] [BibleHub]

G663.desc: [G663] ἀποτομία apotomía - from the base of G664 (ἀποτόμως); (figuratively) decisiveness, i.e. rigor; severity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1825.desc: [G1825] ἐξεγείρω exegeírō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G1453 (ἐγείρω); to rouse fully, i.e. (figuratively) to resuscitate (from death), release (from infliction); raise up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4546.desc: [G4546] Σαμψών Sampsṓn - of Hebrew origin (H08123); Sampson (i.e. Shimshon), an Israelite; Samson [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1726.desc: [G1726] ἐναντίον enantíon - neuter of G1727 (ἐναντίος); (adverbially) in the presence (view) of; before, in the presence of [BLB] [BibleHub]

G582.desc: [G582] ἀπογραφή apographḗ - from G583 (ἀπογράφω); an enrollment; by implication, an assessment; taxing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5601.desc: [G5601] Ὠβήδ Ōbḗd - of Hebrew origin (H05744); Obed, an Israelite; Obed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4360.desc: [G4360] προσοχθίζω prosochthízō - from G4314 (πρός) and a form of (to be vexed with something irksome); to feel indignant at; be grieved at [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2931.desc: [G2931] κρυφῆ kryphē - adverb from G2928 (κρύπτω); privately; in secret [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4643.desc: [G4643] σκληρότης sklērótēs - from G4642 (σκληρός); callousness, i.e. (figuratively) stubbornness; hardness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G228.desc: [G228] ἀληθινός alēthinós - from G227 (ἀληθής); truthful; true [BLB] [BibleHub]

G998.desc: [G998] βοηθός boēthós - from G995 (βοή) and theo (to run); a succorer; helper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2252.desc: [G2252] ἤμην ḗmēn - a prolonged form of G2258 (ἦν); I was; be, was [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5451.desc: [G5451] φυτεία phyteía - from G5452 (φυτεύω); trans-planting, i.e. (concretely) a shrub or vegetable; plant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1043.desc: [G1043] Γαβριήλ Gabriḗl - of Hebrew origin (H01403); Gabriel, an archangel; Gabriel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4468.desc: [G4468] ῥᾳδιουργία rhaidiourgía - from the same as G4467 (ῥᾳδιούργημα); recklessness, i.e. (by extension) malignity; mischief [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3392.desc: [G3392] μιαίνω miaínō - perhaps a primary verb; to sully or taint, i.e. contaminate (ceremonially or morally); defile [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2802.desc: [G2802] Κλαύδη Klaúdē - of uncertain derivation; Claude, an island near Crete; Clauda [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2351.desc: [G2351] θόρυβος thórybos - from the base of G2360 (θροέω); a disturbance; tumult, uproar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1066.desc: [G1066] Γεδεών Gedeṓn - of Hebrew origin (H01439); Gedeon (i.e. Gid(e)on), an Israelite; Gedeon (in the King James Version) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2329.desc: [G2329] θέρμη thérmē - from the base of G2330 (θέρος); warmth; heat [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2877.desc: [G2877] κοράσιον korásion - neuter of a presumed derivative of (a maiden); a (little) girl; damsel, maid [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1045.desc: [G1045] Γάδ Gád - of Hebrew origin (H01410); Gad, a tribe of Israelites; Gad [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5435.desc: [G5435] Φρυγία Phrygía - probably of foreign origin; Phrygia, a region of Asia Minor; Phrygia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G338.desc: [G338] ἀναίτιος anaítios - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G159 (αἴτιος) (in the sense of G156 (αἰτία)); innocent; blameless, guiltless [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4427.desc: [G4427] πτύσμα ptýsma - from G4429 (πτύω); saliva; spittle [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1221.desc: [G1221] δήποτε dḗpote - from G1211 (δή) and G4218 (ποτέ); a particle of generalization; indeed, at any time; (what-)soever [BLB] [BibleHub]

G643.desc: [G643] ἀποσκευάζω aposkeuázō - from G575 (ἀπό) and a derivative of G4632 (σκεῦος); to pack up (one's) baggage; take up… carriages [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3622.desc: [G3622] οἰκονομία oikonomía - from G3623 (οἰκονόμος); administration (of a household or estate); specially, a (religious) "economy"; dispensation, stewardship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2082.desc: [G2082] ἐσώτερος esṓteros - comparative of G2080 (ἔσω); interior; inner, within [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3515.desc: [G3515] νηπιάζω nēpiázō - from G3516 (νήπιος); to act as a babe, i.e. (figuratively) innocently; be a child [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3578.desc: [G3578] ξενία xenía - from G3581 (ξένος); hospitality, i.e. (by implication) a place of entertainment; lodging [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5486.desc: [G5486] χάρισμα chárisma - from G5483 (χαρίζομαι); a (divine) gratuity, i.e. deliverance (from danger or passion); (specially), a (spiritual) endowment, i.e. (subjectively) religious qualification, or (objectively) miraculous faculty; (free) gift [BLB] [BibleHub]

G106.desc: [G106] ἄζυμος ázymos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2219 (ζύμη); unleavened, i.e. (figuratively) uncorrupted; (in the neutral plural) specially (by implication) the Passover week; unleavened (bread) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2230.desc: [G2230] ἡγεμονεύω hēgemoneúō - from G2232 (ἡγεμών); to act as ruler; be governor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1643.desc: [G1643] ἐλαύνω elaúnō - a prolonged form of a primary verb (obsolete except in certain tenses as an alternative of this) of uncertain affinity; to push (as wind, oars or dæmonical power); carry, drive, row [BLB] [BibleHub]

G491.desc: [G491] Ἀντιοχεύς Antiocheús - from G490 (Ἀντιόχεια); an Antiochian or inhabitant of Antiochia; of Antioch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4927.desc: [G4927] συνομορέω synomoréō - from G4862 (σύν) and a derivative of a compound of the base of 3674 and the base of G3725 (ὅριον); to border together, i.e. adjoin; join hard [BLB] [BibleHub]

G332.desc: [G332] ἀναθεματίζω anathematízō - from G331 (ἀνάθεμα); to declare or vow under penalty of execration; (bind under a) curse, bind with an oath [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4123.desc: [G4123] πλεονέκτης pleonéktēs - from G4119 (πλείων) and G2192 (ἔχω); holding (desiring) more, i.e. eager for gain (avaricious, hence a defrauder); covetous [BLB] [BibleHub]

G201.desc: [G201] ἀκροατήριον akroatḗrion - from G202 (ἀκροατής); an audience-room; place of hearing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5065.desc: [G5065] τεσσαρεσκαιδέκατος tessareskaidékatos - from G5064 (τέσσαρες) and G2532 (καί) and G1182 (δέκατος); fourteenth; fourteenth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1910.desc: [G1910] ἐπιβαίνω epibaínō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and the base of G939 (βάσις); to walk upon, i.e. mount, ascend, embark, arrive; come (into), enter into, go abroad, sit upon, take ship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2699.desc: [G2699] κατατομή katatomḗ - from a compound of G2596 (κατά) and (to cut); a cutting down (off), i.e. mutilation (ironically); concision [BLB] [BibleHub]

G692.desc: [G692] ἀργός argós - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2041 (ἔργον); inactive, i.e. unemployed; (by implication) lazy, useless; barren, idle, slow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1047.desc: [G1047] γάζα gáza - of foreign origin; a treasure; treasure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G948.desc: [G948] βδελύσσω bdelýssō - from a (presumed) derivative of (to stink); to be disgusted, i.e. (by implication) detest (especially of idolatry); abhor, abominable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2045.desc: [G2045] ἐρευνάω ereunáō - apparently from G2046 (ἐρέω) (through the idea of inquiry); to seek, i.e. (figuratively) to investigate; search [BLB] [BibleHub]

G146.desc: [G146] αἰσχροκερδής aischrokerdḗs - from G150 (αἰσχρός) and (gain); sordid; given to (greedy of) filthy lucre [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4368.desc: [G4368] προστάτις prostátis - feminine of a derivative of G4291 (προΐστημι); a patroness, i.e. assistant; succourer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5329.desc: [G5329] Φάρες Pháres - of Hebrew origin (H06557); Phares (i.e. Perets), an Israelite; Phares [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3771.desc: [G3771] οὐρανόθεν ouranóthen - from G3772 (οὐρανός) and the enclitic of source; from the sky; from heaven [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2748.desc: [G2748] Κεδρών Kedrṓn - of Hebrew origin (H06939); Cedron (i.e. Kidron), a brook near Jerusalem; Cedron [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5229.desc: [G5229] ὑπεραίρομαι hyperaíromai - middle voice from G5228 (ὑπέρ) and G142 (αἴρω); to raise oneself over, i.e. (figuratively) to become haughty; exalt self, be exalted above measure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3927.desc: [G3927] παρεπίδημος parepídēmos - from G3844 (παρά) and the base of G1927 (ἐπιδημέω); an alien alongside, i.e. a resident foreigner; pilgrim, stranger [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1110.desc: [G1110] γνωστός gnōstós - from G1097 (γινώσκω); well-known; acquaintance, (which may be) known, notable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2266.desc: [G2266] Ἡρωδιάς Hērōdiás - from G2264 (Ἡρώδης); Herodias, a woman of the Heodian family; Herodias [BLB] [BibleHub]

G468.desc: [G468] ἀνταπόδομα antapódoma - from G467 (ἀνταποδίδωμι); a requital (properly, the thing); recompense [BLB] [BibleHub]

G961.desc: [G961] Βεροιαῖος Beroiaîos - from G960 (Βέροια); a Berœoean or native of Berœa; of Berea [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4862.desc: [G4862] σύν sýn - a primary preposition denoting union; with or together (but much closer than G3326 (μετά) or G3844 (παρά)), i.e. by association, companionship, process, resemblance, possession, instrumentality, addition, etc.; beside, with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2596.desc: [G2596] κατά katá - a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined); about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5010.desc: [G5010] τάξις táxis - from G5021 (τάσσω); regular arrangement, i.e. (in time) fixed succession (of rank or character), official dignity; order [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5256.desc: [G5256] ὑπηρετέω hypēretéō - from G5257 (ὑπηρέτης); to be a subordinate, i.e. (by implication) subserve; minister (unto), serve [BLB] [BibleHub]

G363.desc: [G363] ἀναμιμνήσκω anamimnḗskō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G3403 (μιμνήσκω); to remind; (reflexively) to recollect; call to mind, (bring to , call to, put in), remember(-brance) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2054.desc: [G2054] ἔρις éris - of uncertain affinity; a quarrel, i.e. (by implication) wrangling; contention, debate, strife, variance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1609.desc: [G1609] ἐκπτύω ekptýō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G4429 (πτύω); to spit out, i.e. (figuratively) spurn; reject [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2355.desc: [G2355] θρῆνος thrēnos - from the base of G2360 (θροέω); wailing; lamentation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3641.desc: [G3641] ὀλίγος olígos - of uncertain affinity; puny (in extent, degree, number, duration or value); especially neuter (adverbially) somewhat; + almost, brief(-ly), few, (a) little, + long, a season, short, small, a while [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2179.desc: [G2179] Ἐφεσῖνος Ephesînos - from G2181 (Ἔφεσος); Ephesine, or situated at Ephesus; of Ephesus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3158.desc: [G3158] Ματθάτ Matthát - probably a shortened form of G3161 (Ματταθίας); Matthat (i.e. Mattithjah), the name of two Israelites; Mathat [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1668.desc: [G1668] ἕλκος hélkos - probably from G1670 (ἑλκύω); an ulcer (as if drawn together); sore [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4820.desc: [G4820] συμβάλλω symbállō - from G4862 (σύν) and G906 (βάλλω); to combine, i.e. (in speaking) to converse, consult, dispute, (mentally) to consider, (by implication) to aid, (personally) to join, attack; confer, encounter, help, make, meet with, ponder [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5140.desc: [G5140] τρεῖς treîs - a primary (plural) number; "three"; three [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2393.desc: [G2393] ἴασπις íaspis - probably of foreign origin (see H03471); "jasper", a gem; jasper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1973.desc: [G1973] ἐπιπόθητος epipóthētos - from G1909 (ἐπί) and a derivative of the latter part of G1971 (ἐπιποθέω); yearned upon, i.e. greatly loved; longed for [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5470.desc: [G5470] χάλκεος chálkeos - from G5475 (χαλκός); coppery; brass [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4248.desc: [G4248] πρηνής prēnḗs - from G4253 (πρό); leaning (falling) forward ("prone"), i.e. head foremost; headlong [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1957.desc: [G1957] ἐπιμαρτυρέω epimartyréō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3140 (μαρτυρέω); to attest further, i.e. corroborate; testify [BLB] [BibleHub]

G854.desc: [G854] ἀφανισμός aphanismós - from G853 (ἀφανίζω); disappearance, i.e. (figuratively) abrogation; vanish away [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1939.desc: [G1939] ἐπιθυμία epithymía - from G1937 (ἐπιθυμέω); a longing (especially for what is forbidden); concupiscence, desire, lust (after) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2556.desc: [G2556] κακός kakós - apparently a primary word; worthless (intrinsically, such; whereas G4190 (πονηρός) properly refers to effects), i.e. (subjectively) depraved, or (objectively) injurious; bad, evil, harm, ill, noisome, wicked [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4744.desc: [G4744] στίλβω stílbō - apparently a primary verb; to gleam, i.e. flash intensely; shining [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2201.desc: [G2201] ζεῦγος zeûgos - from the same as G2218 (ζυγός); a couple, i.e. a team (of oxen yoked together) or brace (of birds tied together); yoke, pair [BLB] [BibleHub]

G616.desc: [G616] ἀποκυέω apokyéō - from G575 (ἀπό) and the base of G2949 (κῦμα); to breed forth, i.e. (by transference) to generate (figuratively); beget, produce [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1090.desc: [G1090] γεωργέω geōrgéō - from G1092 (γεωργός); to till (the soil); dress [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1432.desc: [G1432] δωρεάν dōreán - accusative case of G1431 (δωρεά) as adverb; gratuitously (literally or figuratively); without a cause, freely, for naught, in vain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3061.desc: [G3061] λοιμός loimós - of uncertain affinity; a plague (literally, the disease, or figuratively, a pest); pestilence(-t) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2818.desc: [G2818] κληρονόμος klēronómos - from G2819 (κλῆρος) and the base of G3551 (νόμος) (in its original sense of partitioning, i.e. (reflexively) getting by apportionment); a sharer by lot, i.e. inheritor (literally or figuratively); by implication, a possessor; heir [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2168.desc: [G2168] εὐχαριστέω eucharistéō - from G2170 (εὐχάριστος); to be grateful, i.e. (actively) to express gratitude (towards); specially, to say grace at a meal; (give) thank(-ful, -s) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2239.desc: [G2239] ἦθος ēthos - a strengthened form of G1485 (ἔθος); usage, i.e. (plural) moral habits; manners [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4587.desc: [G4587] σεμνότης semnótēs - from G4586 (σεμνός); venerableness, i.e. probity; gravity, honesty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1105.desc: [G1105] γνόφος gnóphos - akin to G3509 (νέφος); gloom (as of a storm); blackness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2848.desc: [G2848] κόκκος kókkos - apparently a primary word; a kernel of seed; corn, grain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1830.desc: [G1830] ἐξερευνάω exereunáō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2045 (ἐρευνάω); to explore (figuratively); search diligently [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5247.desc: [G5247] ὑπεροχή hyperochḗ - from G5242 (ὑπερέχω); prominence, i.e. (figuratively) superiority (in rank or character); authority, excellency [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4634.desc: [G4634] σκηνοπηγία skēnopēgía - from G4636 (σκῆνος) and G4078 (πήγνυμι); the Festival of Tabernacles (so called from the custom of erecting booths for temporary homes); tabernacles [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1026.desc: [G1026] βρέχω bréchō - a primary verb; to moisten (especially by a shower); (send) rain, wash [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4613.desc: [G4613] Σίμων Símōn - of Hebrew origin (H08095); Simon (i.e. Shimon), the name of nine Israelites; Simon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4259.desc: [G4259] προαύλιον proaúlion - neuter of a presumed compound of G4253 (πρό) and G833 (αὐλή); a forecourt, i.e. vestibule (alley-way); porch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1098.desc: [G1098] γλεῦκος gleûkos - akin to G1099 (γλυκύς); sweet wine, i.e. (properly) must (fresh juice), but used of the more saccharine (and therefore highly inebriating) fermented wine; new wine [BLB] [BibleHub]

G666.desc: [G666] ἀπουσία apousía - from the participle of G548 (ἄπειμι); a being away; absence [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3139.desc: [G3139] μάρμαρος mármaros - from (to glisten); marble (as sparkling white); marble [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3676.desc: [G3676] ὅμως hómōs - adverb from the base of G3674 (ὁμοῦ); at the same time, i.e. (conjunctionally) notwithstanding, yet still; and even, nevertheless, though but [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4938.desc: [G4938] σύντριμμα sýntrimma - from G4937 (συντρίβω); concussion or utter fracture (properly, concretely), i.e. complete ruin; destruction [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2646.desc: [G2646] κατάλυμα katályma - from G2647 (καταλύω); properly, a dissolution (breaking up of a journey), i.e. (by implication) a lodging-place; guestchamber, inn [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4012.desc: [G4012] περί perí - from the base of G4008 (πέραν); properly, through (all over), i.e. around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time (with the genitive case denoting the subject or occasion or superlative point; with the accusative case the locality, circuit, matter, circumstance or general period); (there-)about, above, against, at, on behalf of, X and his company, which concern, (as) concerning, for, X how it will go with, ((there-, where-)) of, on, over, pertaining (to), for sake, X (e-)state, (as) touching, (where-)by (in), with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1268.desc: [G1268] διανέμω dianémō - from G1223 (διά) and the base of G3551 (νόμος); to distribute, i.e. (of information) to disseminate; spread [BLB] [BibleHub]

G333.desc: [G333] ἀναθεωρέω anatheōréō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G2334 (θεωρέω); to look again (i.e. attentively) at (literally or figuratively); behold, consider [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5591.desc: [G5591] ψυχικός psychikós - from G5590 (ψυχή); sensitive, i.e. animate (in distinction on the one hand from G4152 (πνευματικός), which is the higher or renovated nature; and on the other from G5446 (φυσικός), which is the lower or bestial nature); natural, sensual [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3467.desc: [G3467] μυωπάζω myōpázō - from a compound of the base of G3466 (μυστήριον) and (the face; from G3700 (ὀπτάνομαι)); to shut the eyes, i.e. blink (see indistinctly); cannot see far off [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2840.desc: [G2840] κοινόω koinóō - from G2839 (κοινός); to make (or consider) profane (ceremonially); call common, defile, pollute, unclean [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3421.desc: [G3421] μνημονεύω mnēmoneúō - from a derivative of G3420 (μνήμη); to exercise memory, i.e. recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse; make mention; be mindful, remember [BLB] [BibleHub]

G943.desc: [G943] βάτος bátos - of Hebrew origin (H01324); a bath, or measure for liquids; measure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3974.desc: [G3974] Πάφος Páphos - of uncertain derivation; Paphus, a place in Cyprus; Paphos [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4716.desc: [G4716] σταυρός staurós - from the base of G2476 (ἵστημι); a stake or post (as set upright), i.e. (specially), a pole or cross (as an instrument of capital punishment); figuratively, exposure to death, i.e. self-denial; by implication, the atonement of Christ; cross [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2208.desc: [G2208] Ζηλωτής Zēlōtḗs - the same as G2207 (ζηλωτής); a Zealot, i.e. (specially) partisan for Jewish political independence; Zelotes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3148.desc: [G3148] μάστιξ mástix - probably from the base of G3145 (μασσάομαι) (through the idea of contact); a whip (literally, the Roman flagellum for criminals; figuratively, a disease); plague, scourging [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4095.desc: [G4095] πίνω pínō - a prolonged form of ; which (together with another form) ; occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe (literally or figuratively); drink [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2783.desc: [G2783] κῆρυξ kēryx - from G2784 (κηρύσσω); a herald, i.e. of divine truth (especially of the gospel); preacher [BLB] [BibleHub]

G595.desc: [G595] ἀπόθεσις apóthesis - from G659 (ἀποτίθημι); a laying aside (literally or figuratively); putting away (off) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1644.desc: [G1644] ἐλαφρία elaphría - from G1645 (ἐλαφρός); levity (figuratively), i.e. fickleness; lightness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G223.desc: [G223] Ἀλέξανδρος Aléxandros - from the same as (the first part of) G220 (ἀλέκτωρ) and G435 (ἀνήρ); man-defender; Alexander, the name of three Israelites and one other man; Alexander [BLB] [BibleHub]

G583.desc: [G583] ἀπογράφω apográphō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G1125 (γράφω); to write off (a copy or list), i.e. enrol; tax, write [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3799.desc: [G3799] ὄψις ópsis - from G3700 (ὀπτάνομαι); properly, sight (the act), i.e. (by implication) the visage, an external show; appearance, countenance, face [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3936.desc: [G3936] παρίστημι parístēmi - from G3844 (παρά) and G2476 (ἵστημι); to stand beside, i.e. (transitively) to exhibit, proffer, (specially), recommend, (figuratively) substantiate; or (intransitively) to be at hand (or ready), aid; assist, bring before, command, commend, give presently, present, prove, provide, shew, stand (before, by, here, up, with), yield [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1213.desc: [G1213] δηλόω dēlóō - from G1212 (δῆλος); to make plain (by words); declare, shew, signify [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5388.desc: [G5388] φιλότεκνος philóteknos - from G5384 (φίλος) and G5043 (τέκνον); fond of one's children, i.e. maternal; love their children [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2481.desc: [G2481] ἴσως ísōs - adverb from G2470 (ἴσος); likely, i.e. perhaps; it may be [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5073.desc: [G5073] τετραπλόος tetraplóos - from G5064 (τέσσαρες) and a derivative of the base of G4118 (πλεῖστος); quadruple; fourfold [BLB] [BibleHub]

G193.desc: [G193] ἀκρατής akratḗs - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2904 (κράτος); powerless, i.e. without self-control; incontinent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2162.desc: [G2162] εὐφημία euphēmía - from G2163 (εὔφημος); good language ("euphemy"), i.e. praise (repute); good report [BLB] [BibleHub]

G820.desc: [G820] ἄτιμος átimos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5092 (τιμή); (negatively) unhonoured or (positively) dishonoured; despised, without honour, less honourable (comparative degree) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G941.desc: [G941] βαστάζω bastázō - perhaps remotely derived from the base of G939 (βάσις) (through the idea of removal); to lift, literally or figuratively (endure, declare, sustain, receive, etc.); bear, carry, take up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3107.desc: [G3107] μακάριος makários - a prolonged form of the poetical (meaning the same); supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off; blessed, happy(X -ier) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2022.desc: [G2022] ἐπιχέω epichéō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and (to pour); ; --to pour upon:--pour in [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2280.desc: [G2280] Θαδδαῖος Thaddaîos - of uncertain origin; Thaddæus, one of the Apostles; Thaddæus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3953.desc: [G3953] παροψίς paropsís - from G3844 (παρά) and the base of G3795 (ὀψάριον); a side-dish (the receptacle); platter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4230.desc: [G4230] πραγματεία pragmateía - from G4231 (πραγματεύομαι); a transaction, i.e. negotiation; affair [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2143.desc: [G2143] εὐπρέπεια euprépeia - from a compound of G2095 (εὖ) and G4241 (πρέπω); good suitableness, i.e. gracefulness; grace [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2964.desc: [G2964] κυρόω kyróō - from the same as G2962 (κύριος); to make authoritative, i.e. ratify; confirm [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2914.desc: [G2914] Κρήτη Krḗtē - of uncertain derivation; Crete, an island in the Mediterranean; Crete [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1902.desc: [G1902] ἐπενδύομαι ependýomai - middle voice from G1909 (ἐπί) and G1746 (ἐνδύω); to invest upon oneself; be clothed upon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1569.desc: [G1569] ἔκθαμβος ékthambos - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2285 (θάμβος); utterly astounded; greatly wondering [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4768.desc: [G4768] στυγνάζω stygnázō - from the same as G4767 (στυγνητός); to render gloomy, i.e. (by implication) glower (be overcast with clouds, or sombreness of speech); lower, be sad [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3375.desc: [G3375] μήν mḗn - a stronger form of G3303 (μέν); a particle of affirmation (only with G2229 (ἦ)); assuredly; + surely [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4082.desc: [G4082] πήρα pḗra - of uncertain affinity; a wallet or leather pouch for food; scrip [BLB] [BibleHub]

G767.desc: [G767] ἄσημος ásēmos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and the base of G4591 (σημαίνω); unmarked, i.e. (figuratively) ignoble; mean [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4811.desc: [G4811] συκοφαντέω sykophantéō - from a compound of G4810 (σῦκον) and a derivative of G5316 (φαίνω); to be a fig-informer (reporter of the law forbidding the exportation of figs from Greece), "sycophant", i.e. (genitive and by extension) to defraud (exact unlawfully, extort); accuse falsely, take by false accusation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5026.desc: [G5026] ταύτῃ taútēi - dative case, accusative case and genitive case respectively of the feminine singular of G3778 (οὗτος); (towards or of) this; her, + hereof, it, that, + thereby, the (same), this (same) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3901.desc: [G3901] παραῤῥυέω pararrhyéō - from G3844 (παρά) and the alternate of G4482 (ῥέω); to flow by, i.e. (figuratively) carelessly pass (miss); let slip [BLB] [BibleHub]

G689.desc: [G689] Ἀράμ Arám - of Hebrew origin (H07410); Aram (i.e. Ram), an Israelite; Aram [BLB] [BibleHub]

G989.desc: [G989] βλάσφημος blásphēmos - from a derivative of G984 (βλάπτω) and G5345 (φήμη); scurrilious, i.e. calumnious (against men), or (specially) impious (against God); blasphemer(-mous), railing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5422.desc: [G5422] φρεναπατάω phrenapatáō - from G5423 (φρεναπάτης); to be a mind-misleader, i.e. delude; deceive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2466.desc: [G2466] Ἰσαχάρ Isachár - of Hebrew origin (H03485); Isachar (i.e. Jissaskar), a son of Jacob (figuratively, his descendant); Issachar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G336.desc: [G336] ἀναίρεσις anaíresis - from G337 (ἀναιρέω); (the act of) killing; death [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4507.desc: [G4507] ῥυπαρία rhyparía - from G4508 (ῥυπαρός); dirtiness (morally); turpitude [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2281.desc: [G2281] θάλασσα thálassa - probably prolonged from G251 (ἅλς); the sea (genitive case or specially); sea [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2649.desc: [G2649] καταμαρτυρέω katamartyréō - from G2596 (κατά) and G3140 (μαρτυρέω); to testify against; witness against [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2527.desc: [G2527] καθόλου kathólou - from G2596 (κατά) and G3650 (ὅλος); on the whole, i.e. entirely; at all [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4736.desc: [G4736] Στέφανος Stéphanos - the same as G4735 (στέφανος); Stephanus, a Christian; Stephen [BLB] [BibleHub]

G104.desc: [G104] ἀεί aeí - from an obsolete primary noun (apparently meaning continued duration); "ever," by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly; always, ever [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4925.desc: [G4925] συνοικοδομέω synoikodoméō - from G4862 (σύν) and G3618 (οἰκοδομέω); to construct, i.e. (passively) to compose (in company with other Christians, figuratively); build together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3828.desc: [G3828] Παμφυλία Pamphylía - from a compound of G3956 (πᾶς) and G4443 (πυρά); every-tribal, i.e. heterogeneous (G5561 (χώρα) being implied); Pamphylia, a region of Asia Minor; Pamphylia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1943.desc: [G1943] ἐπικαλύπτω epikalýptō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G2572 (καλύπτω); to conceal, i.e. (figuratively) forgive; cover [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2535.desc: [G2535] Κάϊν Káïn - of Hebrew origin (H07014); Cain, (i.e. Cajin), the son of Adam; Cain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1191.desc: [G1191] Δέρβη Dérbē - of foreign origin; Derbe, a place in Asia Minor; Derbe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3920.desc: [G3920] παρείσακτος pareísaktos - from G3919 (παρεισάγω); smuggled in; unawares brought in [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1975.desc: [G1975] ἐπιπορεύομαι epiporeúomai - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G4198 (πορεύομαι); to journey further, i.e. travel on (reach); come [BLB] [BibleHub]

G18.desc: [G18] ἀγαθός agathós - a primary word; "good" (in any sense, often as noun); benefit, good(-s, things), well [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4037.desc: [G4037] περιμένω periménō - from G4012 (περί) and G3306 (μένω); to stay around, i.e. await; wait for [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4285.desc: [G4285] προηγέομαι proēgéomai - from G4253 (πρό) and G2233 (ἡγέομαι); to lead the way for others, i.e. show deference; prefer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2897.desc: [G2897] κραιπάλη kraipálē - probably from the same as G726 (ἁρπάζω); properly, a headache (as a seizure of pain) from drunkenness, i.e. (by implication) a debauch (by analogy, a glut); surfeiting [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3372.desc: [G3372] μῆκος mēkos - probably akin to G3173 (μέγας); length (literally or figuratively) length. ; [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3032.desc: [G3032] Λιβερτῖνος Libertînos - of Latin origin; a Roman freedman; Libertine [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3408.desc: [G3408] μισθός misthós - apparently a primary word; pay for service (literally or figuratively), good or bad; hire, reward, wages [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3824.desc: [G3824] παλιγγενεσία palingenesía - from G3825 (πάλιν) and G1078 (γένεσις); (spiritual) rebirth (the state or the act), i.e. (figuratively) spiritual renovation; specially, Messianic restoration; regeneration [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2312.desc: [G2312] θεοδίδακτος theodídaktos - from G2316 (θεός) and G1321 (διδάσκω); divinely instructed; taught of God [BLB] [BibleHub]

G950.desc: [G950] βεβαιόω bebaióō - from G949 (βέβαιος); to stabilitate (figuratively); confirm, (e-)stablish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1427.desc: [G1427] δώδεκα dṓdeka - from G1417 (δύο) and G1176 (δέκα); two and ten, i.e. a dozen; twelve [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3874.desc: [G3874] παράκλησις paráklēsis - from G3870 (παρακαλέω); imploration, hortation, solace; comfort, consolation, exhortation, intreaty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2215.desc: [G2215] ζιζάνιον zizánion - of uncertain origin; darnel or false grain; tares [BLB] [BibleHub]

G77.desc: [G77] ἀδάπανος adápanos - from G1 (Α) (as negative particle); and G1160 (δαπάνη); costless, i.e. gratuitous; without expense [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4434.desc: [G4434] πτωχός ptōchós - from (to crouch); akin to G4422 (πτοέω) and the alternate of G4098 (πίπτω)); a beggar (as cringing), i.e. pauper (strictly denoting absolute or public mendicancy, although also used in a qualified or relative sense; whereas G3993 (πένης) properly means only straitened circumstances in private), literally (often as noun) or figuratively (distressed); beggar(-ly), poor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1155.desc: [G1155] δανείζω daneízō - from G1156 (δάνειον); to loan on interest; reflexively, to borrow; borrow, lend [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4156.desc: [G4156] πνικτός pniktós - from G4155 (πνίγω); throttled, i.e. (neuter concretely) an animal choked to death (not bled); strangled [BLB] [BibleHub]

G876.desc: [G876] ἀφρός aphrós - apparently a primary word; froth, i.e. slaver; foaming [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4654.desc: [G4654] σκοτίζω skotízō - from G4655 (σκότος); to obscure (literally or figuratively); darken [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3827.desc: [G3827] πάμπολυς pámpolys - from G3956 (πᾶς) and G4183 (πολύς); full many, i.e. immense; very great [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1963.desc: [G1963] ἐπίνοια epínoia - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3563 (νοῦς); attention of the mind, i.e. (by implication) purpose; thought [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5569.desc: [G5569] ψευδάδελφος pseudádelphos - from G5571 (ψευδής) and G80 (ἀδελφός); a spurious brother, i.e. pretended associate; false brethren [BLB] [BibleHub]

G210.desc: [G210] ἄκων ákōn - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G1635 (ἑκών); unwilling; against the will [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3510.desc: [G3510] νεφρός nephrós - of uncertain affinity; a kidney (plural), i.e. (figuratively) the inmost mind; reins [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1802.desc: [G1802] Ἐνώχ Enṓch - of Hebrew origin (H02585); Enoch (i.e. Chanok), an antediluvian; Enoch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1261.desc: [G1261] διαλογισμός dialogismós - from G1260 (διαλογίζομαι); discussion, i.e. (internal) consideration (by implication, purpose), or (external) debate; dispute, doubtful(-ing), imagination, reasoning, thought [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3554.desc: [G3554] νόσος nósos - of uncertain affinity; a malady (rarely figuratively, of moral disability); disease, infirmity, sickness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1179.desc: [G1179] Δεκάπολις Dekápolis - from G1176 (δέκα) and G4172 (πόλις); the ten-city region; the Decapolis, a district in Syria; Decapolis [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3426.desc: [G3426] μόδιος módios - of Latin origin; a modius, i.e. certain measure for things dry (the quantity or the utensil); bushel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G720.desc: [G720] ἀρνέομαι arnéomai - perhaps from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and the middle voice of G4483 (ῥέω); to contradict, i.e. disavow, reject, abnegate; deny, refuse [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5472.desc: [G5472] χαλκηδών chalkēdṓn - from G5475 (χαλκός) and perhaps G1491 (εἶδος); copper-like, i.e. "chalcedony"; chalcedony [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5001.desc: [G5001] τάγμα tágma - from G5021 (τάσσω); something orderly in arrangement (a troop), i.e. (figuratively) a series or succession; order [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1919.desc: [G1919] ἐπίγειος epígeios - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G1093 (γῆ); worldly (physically or morally); earthly, in earth, terrestrial [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2502.desc: [G2502] Ἰωσίας Iōsías - of Hebrew origin (H02977); Josias (i.e. Joshiah), an Israelite; Josias [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4828.desc: [G4828] συμμαρτυρέω symmartyréō - from G4862 (σύν) and G3140 (μαρτυρέω); to testify jointly, i.e. corroborate by (concurrent) evidence; testify unto, (also) bear witness (with) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3635.desc: [G3635] ὀκνέω oknéō - from (hesitation); to be slow (figuratively, loath); delay [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4190.desc: [G4190] πονηρός ponērós - from a derivative of G4192 (πόνος); hurtful, i.e. evil (properly, in effect or influence, and thus differing from G2556 (κακός), which refers rather to essential character, as well as from G4550 (σαπρός), which indicates degeneracy from original virtue); figuratively, calamitous; also (passively) ill, i.e. diseased; but especially (morally) culpable, i.e. derelict, vicious, facinorous; neuter (singular) mischief, malice, or (plural) guilt; masculine (singular) the devil, or (plural) sinners; bad, evil, grievous, harm, lewd, malicious, wicked(-ness) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G968.desc: [G968] βῆμα bēma - from the base of G939 (βάσις); a step, i.e. foot-breath; by implication, a rostrum, i.e. a tribunal; judgment-seat, set (foot) on, throne [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3184.desc: [G3184] μεθύω methýō - from another form of G3178 (μέθη); to drink to intoxication, i.e. get drunk; drink well, make (be) drunk(-en) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3738.desc: [G3738] ὀρχέομαι orchéomai - middle voice from (a row or ring); to dance (from the ranklike or regular motion); dance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G995.desc: [G995] βοή boḗ - from G994 (βοάω); a halloo, i.e. call (for aid, etc.); cry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G911.desc: [G911] βάπτω báptō - a primary verb; to whelm, i.e. cover wholly with a fluid; in the New Testament only in a qualified or special sense, i.e. (literally) to moisten (a part of one's person), or (by implication) to stain (as with dye); dip [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2513.desc: [G2513] καθαρός katharós - of uncertain affinity; clean (literally or figuratively); clean, clear, pure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2440.desc: [G2440] ἱμάτιον himátion - neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi (to put on); a dress (inner or outer); apparel, cloke, clothes, garment, raiment, robe, vesture [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2902.desc: [G2902] κρατέω kratéō - from G2904 (κράτος); to use strength, i.e. seize or retain (literally or figuratively); hold (by, fast), keep, lay hand (hold) on, obtain, retain, take (by) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4401.desc: [G4401] προχειροτονέω procheirotonéō - from G4253 (πρό) and G5500 (χειροτονέω); to elect in advance; choose before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3366.desc: [G3366] μηδέ mēdé - from G3361 (μή) and G1161 (δέ); but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor; neither, nor (yet), (no) not (once, so much as) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5045.desc: [G5045] τέκτων téktōn - from the base of G5098 (τιμωρία); an artificer (as producer of fabrics), i.e. (specially), a craftsman in wood; carpenter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3585.desc: [G3585] ξύλινος xýlinos - from G3586 (ξύλον); wooden; of wood [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4651.desc: [G4651] σκορπίος skorpíos - probably from an obsolete (perhaps strengthened from the base of G4649 (σκοπός) and meaning to pierce); a "scorpion" (from its sting); scorpion [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4358.desc: [G4358] προσορμίζω prosormízō - from G4314 (πρός) and a derivative of the same as G3730 (ὁρμή) (meaning to tie (anchor) or lull); to moor to, i.e. (by implication) land at; draw to the shore [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1104.desc: [G1104] γνησίως gnēsíōs - adverb from G1103 (γνήσιος); genuinely, i.e. really; naturally [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3485.desc: [G3485] ναός naós - from a primary (to dwell); a fane, shrine, temple ; shrine, temple [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4022.desc: [G4022] περιέρχομαι periérchomai - from G4012 (περί) and G2064 (ἔρχομαι) (including its alternate); to come all around, i.e. stroll, vacillate, veer; fetch a compass, vagabond, wandering about [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1241.desc: [G1241] διαζώννυμι diazṓnnymi - from G1223 (διά) and G2224 (ζώννυμι); to gird tightly; gird [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2735.desc: [G2735] κατόρθωμα katórthōma - from a compound of G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of G3717 (ὀρθός) (compare G1357 (διόρθωσις)); something made fully upright, i.e. (figuratively) rectification (specially, good public administration); very worthy deed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4157.desc: [G4157] πνοή pnoḗ - from G4154 (πνέω); respiration, a breeze; breath, wind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3942.desc: [G3942] παροιμία paroimía - from a compound of G3844 (παρά) and perhaps a derivative of G3633 (οἴομαι); apparently a state alongside of supposition, i.e. (concretely) an adage; specially, an enigmatical or fictitious illustration; parable, proverb [BLB] [BibleHub]

G387.desc: [G387] ἀναστατόω anastatóō - from a derivative of G450 (ἀνίστημι) (in the sense of removal); properly, to drive out of home, i.e. (by implication) to disturb (literally or figuratively); trouble, turn upside down, make an uproar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1030.desc: [G1030] βρυγμός brygmós - from G1031 (βρύχω); a grating (of the teeth); gnashing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1811.desc: [G1811] ἐξακολουθέω exakolouthéō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G190 (ἀκολουθέω); to follow out, i.e. (figuratively) to imitate, obey, yield to; follow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G834.desc: [G834] αὐλητής aulētḗs - from G832 (αὐλέω); a flute-player; minstrel, piper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4588.desc: [G4588] Σέργιος Sérgios - of Latin origin; Sergius, a Roman; Sergius [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5117.desc: [G5117] τόπος tópos - apparently a primary word; a spot (general in space, but limited by occupancy; whereas G5561 (χώρα) is a large but participle locality), i.e. location (as a position, home, tract, etc.); figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard; coast, licence, place, X plain, quarter, + rock, room, where [BLB] [BibleHub]

G73.desc: [G73] ἀγών agṓn - from G71 (ἄγω); properly, a place of assembly (as if led), i.e. (by implication) a contest (held there); figuratively, an effort or anxiety; conflict, contention, fight, race [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4696.desc: [G4696] σπίλος spílos - of uncertain derivation; a stain or blemish, i.e. (figuratively) defect, disgrace; spot [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4549.desc: [G4549] Σαούλ Saoúl - of Hebrew origin (H07586); Saul (i.e. Shaul), the Jewish name of Paul; Saul [BLB] [BibleHub]

G86.desc: [G86] ᾅδης háidēs - from G1 (Α) (as negative particle) and G1492 (εἴδω); properly, unseen, i.e. "Hades" or the place (state) of departed souls; grave, hell [BLB] [BibleHub]

G327.desc: [G327] ἀναζητέω anazētéō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G2212 (ζητέω); to search out; seek [BLB] [BibleHub]

G89.desc: [G89] ἀδιαλείπτως adialeíptōs - adverb from G88 (ἀδιάλειπτος); uninterruptedly, i.e. without omission (on an appropriate occasion); without ceasing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3588.desc: [G3588] ὁ ho - the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom); the, this, that, one, he, she, it, etc [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3840.desc: [G3840] πάντοθεν pántothen - adverb (of source) from G3956 (πᾶς); from (i.e. on) all sides; on every side, round about [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5319.desc: [G5319] φανερόω phaneróō - from G5318 (φανερός); to render apparent (literally or figuratively); appear, manifestly declare, (make) manifest (forth), shew (self) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2106.desc: [G2106] εὐδοκέω eudokéō - from G2095 (εὖ) and G1380 (δοκέω); to think well of, i.e. approve (an act); specially, to approbate (a person or thing); think good, (be well) please(-d), be the good (have, take) pleasure, be willing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2805.desc: [G2805] κλαυθμός klauthmós - from G2799 (κλαίω); lamentation; wailing, weeping, X wept [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4314.desc: [G4314] πρός prós - a strengthened form of G4253 (πρό); a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated); about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G260.desc: [G260] ἅμα háma - a primary particle; properly, at the "same" time, but freely used as a preposition or adverb denoting close association; also, and, together, with(-al) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5266.desc: [G5266] ὑπόδημα hypódēma - from G5265 (ὑποδέω); something bound under the feet, i.e. a shoe or sandal; shoe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1842.desc: [G1842] ἐξολοθρεύω exolothreúō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G3645 (ὀλοθρεύω); to extirpate; destroy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1856.desc: [G1856] ἐξωθέω exōthéō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and (to push); to expel; by implication, to propel; drive out, thrust in [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1731.desc: [G1731] ἐνδείκνυμι endeíknymi - from G1722 (ἐν) and G1166 (δεικνύω); to indicate (by word or act); do, show (forth) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3593.desc: [G3593] ὁδεύω hodeúō - from G3598 (ὁδός); to travel; journey [BLB] [BibleHub]

G671.desc: [G671] ἀπόχρησις apóchrēsis - from a compound of G575 (ἀπό) and G5530 (χράομαι); the act of using up, i.e. consumption; using [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1966.desc: [G1966] ἐπιοῦσα epioûsa - feminine singular participle of a comparative of G1909 (ἐπί) and (to go); supervening, i.e. (G2250 (ἡμέρα) or G3571 (νύξ) being expressed or implied) the ensuing day or night; following, next [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4277.desc: [G4277] προέπω proépō - from G4253 (πρό) and G2036 (ἔπω); to say already, to predict; forewarn, say (speak, tell) before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G449.desc: [G449] ἄνιπτος ániptos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G3538 (νίπτω); without ablution; unwashen [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2411.desc: [G2411] ἱερόν hierón - neuter of G2413 (ἱερός); a sacred place, i.e. the entire precincts (whereas G3485 (ναός) denotes the central sanctuary itself) of the Temple (at Jerusalem or elsewhere); temple [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4817.desc: [G4817] συλλογίζομαι syllogízomai - from G4862 (σύν) and G3049 (λογίζομαι); to reckon together (with oneself), i.e. deliberate; reason with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G991.desc: [G991] βλέπω blépō - a primary verb; to look at (literally or figuratively); behold, beware, lie, look (on, to), perceive, regard, see, sight, take heed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G652.desc: [G652] ἀπόστολος apóstolos - from G649 (ἀποστέλλω); a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ ("apostle") (with miraculous powers); apostle, messenger, he that is sent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1878.desc: [G1878] ἐπαναμιμνήσκω epanamimnḗskō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G363 (ἀναμιμνήσκω); to remind of; put in mind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G432.desc: [G432] ἄνηθον ánēthon - probably of foreign origin; dill; anise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5332.desc: [G5332] φαρμακεύς pharmakeús - from (a drug, i.e. spell-giving potion); a druggist ("pharmacist") or poisoner, i.e. (by extension) a magician; sorcerer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G861.desc: [G861] ἀφθαρσία aphtharsía - from G862 (ἄφθαρτος); incorruptibility; genitive, unending existence; (figuratively) genuineness; immortality, incorruption, sincerity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G380.desc: [G380] ἀναπτύσσω anaptýssō - from G303 (ἀνά) (in the sense of reversal) and G4428 (πτύσσω); to unroll (a scroll or volume); open [BLB] [BibleHub]

G477.desc: [G477] ἀντίθεσις antíthesis - from a compound of G473 (ἀντί) and G5087 (τίθημι); opposition, i.e. a conflict (of theories); opposition [BLB] [BibleHub]

G156.desc: [G156] αἰτία aitía - from the same as G154 (αἰτέω); a cause (as if asked for), i.e. (logical) reason (motive, matter), (legal) crime (alleged or proved); accusation, case, cause, crime, fault, (wh-)ere(-fore) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G395.desc: [G395] ἀνατολή anatolḗ - from G393 (ἀνατέλλω); a rising of light, i.e. dawn (figuratively); by implication, the east (also in plural); dayspring, east, rising [BLB] [BibleHub]

G355.desc: [G355] ἀναλίσκω analískō - from G303 (ἀνά) and a form of the alternate of G138 (αἱρέομαι); properly, to use up, i.e. destroy; consume [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2799.desc: [G2799] κλαίω klaíō - of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. wail aloud (whereas 1145 is rather to cry silently); bewail, weep [BLB] [BibleHub]

G230.desc: [G230] ἀληθῶς alēthōs - adverb from G227 (ἀληθής); truly; indeed, surely, of a surety, truly, of a (in) truth, verily, very [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2476.desc: [G2476] ἵστημι hístēmi - a prolonged form of a primary (of the same meaning, and used for it in certain tenses); to stand (transitively or intransitively), used in various applications (literally or figuratively); abide, appoint, bring, continue, covenant, establish, hold up, lay, present, set (up), stanch, stand (by, forth, still, up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1616.desc: [G1616] ἐκτένεια ekténeia - from G1618 (ἐκτενής); intentness; X instantly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2800.desc: [G2800] κλάσις klásis - from G2806 (κλάω); fracture (the act); breaking [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1876.desc: [G1876] ἐπάναγκες epánankes - neuter of a presumed compound of G1909 (ἐπί) and G318 (ἀνάγκη); (adverbially) on necessity, i.e. necessarily; necessary [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1676.desc: [G1676] Ἑλληνιστί Hellēnistí - adverb from the same as G1675 (Ἑλληνιστής); Hellenistically, i.e. in the Grecian language; Greek [BLB] [BibleHub]

G841.desc: [G841] αὐτάρκεια autárkeia - from G842 (αὐτάρκης); self-satisfaction, i.e. (abstractly) contentedness, or (concretely) a competence; contentment, sufficiency [BLB] [BibleHub]

G901.desc: [G901] βαθύς bathýs - from the base of G939 (βάσις); profound (as going down), literally or figuratively; deep, very early [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5484.desc: [G5484] χάριν chárin - accusative case of G5485 (χάρις) as preposition; through favor of, i.e. on account of; be-(for) cause of, for sake of, +…fore, X reproachfully [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4086.desc: [G4086] πιθανολογία pithanología - from a compound of a derivative of G3982 (πείθω) and G3056 (λόγος); persuasive language; enticing words [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2609.desc: [G2609] κατάγω katágō - from G2596 (κατά) and G71 (ἄγω); to lead down; specially, to moor a vessel; bring (down, forth), (bring to) land, touch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2407.desc: [G2407] ἱερατεύω hierateúō - prolongation from G2409 (ἱερεύς); to be a priest, i.e. perform his functions; execute the priest's office [BLB] [BibleHub]

G867.desc: [G867] ἄφιξις áphixis - from G864 (ἀφικνέομαι); properly, arrival, i.e. (by implication) departure; departing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3616.desc: [G3616] οἰκοδεσποτέω oikodespotéō - from G3617 (οἰκοδεσπότης); to be the head of (i.e. rule) a family; guide the house [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2785.desc: [G2785] κῆτος kētos - probably from the base of G5490 (χάσμα); a huge fish (as gaping for prey); whale [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1442.desc: [G1442] ἕβδομος hébdomos - ordinal from G2033 (ἑπτά); seventh; seventh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4950.desc: [G4950] σύρτις sýrtis - from G4951 (σύρω); a shoal (from the sand drawn thither by the waves), i.e. the Syrtis Major or great bay on the north coast of Africa; quicksands [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1083.desc: [G1083] γέννησις génnēsis - from G1080 (γεννάω); nativity; birth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2135.desc: [G2135] εὐνοῦχος eunoûchos - from (a bed) and G2192 (ἔχω); a castrated person (such being employed in Oriental bed-chambers); by extension an impotent or unmarried man; by implication, a chamberlain (state-officer); eunuch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G732.desc: [G732] ἄῤῥωστος árrhōstos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G4517 (ῥώννυμι); infirm; sick (folk, -ly) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3482.desc: [G3482] Ναθαναήλ Nathanaḗl - of Hebrew origin (H05417); Nathanaël (i.e. Nathanel), an Israelite and Christian; Nathanael [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4146.desc: [G4146] πλουσίως plousíōs - adverb from G4145 (πλούσιος); copiously; abundantly, richly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4.desc: [G4] ἀβαρής abarḗs - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G922 (βάρος); weightless, i.e. (figuratively) not burdensome; from being burdensome [BLB] [BibleHub]

G887.desc: [G887] ἀχλύς achlýs - of uncertain derivation; dimness of sight, i.e. (probably) a cataract; mist [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4256.desc: [G4256] προαιτιάομαι proaitiáomai - from G4253 (πρό) and a derivative of G156 (αἰτία); to accuse already, i.e. previously charge; prove before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1095.desc: [G1095] γηράσκω gēráskō - from G1094 (γῆρας); to be senescent; be (wax) old [BLB] [BibleHub]

G621.desc: [G621] ἀπολείχω apoleíchō - from G575 (ἀπό) and (to "lick"); to lick clean; lick [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1134.desc: [G1134] γυναικεῖος gynaikeîos - from G1135 (γυνή); feminine; wife [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4255.desc: [G4255] προαιρέομαι proairéomai - from G4253 (πρό) and G138 (αἱρέομαι); to choose for oneself before another thing (prefer), i.e. (by implication) to propose (intend); purpose [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1895.desc: [G1895] ἐπειδήπερ epeidḗper - from G1894 (ἐπειδή) and G4007 (περ); since indeed (of cause); forasmuch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1734.desc: [G1734] ἑνδέκατος hendékatos - ordinal from G1733 (ἕνδεκα); eleventh; eleventh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4116.desc: [G4116] πλατύς platýs - from G4111 (πλάσσω); spread out "flat" ("plot"), i.e. broad; wide [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4500.desc: [G4500] ῥοιζηδόν rhoizēdón - adverb from a derivative of (a whir); whizzingly, i.e. with a crash; with a great noise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5391.desc: [G5391] φιλόφρων philóphrōn - from G5384 (φίλος) and G5424 (φρήν); friendly of mind, i.e. kind; courteous [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3742.desc: [G3742] ὁσιότης hosiótēs - from G3741 (ὅσιος); piety; holiness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G64.desc: [G64] ἀγρεύω agreúō - from G61 (ἄγρα); to hunt, i.e. (figuratively) to entrap; catch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1695.desc: [G1695] Ἐμμαούς Emmaoús - probably of Hebrew origin (compare H03222); Emmaus, a place in Palestine; Emmaus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G209.desc: [G209] ἀκωλύτως akōlýtōs - adverb from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G2967 (κωλύω); in an unhindered manner, i.e. freely; no man forbidding him [BLB] [BibleHub]

G98.desc: [G98] Ἀδραμυττηνός Adramyttēnós - from (a place in Asia Minor); Adramyttene or belonging to Adramyttium; of Adramyttium [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1789.desc: [G1789] ἐντρέφω entréphō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G5142 (τρέφω); (figuratively) to educate; nourish up in [BLB] [BibleHub]

G659.desc: [G659] ἀποτίθημι apotíthēmi - from G575 (ἀπό) and G5087 (τίθημι); to put away (literally or figuratively); cast off, lay apart (aside, down), put away (off) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G9.desc: [G9] Ἀβιληνή Abilēnḗ - of foreign origin (compare H058); Abilene, a region of Syria; Abilene [BLB] [BibleHub]

G446.desc: [G446] ἀνθύπατος anthýpatos - from G473 (ἀντί) and a superlative of G5228 (ὑπέρ); instead of the highest officer, i.e. (specially) a Roman proconsul; deputy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1063.desc: [G1063] γάρ gár - a primary particle; properly, assigning a reason (used in argument, explanation or intensification; often with other particles); and, as, because (that), but, even, for, indeed, no doubt, seeing, then, therefore, verily, what, why, yet [BLB] [BibleHub]

G881.desc: [G881] Ἀχάζ Acház - of Hebrew origin (H0271); Achaz, an Israelite; Achaz [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1696.desc: [G1696] ἐμμένω emménō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G3306 (μένω); to stay in the same place, i.e. (figuratively) persevere; continue [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4471.desc: [G4471] Ῥαμᾶ Rhamâ - of Hebrew origin (H07414); Rama (i.e. Ramah), a place in Palestine; Rama [BLB] [BibleHub]

G847.desc: [G847] αὐτοῦ autoû - genitive (i.e. possessive) of G846 (αὐτός), used as an adverb of location; properly, belonging to the same spot, i.e. in this (or that) place; (t-)here [BLB] [BibleHub]

G196.desc: [G196] ἀκριβέστατος akribéstatos - superlative of (a derivative of the same as G206 (ἄκρον)); most exact; most straitest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2591.desc: [G2591] Κάρπος Kárpos - perhaps for G2590 (καρπός); Carpus, probably a Christian; Carpus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3869.desc: [G3869] παρακαθίζω parakathízō - from G3844 (παρά) and G2523 (καθίζω); to sit down near; sit [BLB] [BibleHub]

G875.desc: [G875] ἀφρίζω aphrízō - from G876 (ἀφρός); to froth at the mouth (in epilepsy); foam [BLB] [BibleHub]

G856.desc: [G856] ἀφεδρών aphedrṓn - from a compound of G575 (ἀπό) and the base of G1476 (ἑδραῖος); a place of sitting apart, i.e. a privy; draught [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1962.desc: [G1962] ἐπινεύω epineúō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3506 (νεύω); to nod at, i.e. (by implication) to assent; consent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4617.desc: [G4617] σινιάζω siniázō - from (a sieve); to riddle (figuratively); sift [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5107.desc: [G5107] τοιόσδε toiósde - (including the other inflections); from a derivative of 5104 and G1161 (δέ); such-like then, i.e. so great; such [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3080.desc: [G3080] λύσις lýsis - from G3089 (λύω); a loosening, i.e. (specially), divorce; to be loosed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4988.desc: [G4988] Σωσθένης Sōsthénēs - from the base of G4982 (σώζω) and that of G4599 (σθενόω); of safe strength; Sosthenes, a Christian; Sosthenes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1850.desc: [G1850] ἐξουσιάζω exousiázō - from G1849 (ἐξουσία); to control; exercise authority upon, bring under the (have) power of [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4731.desc: [G4731] στερεός stereós - from G2476 (ἵστημι); stiff, i.e. solid, stable (literally or figuratively); stedfast, strong, sure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2514.desc: [G2514] καθαρότης katharótēs - from G2513 (καθαρός); cleanness (ceremonially); purification [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5106.desc: [G5106] τοίνυν toínyn - from G5104 (τοί) and G3568 (νῦν); truly now, i.e. accordingly; then, therefore [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3888.desc: [G3888] παραμυθέομαι paramythéomai - from G3844 (παρά) and the middle voice of a derivative of G3454 (μῦθος); to relate near, i.e. (by implication) encourage, console; comfort [BLB] [BibleHub]

G173.desc: [G173] ἄκανθα ákantha - probably from the same as G188 (ἀκμήν); a thorn; thorn [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4707.desc: [G4707] σπουδαιότερος spoudaióteros - comparative of G4705 (σπουδαῖος); more prompt, more earnest; more diligent (forward) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5156.desc: [G5156] τρόμος trómos - from G5141 (τρέμω); a "trembling", i.e. quaking with fear; + tremble(-ing) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3558.desc: [G3558] νότος nótos - of uncertain affinity; the south(-west) wind; by extension, the southern quarter itself; south (wind) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1588.desc: [G1588] ἐκλεκτός eklektós - from G1586 (ἐκλέγομαι); select; by implication, favorite; chosen, elect [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4245.desc: [G4245] πρεσβύτερος presbýteros - comparative of (elderly); older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist (also figuratively, member of the celestial council) or Christian "presbyter"; elder(-est), old [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4710.desc: [G4710] σπουδή spoudḗ - from G4692 (σπεύδω); "speed", i.e. (by implication) despatch, eagerness, earnestness; business, (earnest) care(-fulness), diligence, forwardness, haste [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4591.desc: [G4591] σημαίνω sēmaínō - from (a mark; of uncertain derivation); to indicate; signify [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3557.desc: [G3557] νοσφίζομαι nosphízomai - middle voice from (apart or clandestinely); to sequestrate for oneself, i.e. embezzle; keep back, purloin [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5387.desc: [G5387] φιλόστοργος philóstorgos - from G5384 (φίλος) and (cherishing one's kindred, especially parents or children); fond of natural relatives, i.e. fraternal towards fellow Christian; kindly affectioned [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3764.desc: [G3764] οὐδέπω oudépō - from G3761 (οὐδέ) and G4452 (-πω); not even yet; as yet not, never before (yet), (not) yet [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1610.desc: [G1610] ἐκριζόω ekrizóō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G4492 (ῥιζόω); to uproot; pluck up by the root, root up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3547.desc: [G3547] νομοδιδάσκαλος nomodidáskalos - from G3551 (νόμος) and G1320 (διδάσκαλος); an expounder of the (Jewish) law, i.e. a Rabbi; doctor (teacher) of the law [BLB] [BibleHub]

G74.desc: [G74] ἀγωνία agōnía - from G73 (ἀγών); a struggle (properly, the state), i.e. (figuratively) anguish; agony [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4020.desc: [G4020] περιεργάζομαι periergázomai - from G4012 (περί) and G2038 (ἐργάζομαι); to work all around, i.e. bustle about (meddle); be a busybody [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3476.desc: [G3476] Ναασσών Naassṓn - of Hebrew origin (H05177); Naasson (i.e. Nachshon), an Israelite; Naasson [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4454.desc: [G4454] πῶλος pōlos - apparently a primary word; a "foal" or "filly", i.e. (specially), a young ass; colt [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1289.desc: [G1289] διασπείρω diaspeírō - from G1223 (διά) and G4687 (σπείρω); to sow throughout, i.e. (figuratively) distribute in foreign lands; scatter abroad [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1406.desc: [G1406] δραχμή drachmḗ - from G1405 (δράσσομαι); a drachma or (silver) coin (as handled); piece (of silver) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4310.desc: [G4310] προπάσχω propáschō - from G4253 (πρό) and G3958 (πάσχω); to undergo hardship previously; suffer before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2945.desc: [G2945] κύκλῳ kýklōi - as if dative case of (a ring, "cycle"; akin to G2947 (κυλιόω)); i.e. in a circle (by implication, of G1722 (ἐν)), i.e. (adverbially) all around; round about [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3813.desc: [G3813] παιδίον paidíon - neuter diminutive of G3816 (παῖς); a childling (of either sex), i.e. (properly), an infant, or (by extension) a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian; (little, young) child, damsel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3934.desc: [G3934] Πάρθος Párthos - probably of foreign origin; a Parthian, i.e. inhabitant of Parthia; Parthian [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4356.desc: [G4356] πρόσληψις próslēpsis - from G4355 (προσλαμβάνω); admission; receiving [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5294.desc: [G5294] ὑποτίθημι hypotíthēmi - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G5087 (τίθημι); to place underneath, i.e. (figuratively) to hazard, (reflexively) to suggest; lay down, put in remembrance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3022.desc: [G3022] λευκός leukós - from ("light"); white; white [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5339.desc: [G5339] φείδομαι pheídomai - of uncertain affinity; to be chary of, i.e. (subjectively) to abstain or (objectively) to treat leniently; forbear, spare [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4478.desc: [G4478] Ῥαχήλ Rhachḗl - of Hebrew origin (H07354); Rachel, the wife of Jacob; Rachel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1808.desc: [G1808] ἐξαίρω exaírō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G142 (αἴρω); to remove; put (take) away [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4225.desc: [G4225] πού poú - genitive case of an indefinite pronoun (some) otherwise obsolete (compare G4214 (πόσος)); as adverb of place, somewhere, i.e. nearly; about, a certain place [BLB] [BibleHub]

G495.desc: [G495] ἀντιπέραν antipéran - from G473 (ἀντί) and G4008 (πέραν); on the opposite side; over against [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3483.desc: [G3483] ναί naí - a primary particle of strong affirmation; yes; even so, surely, truth, verily, yea, yes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2088.desc: [G2088] ἑτέρως hetérōs - adverb from G2087 (ἕτερος); differently; otherwise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2257.desc: [G2257] ἡμῶν hēmōn - genitive case plural of G1473 (ἐγώ); of (or from) us; our (company), us, we [BLB] [BibleHub]

G351.desc: [G351] ἀνάκρισις anákrisis - from G350 (ἀνακρίνω); a (judicial) investigation; examination [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3683.desc: [G3683] Ὀνησίφορος Onēsíphoros - from a derivative of G3685 (ὀνίνημι) and G5411 (φόρος); profit-bearer; Onesiphorus, a Christian; Onespiphorus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G742.desc: [G742] Ἀρφαξάδ Arphaxád - of Hebrew origin (H0775); Arphaxad, a post-diluvian patriarch; Arphaxad [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4034.desc: [G4034] περιλάμπω perilámpō - from G4012 (περί) and G2989 (λάμπω); to illuminate all around, i.e. invest with a halo; shine round about [BLB] [BibleHub]

G213.desc: [G213] ἀλαζών alazṓn - from (vagrancy); braggart; boaster [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1472.desc: [G1472] ἐγχρίω enchríō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G5548 (χρίω); to rub in (oil), i.e. besmear; anoint [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2652.desc: [G2652] κατανάθεμα katanáthema - from G2596 (κατά) (intensive) and G331 (ἀνάθεμα); an imprecation; curse [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4394.desc: [G4394] προφητεία prophēteía - from G4396 (προφήτης) ("prophecy"); prediction (scriptural or other); prophecy, prophesying [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2036.desc: [G2036] ἔπω épō - a primary verb (used only in the definite past tense, the others being borrowed from G2046 (ἐρέω), G4483 (ῥέω), and G5346 (φημί)); to speak or say (by word or writing); answer, bid, bring word, call, command, grant, say (on), speak, tell [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4222.desc: [G4222] ποτίζω potízō - from a derivative of the alternate of G4095 (πίνω); to furnish drink, irrigate; give (make) to drink, feed, water [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1473.desc: [G1473] ἐγώ egṓ - a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic) ; I, me [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5299.desc: [G5299] ὑπωπιάζω hypōpiázō - from a compound of G5259 (ὑπό) and a derivative of G3700 (ὀπτάνομαι); to hit under the eye (buffet or disable an antagonist as a pugilist), i.e. (figuratively) to tease or annoy (into compliance), subdue (one's passions); keep under, weary [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2896.desc: [G2896] κράζω krázō - a primary verb; properly, to "croak" (as a raven) or scream, i.e. (genitive case) to call aloud (shriek, exclaim, intreat); cry (out) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2376.desc: [G2376] θυρίς thyrís - from G2374 (θύρα); an aperture, i.e. window; window [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2894.desc: [G2894] κόφινος kóphinos - of uncertain derivation; a (small) basket; basket [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5452.desc: [G5452] φυτεύω phyteúō - from a derivative of G5453 (φύω); to set out in the earth, i.e. implant; figuratively, to instil doctrine; plant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5142.desc: [G5142] τρέφω tréphō - a primary verb (properly, ; but perhaps strengthened from the base of G5157 (τροπή) through the idea of convolution); properly, to stiffen, i.e. fatten (by implication, to cherish (with food, etc.), pamper, rear); bring up, feed, nourish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2140.desc: [G2140] εὐποιΐα eupoiḯa - from a compound of G2095 (εὖ) and G4160 (ποιέω); well-doing, i.e. beneficence; to do good [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4592.desc: [G4592] σημεῖον sēmeîon - neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of G4591 (σημαίνω); an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally; miracle, sign, token, wonder [BLB] [BibleHub]

G634.desc: [G634] ἀποπίπτω apopíptō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G4098 (πίπτω); to fall off; fall [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4390.desc: [G4390] προτρέχω protréchō - from G4253 (πρό) and G5143 (τρέχω) (including its alternate); to run forward, i.e. outstrip, precede; outrun, run before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4172.desc: [G4172] πόλις pólis - probably from the same as G4171 (πόλεμος), or perhaps from G4183 (πολύς); a town (properly, with walls, of greater or less size); city [BLB] [BibleHub]

G134.desc: [G134] αἰνέω ainéō - from G136 (αἶνος); to praise (God); praise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1152.desc: [G1152] Δάμαρις Dámaris - probably from the base of G1150 (δαμάζω); perhaps gentle; Damaris, an Athenian woman; Damaris [BLB] [BibleHub]

G160.desc: [G160] αἰφνίδιος aiphnídios - from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5316 (φαίνω) (compare G1810 (ἐξαίφνης)) (meaning non-apparent); unexpected, i.e. (adverbially) suddenly; sudden, unawares [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1414.desc: [G1414] δυνατέω dynatéō - from G1415 (δυνατός); to be efficient (figuratively); be mighty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2032.desc: [G2032] ἐπουράνιος epouránios - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3772 (οὐρανός); above the sky; celestial, (in) heaven(-ly), high [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3688.desc: [G3688] ὄνος ónos - apparently a primary word; a donkey; an ass [BLB] [BibleHub]

G353.desc: [G353] ἀναλαμβάνω analambánō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G2983 (λαμβάνω); to take up; receive up, take (in, unto, up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3654.desc: [G3654] ὅλως hólōs - adverb from G3650 (ὅλος); completely, i.e. altogether; (by analogy), everywhere; (negatively) not by any means; at all, commonly, utterly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1420.desc: [G1420] δυσεντερία dysentería - from G1418 (δυσ-) and a comparative of G1787 (ἐντός) (meaning a bowel); a "dysentery"; bloody flux [BLB] [BibleHub]

G777.desc: [G777] ἄσιτος ásitos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G4621 (σῖτος); without (taking) food; fasting [BLB] [BibleHub]

G563.desc: [G563] ἀπερισπάστως aperispástōs - adverb from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a negative participle) and a presumed derivative of G4049 (περισπάω); undistractedly, i.e. free from (domestic) solicitude; without distraction [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1173.desc: [G1173] δεῖπνον deîpnon - from the same as G1160 (δαπάνη); dinner, i.e. the chief meal (usually in the evening); feast, supper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2706.desc: [G2706] καταφρονέω kataphronéō - from G2596 (κατά) and G5426 (φρονέω); to think against, i.e. disesteem; despise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G896.desc: [G896] Βάαλ Báal - of Hebrew origin (H01168); Baal, a Phœnician deity (used as a symbol of idolatry); Baal [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5168.desc: [G5168] τρυμαλιά trymaliá - from a derivative of (to wear away; akin to the base of G5134 (τραῦμα), G5147 (τρίβος) and G5176 (τρώγω)); an orifice, i.e. needle's eye; eye [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1395.desc: [G1395] δότης dótēs - from the base of G1325 (δίδωμι); a giver; giver [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5101.desc: [G5101] τίς tís - probably emphatic of G5100 (τὶς); an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what (in direct or indirect questions); every man, how (much), + no(-ne, thing), what (manner, thing), where (-by, -fore, -of, -unto, - with, -withal), whether, which, who(-m, -se), why [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2392.desc: [G2392] ἴασις íasis - from G2390 (ἰάομαι); curing (the act); cure, heal(-ing) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G505.desc: [G505] ἀνυπόκριτος anypókritos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G5271 (ὑποκρίνομαι); undissembled, i.e. sincere; without dissimulation (hypocrisy), unfeigned [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3646.desc: [G3646] ὁλοκαύτωμα holokaútōma - from a derivative of a compound of G3650 (ὅλος) and a derivative of G2545 (καίω); a wholly-consumed sacrifice ("holocaust"); (whole) burnt offering [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3946.desc: [G3946] παρόμοιος parómoios - from G3844 (παρά) and G3664 (ὅμοιος); alike nearly, i.e. similar; like [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5348.desc: [G5348] φθάνω phthánō - apparently a primary verb; to be beforehand, i.e. anticipate or precede; by extension, to have arrived at; (already) attain, come, prevent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2436.desc: [G2436] ἵλεως híleōs - perhaps from the alternate form of G138 (αἱρέομαι); cheerful (as attractive), i.e. propitious; adverbially (by Hebraism) God be gracious!, i.e. (in averting some calamity) far be it; be it far, merciful [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4958.desc: [G4958] συστέλλω systéllō - from G4862 (σύν) and G4724 (στέλλω); to send (draw) together, i.e. enwrap (enshroud a corpse for burial), contract (an interval); short, wind up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3385.desc: [G3385] μήτι mḗti - from G3361 (μή) and the neuter of G5100 (τὶς); whether at all; not (the particle usually not expressed, except by the form of the question) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1986.desc: [G1986] ἐπισπάομαι epispáomai - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G4685 (σπάω); to draw over, i.e. (with G203 (ἀκροβυστία) implied) efface the mark of circumcision (by recovering with the foreskin); become uncircumcised [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2528.desc: [G2528] καθοπλίζω kathoplízō - from G2596 (κατά); and G3695 (ὁπλίζω); to equip fully with armor; arm [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1151.desc: [G1151] δάμαλις dámalis - probably from the base of G1150 (δαμάζω); a heifer (as tame); heifer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G49.desc: [G49] ἁγνισμός hagnismós - from G48 (ἁγνίζω); a cleansing (the act), i.e. (ceremonially) lustration; purification [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2503.desc: [G2503] ἰῶτα iōta - of Hebrew origin (the tenth letter of the Hebrew alphabet); "iota", the name of the eighth letter of the Greek alphabet, put (figuratively) for a very small part of anything; jot [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3864.desc: [G3864] παραθαλάσσιος parathalássios - from G3844 (παρά) and G2281 (θάλασσα); along the sea, i.e. maritime (lacustrine); upon the sea coast [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2987.desc: [G2987] λαμπρότης lamprótēs - from G2986 (λαμπρός); brilliancy; brightness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G347.desc: [G347] ἀνακλίνω anaklínō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G2827 (κλίνω); to lean back; lay, (make) sit down [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3454.desc: [G3454] μῦθος mŷthos - perhaps from the same as G3453 (μυέω) (through the idea of tuition); a tale, i.e. fiction ("myth"); fable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G556.desc: [G556] ἀπελαύνω apelaúnō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G1643 (ἐλαύνω); to dismiss; drive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2187.desc: [G2187] Ἐφραίμ Ephraím - of Hebrew origin (H0669 or better H06085); Ephraim, a place in Palestine; Ephraim [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2678.desc: [G2678] κατασείω kataseíō - from G2596 (κατά) and G4579 (σείω); to sway downward, i.e. make a signal; beckon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1496.desc: [G1496] εἰδωλολάτρης eidōlolátrēs - from G1497 (εἴδωλον) and the base of G3000 (λατρεύω); an image- (servant or) worshipper (literally or figuratively); idolater [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2075.desc: [G2075] ἐστέ esté - second person plural present indicative of G1510 (εἰμί); ye are; be, have been, belong [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4119.desc: [G4119] πλείων pleíōn - comparative of G4183 (πολύς); more in quantity, number, or quality; also (in plural) the major portion; X above, + exceed, more excellent, further, (very) great(-er), long(-er), (very) many, greater (more) part, + yet but [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5305.desc: [G5305] ὕστερον hýsteron - neuter of G5306 (ὕστερος) as adverb; more lately, i.e. eventually; afterward, (at the) last (of all) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5409.desc: [G5409] φορέω phoréō - from G5411 (φόρος); to have a burden, i.e. (by analogy) to wear as clothing or a constant accompaniment; bear, wear [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2004.desc: [G2004] ἐπιτάσσω epitássō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G5021 (τάσσω); to arrange upon, i.e. order; charge, command, injoin [BLB] [BibleHub]

G137.desc: [G137] Αἰνών Ainṓn - of Hebrew origin (a derivative of G5869, place of springs); Ænon, a place in Palestine; Ænon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3344.desc: [G3344] μεταστρέφω metastréphō - from G3326 (μετά) and G4762 (στρέφω); to turn across, i.e. transmute or (figuratively) corrupt; pervert, turn [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1238.desc: [G1238] διάδημα diádēma - from a compound of G1223 (διά) and G1210 (δέω); a "diadem" (as bound about the head); crown [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3594.desc: [G3594] ὁδηγέω hodēgéō - from G3595 (ὁδηγός); to show the way (literally or figuratively (teach)); guide, lead [BLB] [BibleHub]

G986.desc: [G986] Βλάστος Blástos - perhaps the same as the base of G985 (βλαστάνω); Blastus, an officer of Herod Agrippa; Blastus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2648.desc: [G2648] καταμανθάνω katamanthánō - from G2596 (κατά) and G3129 (μανθάνω); to learn thoroughly, i.e. (by implication) to note carefully; consider [BLB] [BibleHub]

G270.desc: [G270] ἀμάω amáō - from G260 (ἅμα); properly, to collect, i.e. (by implication) reap; reap down [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4554.desc: [G4554] Σάρδεις Sárdeis - plural of uncertain derivation; Sardis, a place in Asia Minor; Sardis [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5393.desc: [G5393] Φλέγων Phlégōn - active participle of the base of G5395 (φλόξ); blazing; Phlegon, a Christian; Phlegon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5558.desc: [G5558] χρυσόω chrysóō - from G5557 (χρυσός); to gild, i.e. bespangle with golden ornaments; deck [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5244.desc: [G5244] ὑπερήφανος hyperḗphanos - from G5228 (ὑπέρ) and G5316 (φαίνω); appearing above others (conspicuous), i.e. (figuratively) haughty; proud [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5180.desc: [G5180] τύπτω týptō - a primary verb (in a strengthened form); to "thump", i.e. cudgel or pummel (properly, with a stick or bastinado), but in any case by repeated blows; thus differing from G3817 (παίω) and G3960 (πατάσσω), which denote a (usually single) blow with the hand or any instrument, or G4141 (πλήσσω) with the fist (or a hammer), or G4474 (ῥαπίζω) with the palm; as well as from G5177 (τυγχάνω), an accidental collision); by implication, to punish; figuratively, to offend (the conscience); beat, smite, strike, wound [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1327.desc: [G1327] διέξοδος diéxodos - from G1223 (διά) and G1841 (ἔξοδος); an outlet through, i.e. probably an open square (from which roads diverge); highway [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3311.desc: [G3311] μερισμός merismós - from G3307 (μερίζω); a separation or distribution; dividing asunder, gift [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3070.desc: [G3070] Λυδία Lydía - properly, feminine of Ludios (of foreign origin) (a Lydian, in Asia Minor); Lydia, a Christian woman; Lydia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3507.desc: [G3507] νεφέλη nephélē - from G3509 (νέφος); properly, cloudiness, i.e. (concretely) a cloud; cloud [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1672.desc: [G1672] Ἕλλην Héllēn - from G1671 (Ἑλλάς); a Hellen (Grecian) or inhabitant of Hellas; by extension a Greek-speaking person, especially a non-Jew; Gentile, Greek [BLB] [BibleHub]

G913.desc: [G913] Βαράκ Barák - of Hebrew origin (H01301); Barak, an Israelite; Barak [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5522.desc: [G5522] χόος chóos - from the base of G5494 (χειμών); a heap (as poured out), i.e. rubbish; loose dirt; dust [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1771.desc: [G1771] ἔννοια énnoia - from a compound of G1722 (ἐν) and G3563 (νοῦς); thoughtfulness, i.e. moral understanding; intent, mind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2655.desc: [G2655] καταναρκάω katanarkáō - from G2596 (κατά) and (to be numb); to grow utterly torpid, i.e. (by implication) slothful (figuratively, expensive); be burdensome (chargeable) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2524.desc: [G2524] καθίημι kathíēmi - from G2596 (κατά); and (to send); to lower; let down [BLB] [BibleHub]

G980.desc: [G980] βιόω bióō - from G979 (βίος); to spend existence; live [BLB] [BibleHub]
