G2354.desc: [G2354] θρηνέω thrēnéō - from G2355 (θρῆνος); to bewail; lament, mourn [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1363.desc: [G1363] διπλόω diplóō - from G1362 (διπλοῦς); to render two-fold; double [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3390.desc: [G3390] μητρόπολις mētrópolis - from G3384 (μήτηρ) and G4172 (πόλις); a mother city, i.e. "metropolis"; chiefest city [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5385.desc: [G5385] φιλοσοφία philosophía - from G5386 (φιλόσοφος); "philosophy", i.e. (specially), Jewish sophistry; philosophy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1127.desc: [G1127] γρηγορεύω grēgoreúō - from G1453 (ἐγείρω); to keep awake, i.e. watch (literally or figuratively); be vigilant, wake, (be) watch(-ful) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3994.desc: [G3994] πενθερά pentherá - feminine of G3995 (πενθερός); a wife's mother; mother in law, wife's mother [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5179.desc: [G5179] τύπος týpos - from G5180 (τύπτω); a die (as struck), i.e. (by implication) a stamp or scar; by analogy, a shape, i.e. a statue, (figuratively) style or resemblance; specially, a sampler ("type"), i.e. a model (for imitation) or instance (for warning); en-(ex-)ample, fashion, figure, form, manner, pattern, print [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3164.desc: [G3164] μάχομαι máchomai - middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to war, i.e. (figuratively) to quarrel, dispute; fight, strive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4769.desc: [G4769] στῦλος stŷlos - from (to stiffen; properly akin to the base of G2476 (ἵστημι)); a post ("style"), i.e. (figuratively) support; pillar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3168.desc: [G3168] μεγαλειότης megaleiótēs - from G3167 (μεγαλεῖος); superbness, i.e. glory or splendor; magnificence, majesty, mighty power [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5310.desc: [G5310] ὕψιστος hýpsistos - superlative from the base of G5311 (ὕψος); highest, i.e. (masculine singular) the Supreme (God), or (neuter plural) the heavens; most high, highest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2920.desc: [G2920] κρίσις krísis - decision (subjectively or objectively, for or against); by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice (especially, divine law); accusation, condemnation, damnation, judgment [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1029.desc: [G1029] βρόχος bróchos - of uncertain derivation; a noose; snare [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1225.desc: [G1225] διαβάλλω diabállō - from G1223 (διά) and G906 (βάλλω); (figuratively) to traduce; accuse [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5498.desc: [G5498] χειρόγραφον cheirógraphon - neuter of a compound of G5495 (χείρ) and G1125 (γράφω); something hand-written ("chirograph"), i.e. a manuscript (specially, a legal document or bond (figuratively)); handwriting [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5030.desc: [G5030] ταχέως tachéōs - adverb from G5036 (ταχύς); briefly, i.e. (in time) speedily, or (in manner) rapidly; hastily, quickly, shortly, soon, suddenly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5343.desc: [G5343] φεύγω pheúgō - apparently a primary verb; to run away (literally or figuratively); by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish; escape, flee (away) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G954.desc: [G954] Βεελζεβούλ Beelzeboúl - of Chaldee origin (by parody on H01176); dung-god; Beelzebul, a name of Satan; Beelzebub [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1107.desc: [G1107] γνωρίζω gnōrízō - from a derivative of G1097 (γινώσκω); to make known; subjectively, to know; certify, declare, make known, give to understand, do to wit, wot [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3904.desc: [G3904] παρασκευή paraskeuḗ - as if from G3903 (παρασκευάζω); readiness; preparation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4050.desc: [G4050] περισσεία perisseía - from G4052 (περισσεύω); surplusage, i.e. superabundance; abundance(-ant, (-ly)), superfluity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4773.desc: [G4773] συγγενής syngenḗs - from G4862 (σύν) and G1085 (γένος); a relative (by blood); by extension, a fellow countryman; cousin, kin(-sfolk, -sman) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G985.desc: [G985] βλαστάνω blastánō - from (a sprout); to germinate; by implication, to yield fruit; bring forth, bud, spring (up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5376.desc: [G5376] Φίλιππος Phílippos - from G5384 (φίλος) and G2462 (ἵππος); fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites; Philip [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4335.desc: [G4335] προσευχή proseuchḗ - from G4336 (προσεύχομαι); prayer (worship); by implication, an oratory (chapel); X pray earnestly, prayer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2098.desc: [G2098] εὐαγγέλιον euangélion - from the same as G2097 (εὐαγγελίζω); a good message, i.e. the gospel; gospel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1323.desc: [G1323] δίδραχμον dídrachmon - from G1364 (δίς) and G1406 (δραχμή); a double drachma (didrachm); tribute [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4268.desc: [G4268] πρόγνωσις prógnōsis - from G4267 (προγινώσκω); forethought; foreknowledge [BLB] [BibleHub]

G245.desc: [G245] ἀλλότριος allótrios - from G243 (ἄλλος); another's, i.e. not one's own; by extension foreign, not akin, hostile; alien, (an-)other (man's, men's), strange(-r) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3356.desc: [G3356] μετριοπαθέω metriopathéō - from a compound of the base of G3357 (μετρίως) and G3806 (πάθος); to be moderate in passion, i.e. gentle (to treat indulgently); have compassion [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1897.desc: [G1897] ἐπείπερ epeíper - from G1893 (ἐπεί) and G4007 (περ); since indeed (of cause); seeing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2229.desc: [G2229] ἦ ē - an adverb of confirmation; perhaps intensive of G2228 (ἤ); used only (in the New Testament) before G3303 (μέν); assuredly; surely [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2578.desc: [G2578] κάμπτω kámptō - apparently a primary verb; to bend; bow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2240.desc: [G2240] ἥκω hḗkō - a primary verb; to arrive, i.e. be present (literally or figuratively); come [BLB] [BibleHub]

G242.desc: [G242] ἅλλομαι hállomai - middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to jump; figuratively, to gush; leap, spring up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G307.desc: [G307] ἀναβιβάζω anabibázō - from G303 (ἀνά) and a derivative of the base of G939 (βάσις); to cause to go up, i.e. haul (a net); draw [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3944.desc: [G3944] παροίχομαι paroíchomai - from G3844 (παρά) and (to depart); to escape along, i.e. be gone; past [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5054.desc: [G5054] τελευτή teleutḗ - from G5053 (τελευτάω); decease; death [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4987.desc: [G4987] σωρεύω sōreúō - from another form of G4673 (σορός); to pile up (literally or figuratively); heap, load [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4000.desc: [G4000] πεντακισχίλιοι pentakischílioi - from G3999 (πεντάκις) and G5507 (χίλιοι); five times a thousand; five thousand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1055.desc: [G1055] γαλήνη galḗnē - of uncertain derivation; tranquillity; calm [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2882.desc: [G2882] Κόρινθος Kórinthos - of uncertain derivation; Corinthus, a city of Greece; Corinth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4177.desc: [G4177] πολίτης polítēs - from G4172 (πόλις); a townsman; citizen [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5207.desc: [G5207] υἱός huiós - apparently a primary word; a "son" (sometimes of animals), used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship; child, foal, son [BLB] [BibleHub]

G953.desc: [G953] βεβηλόω bebēlóō - from G952 (βέβηλος); to desecrate; profane [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2700.desc: [G2700] κατατοξεύω katatoxeúō - from G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of G5115 (τόξον); to shoot down with an arrow or other missile; thrust through [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4928.desc: [G4928] συνοχή synochḗ - from G4912 (συνέχω); restraint, i.e. (figuratively) anxiety; anguish, distress [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1210.desc: [G1210] δέω déō - a primary verb; to bind (in various applications, literally or figuratively); bind, be in bonds, knit, tie, wind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G618.desc: [G618] ἀπολαμβάνω apolambánō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G2983 (λαμβάνω); to receive (specially, in full, or as a host); also to take aside; receive, take [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3193.desc: [G3193] μελίσσιος melíssios - from G3192 (μέλι); relating to honey, i.e. bee (comb); honeycomb [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3996.desc: [G3996] πενθέω penthéō - from G3997 (πένθος); to grieve (the feeling or the act); mourn, (be-)wail [BLB] [BibleHub]

G463.desc: [G463] ἀνοχή anochḗ - from G430 (ἀνέχομαι); self-restraint, i.e. tolerance; forbearance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1663.desc: [G1663] Ἐλιέζερ Eliézer - of Hebrew origin (H0461); Eliezer, an Israelite; Eliezer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4788.desc: [G4788] συγκλείω synkleíō - from G4862 (σύν) and G2808 (κλείω); to shut together, i.e. include or (figuratively) embrace in a common subjection to; conclude, inclose, shut up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G203.desc: [G203] ἀκροβυστία akrobystía - from G206 (ἄκρον) and probably a modified form of (the penis or male sexual organ); the prepuce; by implication, an uncircumcised (i.e. gentile, figuratively, unregenerate) state or person; not circumcised, uncircumcised (with G2192 (ἔχω)), uncircumcision [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3995.desc: [G3995] πενθερός pentherós - of uncertain affinity; a wife's father; father in law [BLB] [BibleHub]

G120.desc: [G120] ἀθυμέω athyméō - from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2372 (θυμός); to be spiritless, i.e. disheartened; be dismayed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4667.desc: [G4667] Σμύρνα Smýrna - the same as G4666 (σμύρνα); Smyrna, a place in Asia Minor; Smyrna [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4323.desc: [G4323] προσανατίθημι prosanatíthēmi - from G4314 (πρός) and G394 (ἀνατίθεμαι); to lay up in addition, i.e. (middle voice and figuratively) to impart or (by implication) to consult; in conference add, confer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4951.desc: [G4951] σύρω sýrō - probably akin to G138 (αἱρέομαι); to trail; drag, draw, hale [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2584.desc: [G2584] Καπερναούμ Kapernaoúm - of Hebrew origin (probably H03723 and H05151); Capernaum (i.e. Caphanachum), a place in Palestine; Capernaum [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3066.desc: [G3066] Λούκιος Loúkios - of Latin origin; illuminative; Lucius, a Christian; Lucius [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5499.desc: [G5499] χειροποίητος cheiropoíētos - from G5495 (χείρ) and a derivative of G4160 (ποιέω); manufactured, i.e. of human construction; made by (make with) hands [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1661.desc: [G1661] ἐλεφάντινος elephántinos - from (an "elephant"); elephantine, i.e. (by implication) composed of ivory; of ivory [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5049.desc: [G5049] τελείως teleíōs - adverb from G5046 (τέλειος); completely, i.e. (of hope) without wavering; to the end [BLB] [BibleHub]

G763.desc: [G763] ἀσέβεια asébeia - from G765 (ἀσεβής); impiety, i.e. (by implication) wickedness; ungodly(-liness) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G172.desc: [G172] ἄκακος ákakos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2556 (κακός); not bad, i.e. (objectively) innocent or (subjectively) unsuspecting; harmless, simple [BLB] [BibleHub]

G970.desc: [G970] βία bía - probably akin to G979 (βίος) (through the idea of vital activity); force; violence [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2190.desc: [G2190] ἐχθρός echthrós - from a primary (to hate); hateful (passively, odious, or actively, hostile); usually as a noun, an adversary (especially Satan); enemy, foe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2405.desc: [G2405] ἱερατεία hierateía - from G2407 (ἱερατεύω); priestliness, i.e. the sacerdotal function; office of the priesthood, priest's office [BLB] [BibleHub]

G722.desc: [G722] ἀροτριόω arotrióō - from G723 (ἄροτρον); to plow; plough [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1776.desc: [G1776] ἐνοχλέω enochléō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G3791 (ὀχλέω); to crowd in, i.e. (figuratively) to annoy; trouble [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1700.desc: [G1700] ἐμοῦ emoû - a prolonged form of G3449 (μόχθος); of me; me, mine, my [BLB] [BibleHub]

G687.desc: [G687] ἆρα âra - a form of G686 (ἄρα), denoting an interrogation to which a negative answer is presumed ; therefore [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2764.desc: [G2764] κεραμικός keramikós - from G2766 (κέραμος); made of clay, i.e. earthen; of a potter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G860.desc: [G860] ἁφή haphḗ - from G680 (ἅπτομαι); probably a ligament (as fastening); joint [BLB] [BibleHub]

G311.desc: [G311] ἀναβολή anabolḗ - from G306 (ἀναβάλλομαι); a putting off; delay [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4835.desc: [G4835] συμπαθής sympathḗs - from G4841 (συμπάσχω); having a fellow-feeling ("sympathetic"), i.e. (by implication) mutually commiserative; having compassion one of another [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3422.desc: [G3422] μνημόσυνον mnēmósynon - from G3421 (μνημονεύω); a reminder (memorandum), i.e. record; memorial [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5067.desc: [G5067] τέταρτος tétartos - ordinal from G5064 (τέσσαρες); fourth; four(-th) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G410.desc: [G410] ἀνέγκλητος anénklētos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G1458 (ἐγκαλέω); unaccused, i.e. (by implication) irreproachable; blameless [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4679.desc: [G4679] σοφίζω sophízō - from G4680 (σοφός); to render wise; in a sinister acceptation, to form "sophisms", i.e. continue plausible error; cunningly devised, make wise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1149.desc: [G1149] Δαλματία Dalmatía - probably of foreign derivation; Dalmatia, a region of Europe; Dalmatia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3787.desc: [G3787] ὀφθαλμοδουλεία ophthalmodouleía - from G3788 (ὀφθαλμός) and G1397 (δουλεία); sight-labor, i.e. that needs watching (remissness); eye-service [BLB] [BibleHub]

G202.desc: [G202] ἀκροατής akroatḗs - from (to listen; apparently an intensive of G191 (ἀκούω)); a hearer (merely); hearer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5516.desc: [G5516] χξϛ chx stigma - the 22nd, 14th and an obsolete letter (G4742 (στίγμα) as a cross) of the Greek alphabet (intermediate between the 5th and 6th), used as numbers; denoting respectively 600, 60 and 6; 666 as a numeral; six hundred threescore and six [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2080.desc: [G2080] ἔσω ésō - from G1519 (εἰς); inside (as preposition or adjective); (with-)in(-ner, -to, -ward) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5328.desc: [G5328] Φαραώ Pharaṓ - of foreign origin (H06547); Pharao (i.e. Pharoh), an Egyptian king; Pharaoh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4822.desc: [G4822] συμβιβάζω symbibázō - from G4862 (σύν) and (to force; causative (by reduplication) of the base of G939 (βάσις)); to drive together, i.e. unite (in association or affection), (mentally) to infer, show, teach; compact, assuredly gather, intrust, knit together, prove [BLB] [BibleHub]

G987.desc: [G987] βλασφημέω blasphēméō - from G989 (βλάσφημος); to vilify; specially, to speak impiously; (speak) blaspheme(-er, -mously, -my), defame, rail on, revile, speak evil [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5287.desc: [G5287] ὑπόστασις hypóstasis - from a compound of G5259 (ὑπό) and G2476 (ἵστημι); a setting under (support), i.e. (figuratively) concretely, essence, or abstractly, assurance (objectively or subjectively); confidence, confident, person, substance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4681.desc: [G4681] Σπανία Spanía - probably of foreign origin; Spania, a region of Europe; Spain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5197.desc: [G5197] ὑβριστής hybristḗs - from G5195 (ὑβρίζω); an insulter, i.e. maltreater; despiteful, injurious [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1804.desc: [G1804] ἐξαγγέλλω exangéllō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and the base of G32 (ἄγγελος); to publish, i.e. celebrate; shew forth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G439.desc: [G439] ἀνθρακιά anthrakiá - from G440 (ἄνθραξ); a bed of burning coals; fire of coals [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4249.desc: [G4249] πρίζω prízō - a strengthened form of a primary prio (to saw); to saw in two; saw asunder [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4197.desc: [G4197] πορεία poreía - from G4198 (πορεύομαι); travel (by land); figuratively (plural) proceedings, i.e. career; journey(-ing), ways [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4352.desc: [G4352] προσκυνέω proskynéō - from G4314 (πρός) and a probable derivative of G2965 (κύων) (meaning to kiss, like a dog licking his master's hand); to fawn or crouch to, i.e. (literally or figuratively) prostrate oneself in homage (do reverence to, adore); worship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G489.desc: [G489] ἀντιμισθία antimisthía - from a compound of G473 (ἀντί) and G3408 (μισθός); requital, correspondence; recompense [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1337.desc: [G1337] διθάλασσος dithálassos - from G1364 (δίς) and G2281 (θάλασσα); having two seas, i.e. a sound with a double outlet; where two seas meet [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1798.desc: [G1798] ἐνύπνιον enýpnion - from G1722 (ἐν) and G5258 (ὕπνος); something seen in sleep, i.e. a dream (vision in a dream); dream [BLB] [BibleHub]

G444.desc: [G444] ἄνθρωπος ánthrōpos - from G435 (ἀνήρ) and (the countenance; from G3700 (ὀπτάνομαι)); man-faced, i.e. a human being; certain, man [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4960.desc: [G4960] συστοιχέω systoichéō - from G4862 (σύν) and G4748 (στοιχέω); to file together (as soldiers in ranks), i.e. (figuratively) to correspond to; answer to [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3198.desc: [G3198] Μελχισεδέκ Melchisedék - of Hebrew origin (H04442); Melchisedek (i.e. Malkitsedek), a patriarch; Melchisedec [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2468.desc: [G2468] ἴσθι ísthi - second person imperative present of G1510 (εἰμί); be thou; + agree, be, X give thyself wholly to [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5141.desc: [G5141] τρέμω trémō - strengthened from a primary (to "dread", "terrify"); to "tremble" or fear; be afraid, trembling [BLB] [BibleHub]

G723.desc: [G723] ἄροτρον árotron - from (to till); a plow; plough [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5589.desc: [G5589] ψιχίον psichíon - diminutive from a derivative of the base of G5567 (ψάλλω) (meaning a crumb); a little bit or morsel; crumb [BLB] [BibleHub]

G383.desc: [G383] ἀνασείω anaseíō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G4579 (σείω); figuratively, to excite; move, stir up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4435.desc: [G4435] πυγμή pygmḗ - from a primary (the fist as a weapon); the clenched hand, i.e. (only in dative case as adverb) with the fist (hard scrubbing); oft [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1325.desc: [G1325] δίδωμι dídōmi - a prolonged form of a primary verb (which is used as an alternative in most of the tenses); to give (used in a very wide application, properly, or by implication, literally or figuratively; greatly modified by the connection); adventure, bestow, bring forth, commit, deliver (up), give, grant, hinder, make, minister, number, offer, have power, put, receive, set, shew, smite (+ with the hand), strike (+ with the palm of the hand), suffer, take, utter, yield [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5421.desc: [G5421] φρέαρ phréar - of uncertain derivation; a hole in the ground (dug for obtaining or holding water or other purposes), i.e. a cistern or well; figuratively, an abyss (as a prison); well, pit [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2104.desc: [G2104] εὐγενής eugenḗs - from G2095 (εὖ) and G1096 (γίνομαι); well born, i.e. (literally) high in rank, or (figuratively) generous; more noble, nobleman [BLB] [BibleHub]

G331.desc: [G331] ἀνάθεμα anáthema - from G394 (ἀνατίθεμαι); a (religious) ban or (concretely) excommunicated (thing or person); accused, anathema, curse, X great [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2786.desc: [G2786] Κηφᾶς Kēphâs - of Chaldee origin (compare H03710); the Rock; Cephas (i.e. Kepha), a surname of Peter; Cephas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G392.desc: [G392] ἀνατάσσομαι anatássomai - from G303 (ἀνά) and the middle voice of G5021 (τάσσω); to arrange; set in order [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2414.desc: [G2414] Ἱεροσόλυμα Hierosólyma - of Hebrew origin (H03389); Hierosolyma (i.e. Jerushalaim), the capitol of Palestine; Jerusalem [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4795.desc: [G4795] συγκυρία synkyría - from a comparative of G4862 (σύν) and (to light or happen; from the base of G2962 (κύριος)); concurrence, i.e. accident; chance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1547.desc: [G1547] ἐκγαμίζω ekgamízō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and a form of G1061 (γαμίσκω) (compare G1548 (ἐκγαμίσκω)); to marry off a daughter; give in marriage [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5338.desc: [G5338] φέγγος phéngos - probably akin to the base of G5457 (φῶς) (compare G5350 (φθέγγομαι)); brilliancy; light [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2202.desc: [G2202] ζευκτηρία zeuktēría - feminine of a derivative (at the second stage) from the same as G2218 (ζυγός); a fastening (tiller-rope); band [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2194.desc: [G2194] Ζαβουλών Zaboulṓn - of Hebrew origin (H02074); Zabulon (i.e. Zebulon), a region of Palestine; Zabulon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G472.desc: [G472] ἀντέχομαι antéchomai - from G473 (ἀντί) and the middle voice of G2192 (ἔχω); to hold oneself opposite to, i.e. (by implication) adhere to; by extension to care for; hold fast, hold to, support [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4105.desc: [G4105] πλανάω planáō - from G4106 (πλάνη); to (properly, cause to) roam (from safety, truth, or virtue); go astray, deceive, err, seduce, wander, be out of the way [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4042.desc: [G4042] περιοχή periochḗ - from G4023 (περιέχω); a being held around, i.e. (concretely) a passage (of Scripture, as circumscribed); place [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3163.desc: [G3163] μάχη máchē - from G3164 (μάχομαι); a battle, i.e. (figuratively) controversy; fighting, strive, striving [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2739.desc: [G2739] καυματίζω kaumatízō - from G2738 (καῦμα); to burn; scorch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G59.desc: [G59] ἀγοράζω agorázō - from G58 (ἀγορά); properly, to go to market, i.e. (by implication) to purchase; specially, to redeem; buy, redeem [BLB] [BibleHub]

G65.desc: [G65] ἀγριέλαιος agriélaios - from G66 (ἄγριος) and G1636 (ἐλαία); an oleaster; olive tree (which is) wild [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4801.desc: [G4801] συζεύγνυμι syzeúgnymi - from G4862 (σύν) and the base of G2201 (ζεῦγος); to yoke together, i.e. (figuratively) conjoin (in marriage); join together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2991.desc: [G2991] λαξευτός laxeutós - from a compound of (a stone) and the base of G3584 (ξηρός) (in its original sense of scraping); rock-quarried; hewn in stone [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4329.desc: [G4329] προσδοκία prosdokía - from G4328 (προσδοκάω); apprehension (of evil); by implication, infliction anticipated; expectation, looking after [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4902.desc: [G4902] συνέπομαι synépomai - middle voice from G4862 (σύν) and a primary (to follow); to attend (travel) in company with; accompany [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4046.desc: [G4046] περιποιέομαι peripoiéomai - middle voice from G4012 (περί) and G4160 (ποιέω); to make around oneself, i.e. acquire (buy); purchase [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3795.desc: [G3795] ὀψάριον opsárion - neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of G3702 (ὀπτός); a relish to other food (as if cooked sauce), i.e. (specially), fish (presumably salted and dried as a condiment); fish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1411.desc: [G1411] δύναμις dýnamis - from G1410 (δύναμαι); force (literally or figuratively); specially, miraculous power (usually by implication, a miracle itself); ability, abundance, meaning, might(-ily, -y, -y deed), (worker of) miracle(-s), power, strength, violence, mighty (wonderful) work [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4263.desc: [G4263] πρόβατον próbaton - probably neuter of a presumed derivative of G4260 (προβαίνω); something that walks forward (a quadruped), i.e. (specially), a sheep (literally or figuratively); sheep(-fold) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4976.desc: [G4976] σχῆμα schēma - from the alternate of G2192 (ἔχω); a figure (as a mode or circumstance), i.e. (by implication) external condition; fashion [BLB] [BibleHub]

G479.desc: [G479] ἀντικαλέω antikaléō - from G473 (ἀντί) and G2564 (καλέω); to invite in return; bid again [BLB] [BibleHub]

G163.desc: [G163] αἰχμαλωτίζω aichmalōtízō - from G164 (αἰχμάλωτος); to make captive; lead away captive, bring into captivity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1356.desc: [G1356] διοπετής diopetḗs - from the alternate of G2203 (Ζεύς) and the alternate of G4098 (πίπτω); sky-fallen (i.e. an aerolite); which fell down from Jupiter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5327.desc: [G5327] φάραγξ pháranx - properly, strengthened from the base of G4008 (πέραν) or rather of G4486 (ῥήγνυμι); a gap or chasm, i.e. ravine (winter-torrent); valley [BLB] [BibleHub]

G442.desc: [G442] ἀνθρώπινος anthrṓpinos - from G444 (ἄνθρωπος); human; human, common to man, man(-kind), (man-)kind, men's, after the manner of men [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4209.desc: [G4209] πορφύρα porphýra - of Latin origin; the "purple" mussel, i.e. (by implication) the red-blue color itself, and finally a garment dyed with it; purple [BLB] [BibleHub]

G248.desc: [G248] ἀλοάω aloáō - from the same as G257 (ἅλων); to tread out grain; thresh, tread out the corn [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4583.desc: [G4583] σεληνιάζομαι selēniázomai - middle voice or passive from a presumed derivative of G4582 (σελήνη); to be moon-struck, i.e. crazy; be a lunatic [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2722.desc: [G2722] κατέχω katéchō - from G2596 (κατά) and G2192 (ἔχω); to hold down (fast), in various applications (literally or figuratively); have, hold (fast), keep (in memory), let, X make toward, possess, retain, seize on, stay, take, withhold [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1748.desc: [G1748] ἐνεδρεύω enedreúō - from G1747 (ἐνέδρα); to lurk, i.e. (figuratively) plot assassination; lay wait for [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5056.desc: [G5056] τέλος télos - from a primary (to set out for a definite point or goal); properly, the point aimed at as a limit, i.e. (by implication) the conclusion of an act or state (termination (literally, figuratively or indefinitely), result (immediate, ultimate or prophetic), purpose); specially, an impost or levy (as paid); + continual, custom, end(-ing), finally, uttermost [BLB] [BibleHub]

G222.desc: [G222] Ἀλεξανδρῖνος Alexandrînos - from the same as G221 (Ἀλεξανδρεύς); Alexandrine, or belonging to Alexandria; of Alexandria [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3484.desc: [G3484] Ναΐν Naḯn - probably of Hebrew origin (compare H04999); Nain, a place in Palestine; Nain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G80.desc: [G80] ἀδελφός adelphós - from G1 (Α) (as a connective particle) and (the womb); a brother (literally or figuratively) near or remote (much like G1 (Α)); brother [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1094.desc: [G1094] γῆρας gēras - akin to G1088 (γέρων); senility; old age [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5366.desc: [G5366] φιλάργυρος philárgyros - from G5384 (φίλος) and G696 (ἄργυρος); fond of silver (money), i.e. avaricious; covetous [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2968.desc: [G2968] κώμη kṓmē - from G2749 (κεῖμαι); a hamlet (as if laid down); town, village [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5198.desc: [G5198] ὑγιαίνω hygiaínō - from G5199 (ὑγιής); to have sound health, i.e. be well (in body); figuratively, to be uncorrupt (true in doctrine); be in health, (be safe and) sound, (be) whole(-some) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3086.desc: [G3086] λυτρωτής lytrōtḗs - from G3084 (λυτρόω); a redeemer (figuratively); deliverer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G719.desc: [G719] ἁρμός harmós - from the same as G716 (ἅρμα); an articulation (of the body); joint [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5014.desc: [G5014] ταπείνωσις tapeínōsis - from G5013 (ταπεινόω); depression (in rank or feeling); humiliation, be made low, low estate, vile [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3658.desc: [G3658] ὅμιλος hómilos - from the base of G3674 (ὁμοῦ) and a derivative of the alternate of G138 (αἱρέομαι) (meaning a crowd); association together, i.e. a multitude; company [BLB] [BibleHub]

G797.desc: [G797] ἀστράπτω astráptō - probably from G792 (ἀστήρ); to flash as lightning; lighten, shine [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3117.desc: [G3117] μακρός makrós - from G3372 (μῆκος); long (in place (distant) or time (neuter plural)); far, long [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3762.desc: [G3762] οὐδείς oudeís - from G3761 (οὐδέ) and G1520 (εἷς); not even one (man, woman or thing), i.e. none, nobody, nothing; any (man), aught, man, neither any (thing), never (man), no (man), none (+ of these things), not (any, at all, -thing), nought [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5129.desc: [G5129] τούτῳ toútōi - dative case singular masculine or neuter of G3778 (οὗτος); to (in, with or by) this (person or thing); here(-by, -in), him, one, the same, there(-in), this [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3642.desc: [G3642] ὀλιγόψυχος oligópsychos - from G3641 (ὀλίγος) and G6590; little-spirited, i.e. faint-hearted; feebleminded [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2923.desc: [G2923] κριτής kritḗs - from G2919 (κρίνω); a judge (genitive case or specially); judge [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5011.desc: [G5011] ταπεινός tapeinós - of uncertain derivation; depressed, i.e. (figuratively) humiliated (in circumstances or disposition); base, cast down, humble, of low degree (estate), lowly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4266.desc: [G4266] προγίνομαι progínomai - from G4253 (πρό) and G1096 (γίνομαι); to be already, i.e. have previousy transpired; be past [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3328.desc: [G3328] μεταβάλλω metabállō - from G3326 (μετά) and G906 (βάλλω); to throw over, i.e. (middle voice figuratively) to turn about in opinion; change mind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3126.desc: [G3126] μαμμωνᾶς mammōnâs - of Chaldee origin (confidence, i.e. wealth, personified); mammonas, i.e. avarice (deified); mammon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G805.desc: [G805] ἀσφαλίζω asphalízō - from G804 (ἀσφαλής); to render secure; make fast (sure) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G443.desc: [G443] ἀνθρωποκτόνος anthrōpoktónos - from G444 (ἄνθρωπος) and (to kill); a manslayer; murderer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5047.desc: [G5047] τελειότης teleiótēs - from G5046 (τέλειος); (the state) completeness (mentally or morally); perfection(-ness) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5374.desc: [G5374] Φιλιππήσιος Philippḗsios - from G5375 (Φίλιπποι); a Philippesian (Philippian), i.e. native of Philippi; Philippian [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4307.desc: [G4307] πρόνοια prónoia - from G4306 (προνοέω); forethought, i.e. provident care or supply; providence, provision [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2656.desc: [G2656] κατανεύω kataneúō - from G2596 (κατά) and G3506 (νεύω); to nod down (towards), i.e. (by analogy) to make signs to; beckon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G72.desc: [G72] ἀγωγή agōgḗ - reduplicated from G71 (ἄγω); a bringing up, i.e. mode of living; manner of life [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5362.desc: [G5362] φίλανδρος phílandros - from G5384 (φίλος) and G435 (ἀνήρ); fond of man, i.e. affectionate as a wife; love their husbands [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2499.desc: [G2499] Ἰωσή Iōsḗ - genitive case of G2500 (Ἰωσῆς); Jose, an Israelite; Jose [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5597.desc: [G5597] ψώχω psṓchō - prolongation from the same base as G5567 (ψάλλω); to triturate, i.e. (by analogy) to rub out (kernels from husks with the fingers or hand); rub [BLB] [BibleHub]

G192.desc: [G192] ἀκρασία akrasía - from G193 (ἀκρατής); want of self-restraint; excess, incontinency [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1487.desc: [G1487] εἰ ei - a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.; forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3416.desc: [G3416] Μνάσων Mnásōn - of uncertain origin; Mnason, a Christian; Mnason [BLB] [BibleHub]

G99.desc: [G99] Ἀδρίας Adrías - from (a place near its shore); the Adriatic sea (including the Ionian); Adria [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2128.desc: [G2128] εὐλογητός eulogētós - from G2127 (εὐλογέω); adorable; blessed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4829.desc: [G4829] συμμερίζομαι symmerízomai - middle voice from G4862 (σύν) and G3307 (μερίζω); to share jointly, i.e. participate in; be partaker with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4144.desc: [G4144] πλόος plóos - from G4126 (πλέω); a sail, i.e. navigation; course, sailing, voyage [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5290.desc: [G5290] ὑποστρέφω hypostréphō - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G4762 (στρέφω); to turn under (behind), i.e. to return (literally or figuratively); come again, return (again, back again), turn back (again) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1128.desc: [G1128] γυμνάζω gymnázō - from G1131 (γυμνός); to practise naked (in the games), i.e. train (figuratively); exercise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4906.desc: [G4906] συνεσθίω synesthíō - from G4862 (σύν) and G2068 (ἐσθίω) (including its alternate); to take food in company with; eat with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3669.desc: [G3669] ὁμοίωσις homoíōsis - from G3666 (ὁμοιόω); assimilation, i.e. resemblance; similitude [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5087.desc: [G5087] τίθημι títhēmi - a prolonged form of a primary (which is used only as alternate in certain tenses); to place (in the widest application, literally and figuratively; properly, in a passive or horizontal posture, and thus different from G2476 (ἵστημι), which properly denotes an upright and active position, while G2749 (κεῖμαι) is properly reflexive and utterly prostrate); + advise, appoint, bow, commit, conceive, give, X kneel down, lay (aside, down, up), make, ordain, purpose, put, set (forth), settle, sink down [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4579.desc: [G4579] σείω seíō - apparently a primary verb; to rock (vibrate, properly, sideways or to and fro), i.e. (generally) to agitate (in any direction; cause to tremble); figuratively, to throw into a tremor (of fear or concern); move, quake, shake [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2317.desc: [G2317] θεοσέβεια theosébeia - from G2318 (θεοσεβής); devoutness, i.e. piety; godliness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1384.desc: [G1384] δόκιμος dókimos - from G1380 (δοκέω); properly, acceptable (current after assayal), i.e. approved; approved, tried [BLB] [BibleHub]

G227.desc: [G227] ἀληθής alēthḗs - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2990 (λανθάνω); true (as not concealing); true, truly, truth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2015.desc: [G2015] ἐπιφάνεια epipháneia - from G2016 (ἐπιφανής); a manifestation, i.e. (specially) the advent of Christ (past or future); appearing, brightness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3772.desc: [G3772] οὐρανός ouranós - perhaps from the same as G3735 (ὄρος) (through the idea of elevation); the sky; by extension, heaven (as the abode of God); by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel (Christianity); air, heaven(-ly), sky [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5378.desc: [G5378] Φιλόλογος Philólogos - from G5384 (φίλος) and G3056 (λόγος); fond of words, i.e. talkative (argumentative, learned, "philological"); Philologus, a Christian; Philologus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5034.desc: [G5034] τάχος táchos - from the same as G5036 (ταχύς); a brief space (of time), i.e. (with G1722 (ἐν) prefixed) in haste; + quickly, + shortly, + speedily [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2965.desc: [G2965] κύων kýōn - a primary word; a dog ("hound") (literally or figuratively); dog [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1690.desc: [G1690] ἐμβριμάομαι embrimáomai - from G1722 (ἐν) and (to snort with anger); to have indignation on, i.e. (transitively) to blame, (intransitively) to sigh with chagrin, (specially) to sternly enjoin; straitly charge, groan, murmur against [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3838.desc: [G3838] παντελής pantelḗs - from G3956 (πᾶς) and G5056 (τέλος); full-ended, i.e. entire (neuter as noun, completion); + in (no) wise, uttermost [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4351.desc: [G4351] προσκυλίω proskylíō - from G4314 (πρός) and G2947 (κυλιόω); to roll towards, i.e. block against; roll (to) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1929.desc: [G1929] ἐπιδίδωμι epidídōmi - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G1325 (δίδωμι); to give over (by hand or surrender); deliver unto, give, let (+ (her drive)), offer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4997.desc: [G4997] σωφροσύνη sōphrosýnē - from G4998 (σώφρων); soundness of mind, i.e. (literally) sanity or (figuratively) self-control; soberness, sobriety [BLB] [BibleHub]

G450.desc: [G450] ἀνίστημι anístēmi - from G303 (ἀνά) and G2476 (ἵστημι); to stand up (literal or figurative, transitive or intransitive); arise, lift up, raise up (again), rise (again), stand up(-right) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G604.desc: [G604] ἀποκαταλλάσσω apokatallássō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G2644 (καταλλάσσω); to reconcile fully; reconcile [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5031.desc: [G5031] ταχινός tachinós - from G5034 (τάχος); curt, i.e. impending; shortly, swift [BLB] [BibleHub]

G759.desc: [G759] ἄρωμα árōma - from G142 (αἴρω) (in the sense of sending off scent); an aromatic; (sweet) spice [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4814.desc: [G4814] συλλαλέω syllaléō - from G4862 (σύν) and G2980 (λαλέω); to talk together, i.e. converse; commune (confer, talk) with, speak among [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2309.desc: [G2309] θέλω thélō - apparently strengthened from the alternate form of G138 (αἱρέομαι); to determine (as an active option from subjective impulse; whereas G1014 (βούλομαι) properly denotes rather a passive acquiescence in objective considerations), i.e. choose or prefer (literally or figuratively); by implication, to wish, i.e. be inclined to (sometimes adverbially, gladly); impersonally for the future tense, to be about to; by Hebraism, to delight in; desire, be disposed (forward), intend, list, love, mean, please, have rather, (be) will (have, -ling, - ling(-ly)) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5234.desc: [G5234] ὑπερβαλλόντως hyperballóntōs - adverb from present participle active of G5235 (ὑπερβάλλω); excessively; beyond measure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G551.desc: [G551] ἀπείραστος apeírastos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G3987 (πειράω); untried, i.e. not temptable; not to be tempted [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2675.desc: [G2675] καταρτίζω katartízō - from G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of G739 (ἄρτιος); to complete thoroughly, i.e. repair (literally or figuratively) or adjust; fit, frame, mend, (make) perfect(-ly join together), prepare, restore [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3526.desc: [G3526] Νίγερ Níger - of Latin origin; black; Niger, a Christian; Niger [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4974.desc: [G4974] σφυρόν sphyrón - neuter of a presumed derivative probably of the same as (a ball, "sphere"; compare the feminine , a hammer); the ankle (as globular); ancle bone [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3925.desc: [G3925] παρεμβολή parembolḗ - from a compound of G3844 (παρά) and G1685 (ἐμβάλλω); a throwing in beside (juxtaposition), i.e. (specially), battle-array, encampment or barracks (tower Antonia); army, camp, castle [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4830.desc: [G4830] συμμέτοχος symmétochos - from G4862 (σύν) and G3353 (μέτοχος); a co-participant; partaker [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2244.desc: [G2244] ἡλικία hēlikía - from the same as G2245 (ἡλίκος); maturity (in years or size); age, stature [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5356.desc: [G5356] φθορά phthorá - from G5351 (φθείρω); decay, i.e. ruin (spontaneous or inflicted, literally or figuratively); corruption, destroy, perish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3010.desc: [G3010] λειτουργικός leitourgikós - from the same as G3008 (λειτουργέω); functional publicly ("liturgic"); i.e. beneficient; ministering [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1877.desc: [G1877] ἐπανάγω epanágō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G321 (ἀνάγω); to lead up on, i.e. (technical) to put out (to sea); (intransitively) to return; launch (thrust) out, return [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1634.desc: [G1634] ἐκψύχω ekpsýchō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G5594 (ψύχω); to expire; give (yield) up the ghost [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5151.desc: [G5151] τρίς trís - adverb from G5140 (τρεῖς); three times; three times, thrice [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2228.desc: [G2228] ἤ ḗ - a primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than; and, but (either), (n-)either, except it be, (n-)or (else), rather, save, than, that, what, yea [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5154.desc: [G5154] τρίτος trítos - ordinal from G5140 (τρεῖς); third; neuter (as noun) a third part, or (as adverb) a (or the) third time, thirdly; third(-ly) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3768.desc: [G3768] οὔπω oúpō - from G3756 (οὐ) and G4452 (-πω); not yet; hitherto not, (no…) as yet, not yet [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4661.desc: [G4661] σκῦλον skŷlon - neuter from G4660 (σκύλλω); something stripped (as a hide), i.e. booty; spoil [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1302.desc: [G1302] διατί diatí - from G1223 (διά) and G5101 (τίς); through what cause ?, i.e. why?; wherefore, why [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1992.desc: [G1992] ἐπιστολή epistolḗ - from G1989 (ἐπιστέλλω); a written message; "epistle," letter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G625.desc: [G625] Ἀπολλῶς Apollōs - probably from the same as G624 (Ἀπολλωνία); Apollos, an Israelite; Apollos [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5119.desc: [G5119] τότε tóte - from (the neuter of) G3588 (ὁ) and G3753 (ὅτε); the when, i.e. at the time that (of the past or future, also in consecution); that time, then [BLB] [BibleHub]

G782.desc: [G782] ἀσπάζομαι aspázomai - from G1 (Α) (as a particle of union) and a presumed form of G4685 (σπάω); to enfold in the arms, i.e. (by implication) to salute, (figuratively) to welcome; embrace, greet, salute, take leave [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3623.desc: [G3623] οἰκονόμος oikonómos - from G3624 (οἶκος) and the base of G3551 (νόμος); a house-distributor (i.e. manager), or overseer, i.e. an employee in that capacity; by extension, a fiscal agent (treasurer); figuratively, a preacher (of the Gospel); chamberlain, governor, steward [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3201.desc: [G3201] μέμφομαι mémphomai - middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to blame; find fault [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5485.desc: [G5485] χάρις cháris - from G5463 (χαίρω); graciousness (as gratifying), of manner or act (abstract or concrete; literal, figurative or spiritual; especially the divine influence upon the heart, and its reflection in the life; including gratitude); acceptable, benefit, favour, gift, grace(- ious), joy, liberality, pleasure, thank(-s, -worthy) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1903.desc: [G1903] ἐπενδύτης ependýtēs - from G1902 (ἐπενδύομαι); a wrapper, i.e. outer garment; fisher's coat [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2079.desc: [G2079] ἐσχάτως eschátōs - adverb from G2078 (ἔσχατος); finally, i.e. (with G2192 (ἔχω)) at the extremity of life; point of death [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1320.desc: [G1320] διδάσκαλος didáskalos - from G1321 (διδάσκω); an instructor (genitive case or specially); doctor, master, teacher [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2659.desc: [G2659] κατάνυξις katányxis - from G2660 (κατανύσσω); a prickling (sensation, as of the limbs asleep), i.e. (by implication, (perhaps by some confusion with G3506 (νεύω) or even with G3571 (νύξ))) stupor (lethargy); slumber [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4448.desc: [G4448] πυρόω pyróō - from G4442 (πῦρ); to kindle, i.e. (passively) to be ignited, glow (literally), be refined (by implication), or (figuratively) to be inflamed (with anger, grief, lust); burn, fiery, be on fire, try [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3453.desc: [G3453] μυέω myéō - from the base of G3466 (μυστήριον); to initiate, i.e. (by implication) to teach; instruct [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4315.desc: [G4315] προσάββατον prosábbaton - from G4253 (πρό) and G4521 (σάββατον); a fore-sabbath, i.e. the Sabbath-eve; day before the sabbath [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1691.desc: [G1691] ἐμέ emé - a prolonged form of G3165 (μέ); me; I, me, my(-self) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4975.desc: [G4975] σχεδόν schedón - neuter of a presumed derivative of the alternate of G2192 (ἔχω) as adverb; nigh, i.e. nearly; almost [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3406.desc: [G3406] μισθαποδότης misthapodótēs - from G3409 (μισθόω) and G591 (ἀποδίδωμι); a renumerator; rewarder [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1719.desc: [G1719] ἔμφοβος émphobos - from G1722 (ἐν) and G5401 (φόβος); in fear, i.e. alarmed; affrighted, afraid, tremble [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1514.desc: [G1514] εἰρηνεύω eirēneúō - from G1515 (εἰρήνη); to be (act) peaceful; be at (have, live in) peace, live peaceably [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1489.desc: [G1489] εἴγε eíge - from G1487 (εἰ) and G1065 (γέ); if indeed, seeing that, unless, (with negative) otherwise; if (so be that, yet) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G684.desc: [G684] ἀπώλεια apṓleia - from a presumed derivative of G622 (ἀπόλλυμι); ruin or loss (physical, spiritual or eternal); damnable(-nation), destruction, die, perdition, X perish, pernicious ways, waste [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2435.desc: [G2435] ἱλαστήριον hilastḗrion - neuter of a derivative of G2433 (ἱλάσκομαι); an expiatory (place or thing), i.e. (concretely) an atoning victim, or (specially) the lid of the Ark (in the Temple); mercyseat, propitiation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2013.desc: [G2013] ἐπιτυγχάνω epitynchánō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G5177 (τυγχάνω); to chance upon, i.e. (by implication) to attain; obtain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1488.desc: [G1488] εἶ eî - second person singular present of G1510 (εἰμί); thou art; art, be [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4019.desc: [G4019] περιδέω peridéō - from G4012 (περί) and G1210 (δέω); to bind around one, i.e. enwrap; bind about [BLB] [BibleHub]

G114.desc: [G114] ἀθετέω athetéō - from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G5087 (τίθημι); to set aside, i.e. (by implication) to disesteem, neutralize or violate; cast off, despise, disannul, frustrate, bring to nought, reject [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5204.desc: [G5204] ὕδωρ hýdōr - from the base of G5205 (ὑετός); water (as if rainy) literally or figuratively; water [BLB] [BibleHub]

G329.desc: [G329] ἀναζωπυρέω anazōpyréō - from G303 (ἀνά) and a compound of the base of G2226 (ζῶον) and G4442 (πῦρ); to re-enkindle; stir up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2485.desc: [G2485] ἰχθύδιον ichthýdion - diminutive from G2486 (ἰχθύς); a petty fish; little (small) fish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G920.desc: [G920] Βαριωνᾶς Bariōnâs - of Chaldee origin (H01247 and H03124); son of Jonas (or Jonah); Bar-jonas, an Israelite; Bar-jona [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2776.desc: [G2776] κεφαλή kephalḗ - from the primary (in the sense of seizing); the head (as the part most readily taken hold of), literally or figuratively; head [BLB] [BibleHub]

G651.desc: [G651] ἀποστολή apostolḗ - from G649 (ἀποστέλλω); commission, i.e. (specially) apostolate; apostleship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2782.desc: [G2782] κήρυγμα kḗrygma - from G2784 (κηρύσσω); a proclamation (especially of the gospel; by implication, the gospel itself); preaching [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5120.desc: [G5120] τοῦ toû - properly, the genitive case of G3588 (ὁ); sometimes used for G5127 (τούτου); of this person; his [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4216.desc: [G4216] ποταμοφόρητος potamophórētos - from G4215 (ποταμός) and a derivative of G5409 (φορέω); river-borne, i.e. overwhelmed by a stream; carried away of the flood [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4167.desc: [G4167] ποίμνη poímnē - contraction from G4165 (ποιμαίνω); a flock (literally or figuratively); flock, fold [BLB] [BibleHub]

G789.desc: [G789] Ἄσσος Ássos - probably of foreign origin; Assus, a city of Asia MInor; Assos [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1537.desc: [G1537] ἐκ ek - a primary preposition denoting origin (the point whence action or motion proceeds), from, out (of place, time, or cause; literal or figurative; direct or remote); after, among, X are, at, betwixt(-yond), by (the means of), exceedingly, (+ abundantly above), for(- th), from (among, forth, up), + grudgingly, + heartily, X heavenly, X hereby, + very highly, in, …ly, (because, by reason) of, off (from), on, out among (from, of), over, since, X thenceforth, through, X unto, X vehemently, with(-out) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4527.desc: [G4527] Σαλά Salá - of Hebrew origin (H07974); Sala (i.e. Shelach), a patriarch ; Sala [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4320.desc: [G4320] προσαναβαίνω prosanabaínō - from G4314 (πρός) and G305 (ἀναβαίνω); to ascend farther, i.e. be promoted (take an upper (more honorable) seat); go up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1343.desc: [G1343] δικαιοσύνη dikaiosýnē - from G1342 (δίκαιος); equity (of character or act); specially (Christian) justification; righteousness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1103.desc: [G1103] γνήσιος gnḗsios - from the same as G1077 (γενέσια); legitimate (of birth), i.e. genuine; own, sincerity, true [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3570.desc: [G3570] νυνί nyní - a prolonged form of G3568 (νῦν) for emphasis; just now; now [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3040.desc: [G3040] λιμήν limḗn - apparently a primary word; a harbor; haven [BLB] [BibleHub]

G662.desc: [G662] ἀποτολμάω apotolmáō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G5111 (τολμάω); to venture plainly; be very bold [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2790.desc: [G2790] κιθαρῳδός kitharōidós - from G2788 (κιθάρα) and a derivative of the same as G5603 (ᾠδή); a lyre-singer(-player), i.e. harpist; harper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4099.desc: [G4099] Πισιδία Pisidía - probably of foreign origin; Pisidia, a region of Asia Minor; Pisidia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G118.desc: [G118] ἀθλέω athléō - from (a contest in the public lists); to contend in the competitive games; strive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1861.desc: [G1861] ἐπαγγέλλω epangéllō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and the base of G32 (ἄγγελος); to announce upon (reflexively), i.e. (by implication) to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself; profess, (make) promise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4066.desc: [G4066] περίχωρος períchōros - from G4012 (περί) and G5561 (χώρα); around the region, i.e. circumjacent (as noun, with G1093 (γῆ) implied vicinity); country (round) about, region (that lieth) round about [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4745.desc: [G4745] στοά stoá - probably from G2476 (ἵστημι); a colonnade or interior piazza; porch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4077.desc: [G4077] πηγή pēgḗ - probably from G4078 (πήγνυμι) (through the idea of gushing plumply); a fount (literally or figuratively), i.e. source or supply (of water, blood, enjoyment) (not necessarily the original spring); fountain, well [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2344.desc: [G2344] θησαυρός thēsaurós - from G5087 (τίθημι); a deposit, i.e. wealth (literally or figuratively); treasure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3018.desc: [G3018] Λευΐς Leuḯs - a form of G3017 (Λευΐ); Lewis (i.e. Levi), a Christian; Levi [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1900.desc: [G1900] ἐπέκεινα epékeina - from G1909 (ἐπί) and (the accusative case plural neuter of) G1565 (ἐκεῖνος); upon those parts of, i.e. on the further side of; beyond [BLB] [BibleHub]

G885.desc: [G885] Ἀχείμ Acheím - probably of Hebrew origin (compare H03137); Achim, an Israelite; Achim [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1568.desc: [G1568] ἐκθαμβέω ekthambéō - from G1569 (ἔκθαμβος); to astonish utterly; affright, greatly (sore) amaze [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1961.desc: [G1961] ἐπιμένω epiménō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3306 (μένω); to stay over, i.e. remain (figuratively, persevere); abide (in), continue (in), tarry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5048.desc: [G5048] τελειόω teleióō - from G5046 (τέλειος); to complete, i.e. (literally) accomplish, or (figuratively) consummate (in character); consecrate, finish, fulfil, make) perfect [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2483.desc: [G2483] Ἰταλικός Italikós - from G2482 (Ἰταλία); Italic, i.e. belonging to Italia; Italian [BLB] [BibleHub]

G374.desc: [G374] ἀναπείθω anapeíthō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G3982 (πείθω); to incite; persuade [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1516.desc: [G1516] εἰρηνικός eirēnikós - from G1515 (εἰρήνη); pacific; by implication, salutary; peaceable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2619.desc: [G2619] κατακαλύπτω katakalýptō - from G2596 (κατά) and G2572 (καλύπτω); to cover wholly, i.e. veil; cover, hide [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3843.desc: [G3843] πάντως pántōs - adverb from G3956 (πᾶς); entirely; specially, at all events, (with negative, following) in no event; by all means, altogether, at all, needs, no doubt, in (no) wise, surely [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1997.desc: [G1997] ἐπισυναγωγή episynagōgḗ - from G1996 (ἐπισυνάγω); a complete collection; especially a Christian meeting (for worship); assembling (gathering) together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4090.desc: [G4090] πικρῶς pikrōs - adverb from G4089 (πικρός); bitterly, i.e. (figuratively) violently; bitterly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2980.desc: [G2980] λαλέω laléō - a prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. utter words; preach, say, speak (after), talk, tell, utter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G672.desc: [G672] ἀποχωρέω apochōréō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G5562 (χωρέω); to go away; depart [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2382.desc: [G2382] θώραξ thṓrax - of uncertain affinity; the chest ("thorax"), i.e. (by implication) a corslet; breast-plate [BLB] [BibleHub]

G407.desc: [G407] ἀνδρίζομαι andrízomai - middle voice from G435 (ἀνήρ); to act manly; quit like men [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3420.desc: [G3420] μνήμη mnḗmē - from G3403 (μιμνήσκω); memory; remembrance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G516.desc: [G516] ἀξίως axíōs - adverb from G514 (ἄξιος); appropriately; as becometh, after a godly sort, worthily(-thy) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4174.desc: [G4174] πολιτεία politeía - from G4177 (πολίτης) ("polity"); citizenship; concretely, a community; commonwealth, freedom [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4534.desc: [G4534] Σαλμώνη Salmṓnē - perhaps of similar origin to G4529 (Σαλαμίς); Salmone, a place in Crete; Salmone [BLB] [BibleHub]

G293.desc: [G293] ἀμφίβληστρον amphíblēstron - from a compound of the base of G297 (ἀμφότερος) and G906 (βάλλω); a (fishing) net (as thrown about the fish); net [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3856.desc: [G3856] παραδειγματίζω paradeigmatízō - from G3844 (παρά) and G1165 (δειγματίζω); to show alongside (the public), i.e. expose to infamy; make a public example, put to an open shame [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2012.desc: [G2012] ἐπίτροπος epítropos - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G5158 (τρόπος) (in the sense of G2011 (ἐπιτροπή)); a commissioner, i.e. domestic manager, guardian; steward, tutor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1889.desc: [G1889] Ἐπαφρᾶς Epaphrâs - contracted from G1891 (Ἐπαφρόδιτος); Epaphras, a Christian; Epaphras [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5464.desc: [G5464] χάλαζα chálaza - probably from G5465 (χαλάω); hail; hail [BLB] [BibleHub]

G681.desc: [G681] ἅπτω háptō - a primary verb; properly, to fasten to, i.e. (specially) to set on fire; kindle, light [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4933.desc: [G4933] συντηρέω syntēréō - from G4862 (σύν) and G5083 (τηρέω); to keep closely together, i.e. (by implication) to conserve (from ruin); mentally, to remember (and obey); keep, observe, preserve [BLB] [BibleHub]

G653.desc: [G653] ἀποστοματίζω apostomatízō - from G575 (ἀπό) and a (presumed) derivative of G4750 (στόμα); to speak off-hand (properly, dictate), i.e. to catechize (in an invidious manner); provoke to speak [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1491.desc: [G1491] εἶδος eîdos - from G1492 (εἴδω); a view, i.e. form (literally or figuratively); appearance, fashion, shape, sight [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4804.desc: [G4804] συζητητής syzētētḗs - from G4802 (συζητέω); a disputant, i.e. sophist; disputer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2318.desc: [G2318] θεοσεβής theosebḗs - from G2316 (θεός) and G4576 (σέβομαι); reverent of God, i.e. pious; worshipper of God [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2726.desc: [G2726] κατήφεια katḗpheia - from a compound of G2596 (κατά) and perhaps a derivative of the base of G5316 (φαίνω) (meaning downcast in look); demureness, i.e. (by implication) sadness; heaviness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G665.desc: [G665] ἀποτρέπω apotrépō - from G575 (ἀπό) and the base of G5157 (τροπή); to deflect, i.e. (reflexively) avoid; turn away [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5301.desc: [G5301] ὕσσωπος hýssōpos - of foreign origin (H0231); "hyssop"; hyssop [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1648.desc: [G1648] Ἐλεάζαρ Eleázar - of Hebrew origin (H0499); Eleazar, an Israelite; Eleazar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2139.desc: [G2139] εὐπερίστατος euperístatos - from G2095 (εὖ) and a derivative of a presumed compound of G4012 (περί) and G2476 (ἵστημι); well standing around, i.e. (a competitor) thwarting (a racer) in every direction (figuratively, of sin in genitive case); which doth so easily beset [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5164.desc: [G5164] τροχός trochós - from G5143 (τρέχω); a wheel (as a runner), i.e. (figuratively) a circuit of physical effects; course [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5161.desc: [G5161] Τρόφιμος Tróphimos - from G5160 (τροφή); nutritive; Trophimus, a Christian; Trophimus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G591.desc: [G591] ἀποδίδωμι apodídōmi - from G575 (ἀπό) and G1325 (δίδωμι); to give away, i.e. up, over, back, etc. (in various applications); deliver (again), give (again), (re-)pay(-ment be made), perform, recompense, render, requite, restore, reward, sell, yield [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1622.desc: [G1622] ἐκτός ektós - from G1537 (ἐκ); the exterior; figuratively (as a preposition) aside from, besides; but, except(-ed), other than, out of, outside, unless, without [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3405.desc: [G3405] μισθαποδοσία misthapodosía - from G3406 (μισθαποδότης); requital (good or bad); recompence of reward [BLB] [BibleHub]

G399.desc: [G399] ἀναφέρω anaphérō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G5342 (φέρω); to take up (literally or figuratively); bear, bring (carry, lead) up, offer (up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2024.desc: [G2024] ἐπιχορηγία epichorēgía - from G2023 (ἐπιχορηγέω); contribution; supply [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3567.desc: [G3567] νυμφών nymphṓn - from G3565 (νύμφη); the bridal room; bridechamber [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1612.desc: [G1612] ἐκστρέφω ekstréphō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G4762 (στρέφω); to pervert (figuratively); subvert [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3649.desc: [G3649] ὀλολύζω ololýzō - a reduplicated primary verb; to "howl" or "halloo", i.e. shriek; howl [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2173.desc: [G2173] εὔχρηστος eúchrēstos - from G2095 (εὖ) and G5543 (χρηστός); easily used, i.e. useful; profitable, meet for use [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2058.desc: [G2058] ἑρμηνεία hermēneía - from the same as G2059 (ἑρμηνεύω); translation; interpretation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2410.desc: [G2410] Ἱεριχώ Hierichṓ - of Hebrew origin (H03405); Jericho, a place in Palestine; Jericho [BLB] [BibleHub]

G617.desc: [G617] ἀποκυλίω apokylíō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G2947 (κυλιόω); to roll away; roll away (back) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3045.desc: [G3045] λιπαρός liparós - from (grease); fat, i.e. (figuratively) sumptuous; dainty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1227.desc: [G1227] διαβλέπω diablépō - from G1223 (διά) and G991 (βλέπω); to look through, i.e. recover full vision; see clearly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2487.desc: [G2487] ἴχνος íchnos - from (to arrive; compare G2240 (ἥκω)); a track (figuratively); step [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3715.desc: [G3715] ὄρεξις órexis - from G3713 (ὀρέγομαι); excitement of the mind, i.e. longing after; lust [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1818.desc: [G1818] ἐξαπατάω exapatáō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G538 (ἀπατάω); to seduce wholly; beguile, deceive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2797.desc: [G2797] Κίς Kís - of Hebrew origin (H07027); Cis (i.e. Kish), an Israelite; Cis [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3610.desc: [G3610] οἰκέτης oikétēs - from G3611 (οἰκέω); a fellow resident, i.e. menial domestic; (household) servant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3110.desc: [G3110] Μακεδών Makedṓn - of uncertain derivation; a Macedon (Macedonian), i.e. inhabitant of Macedonia; of Macedonia, Macedonian [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3138.desc: [G3138] Μάρκος Márkos - of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian; Marcus, Mark [BLB] [BibleHub]

G111.desc: [G111] ἀθέμιτος athémitos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of (statute; from the base of G5087 (τίθημι)); illegal; by implication, flagitious; abominable, unlawful thing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1001.desc: [G1001] βολίζω bolízō - from G1002 (βολίς); to heave the lead; sound [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3396.desc: [G3396] μίγνυμι mígnymi - a primary verb; to mix; mingle [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4821.desc: [G4821] συμβασιλεύω symbasileúō - from G4862 (σύν) and G936 (βασιλεύω); to be co-regent (figuratively); reign with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G773.desc: [G773] Ἀσία Asía - of uncertain derivation; Asia, i.e. Asia Minor, or (usually) only its western shore; Asia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2282.desc: [G2282] θάλπω thálpō - probably akin to (to warm); to brood, i.e. (figuratively) to foster; cherish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2296.desc: [G2296] θαυμάζω thaumázō - from G2295 (θαῦμα); to wonder; by implication, to admire; admire, have in admiration, marvel, wonder [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4725.desc: [G4725] στέμμα stémma - from the base of G4735 (στέφανος); a wreath for show; garland [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5514.desc: [G5514] Χλόη Chlóē - feminine of apparently a primary word; "green"; Chloë, a Christian female; Chloe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3929.desc: [G3929] πάρεσις páresis - from G2935 (κτήτωρ); praetermission, i.e. toleration; remission [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3690.desc: [G3690] ὄξος óxos - from G3691 (ὀξύς); vinegar, i.e. sour wine; vinegar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2640.desc: [G2640] κατάλειμμα katáleimma - from G2641 (καταλείπω); a remainder, i.e. (by implication) a few; remnant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3157.desc: [G3157] Ματθάν Matthán - of Hebrew origin (H04977); Matthan (i.e. Mattan), an Israelite; Matthan [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5355.desc: [G5355] φθόνος phthónos - probably akin to the base of G5351 (φθείρω); ill-will (as detraction), i.e. jealousy (spite); envy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4182.desc: [G4182] πολυποίκιλος polypoíkilos - from G4183 (πολύς) and G4164 (ποικίλος); much variegated, i.e. multifarious; manifold [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2222.desc: [G2222] ζωή zōḗ - from G2198 (ζάω); life (literally or figuratively); life(-time) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G721.desc: [G721] ἀρνίον arníon - diminutive from G704 (ἀρήν); a lambkin; lamb [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5621.desc: [G5621] ὠτίον ōtíon - diminutive of G3775 (οὖς); an earlet, i.e. one of the ears, or perhaps the lobe of the ear; ear [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2472.desc: [G2472] ἰσότιμος isótimos - from G2470 (ἴσος) and G5092 (τιμή); of equal value or honor; like precious [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4971.desc: [G4971] σφοδρῶς sphodrōs - adverb from the same as G4970 (σφόδρα); very much; exceedingly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5024.desc: [G5024] ταὐτά tautá - neuter plural of G3588 (ὁ) and G846 (αὐτός) as adverb; in the same way; even thus, (manner) like, so [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5468.desc: [G5468] χαλιναγωγέω chalinagōgéō - from a compound of G5469 (χαλινός) and the reduplicated form of G71 (ἄγω); to be a bit-leader, i.e. to curb (figuratively); bridle [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3577.desc: [G3577] νῶτος nōtos - of uncertain affinity; the back; back [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3498.desc: [G3498] νεκρός nekrós - from an apparently primary (a corpse); dead (literally or figuratively; also as noun); dead [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2156.desc: [G2156] εὐσχημόνως euschēmónōs - adverb from G2158 (εὐσχήμων); decorously; decently, honestly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3153.desc: [G3153] ματαιότης mataiótēs - from G3152 (μάταιος); inutility; figuratively, transientness; morally, depravity; vanity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1994.desc: [G1994] ἐπιστρέφω epistréphō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G4762 (στρέφω); to revert (literally, figuratively or morally); come (go) again, convert, (re-)turn (about, again) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G610.desc: [G610] ἀπόκριμα apókrima - from G611 (ἀποκρίνομαι) (in its original sense of judging); a judicial decision; sentence [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2261.desc: [G2261] ἤπιος ḗpios - probably from G2031 (ἔπος); properly, affable, i.e. mild or kind; gentle [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4615.desc: [G4615] σίναπι sínapi - perhaps from (to hurt, i.e. sting); mustard (the plant); mustard [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1760.desc: [G1760] ἐνθυμέομαι enthyméomai - from a compound of G1722 (ἐν) and G2372 (θυμός); to be inspirited, i.e. ponder; think [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4703.desc: [G4703] σπόρος spóros - from G4687 (σπείρω); a scattering (of seed), i.e. (concretely) seed (as sown); seed (X sown) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3566.desc: [G3566] νυμφίος nymphíos - from G3565 (νύμφη); a bride-groom (literally or figuratively); bridegroom [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2697.desc: [G2697] κατάσχεσις katáschesis - from G2722 (κατέχω); a holding down, i.e. occupancy; possession [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1037.desc: [G1037] βυθός bythós - a variation of G899 (βάθος); depth, i.e. (by implication) the sea; deep [BLB] [BibleHub]

G22.desc: [G22] ἄγαμος ágamos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G1062 (γάμος); unmarried; unmarried [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3744.desc: [G3744] ὀσμή osmḗ - from G3605 (ὄζω); fragrance (literally or figuratively); odour, savour [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1974.desc: [G1974] ἐπιποθία epipothía - from G1971 (ἐπιποθέω); intense longing; great desire [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4608.desc: [G4608] σίκερα síkera - of Hebrew origin (H07941); an intoxicant, i.e. intensely fermented liquor; strong drink [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2932.desc: [G2932] κτάομαι ktáomai - a primary verb; to get, i.e. acquire (by any means; own); obtain, possess, provide, purchase [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5357.desc: [G5357] φιάλη phiálē - of uncertain affinity; a broad shallow cup ("phial"); vial [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3470.desc: [G3470] μῶμος mōmos - perhaps from G3201 (μέμφομαι); a flaw or blot, i.e. (figuratively) disgraceful person; blemish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3183.desc: [G3183] μέθυσος méthysos - from G3184 (μεθύω); tipsy, i.e. (as noun) a sot; drunkard [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3194.desc: [G3194] Μελίτη Melítē - of uncertain origin; Melita, an island in the Mediterranean; Melita [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1355.desc: [G1355] διόπερ dióper - from G1352 (διό) and G4007 (περ); on which very account; wherefore [BLB] [BibleHub]

G66.desc: [G66] ἄγριος ágrios - from G68 (ἀγρός); wild (as pertaining to the country), literally (natural) or figuratively (fierce); wild, raging [BLB] [BibleHub]

G646.desc: [G646] ἀποστασία apostasía - feminine of the same as G647 (ἀποστάσιον); defection from truth (properly, the state) ("apostasy"); falling away, forsake [BLB] [BibleHub]

G537.desc: [G537] ἅπας hápas - from G1 (Α) (as a particle of union) and G3956 (πᾶς); absolutely all or (singular) every one; all (things), every (one), whole [BLB] [BibleHub]
