G609.desc: [G609] ἀποκόπτω apokóptō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G2875 (κόπτω); to amputate; reflexively (by irony) to mutilate (the privy parts); cut off [BLB] [BibleHub]

G412.desc: [G412] ἀνεκλάλητος aneklálētos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G1583 (ἐκλαλέω); not spoken out, i.e. (by implication) unutterable; unspeakable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1345.desc: [G1345] δικαίωμα dikaíōma - from G1344 (δικαιόω); an equitable deed; by implication, a statute or decision; judgment, justification, ordinance, righteousness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4332.desc: [G4332] προσεδρεύω prosedreúō - from a compound of G4314 (πρός) and the base of G1476 (ἑδραῖος); to sit near, i.e. attend as a servant; wait at [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2142.desc: [G2142] εὐπορία euporía - from the same as G2141 (εὐπορέω); pecuniary resources; wealth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G615.desc: [G615] ἀποκτείνω apokteínō - from G575 (ἀπό) and (to slay); to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy; put to death, kill, slay [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3898.desc: [G3898] παραπλησίως paraplēsíōs - adverb from the same as G3897 (παραπλήσιον); in a manner near by, i.e. (figuratively) similarly; likewise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2750.desc: [G2750] κειρία keiría - of uncertain affinity; a swathe, i.e. winding-sheet; graveclothes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4436.desc: [G4436] Πύθων Pýthōn - from (the name of the region where Delphi, the seat of the famous oracle, was located); a Python, i.e. (by analogy, with the supposed diviner there) inspiration (soothsaying); divination [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3125.desc: [G3125] μάμμη mámmē - of natural origin ("mammy"); a grandmother; grandmother [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2270.desc: [G2270] ἡσυχάζω hēsycházō - from the same as G2272 (ἡσύχιος); to keep still (intransitively), i.e. refrain from labor, meddlesomeness or speech; cease, hold peace, be quiet, rest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1744.desc: [G1744] ἐνδύνω endýnō - from G1772 (ἔννομος) and G1416 (δύνω); to sink (by implication, wrap (compare G1746 (ἐνδύω)) on, i.e. (figuratively) sneak; creep [BLB] [BibleHub]

G712.desc: [G712] ἄριστον áriston - apparently neuter of a superlative from the same as G730 (ἄῤῥην); the best meal (or breakfast; perhaps from ("early")), i.e. luncheon; dinner [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1377.desc: [G1377] διώκω diṓkō - a prolonged (and causative) form of a primary verb (to flee; compare the base of G1169 (δειλός) and G1249 (διάκονος)); to pursue (literally or figuratively); by implication, to persecute; ensue, follow (after), given to, (suffer) persecute(-ion), press forward [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1093.desc: [G1093] γῆ gē - contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe (including the occupants in each application); country, earth(-ly), ground, land, world [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1950.desc: [G1950] ἐπιλανθάνομαι epilanthánomai - middle voice from G1909 (ἐπί) and G2990 (λανθάνω); to lose out of mind; by implication, to neglect; (be) forget(-ful of) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4734.desc: [G4734] Στεφανᾶς Stephanâs - probably contraction for (crowned; from G4737 (στεφανόω)); Stephanas, a Christian; Stephanas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5560.desc: [G5560] χωλός chōlós - apparently a primary word; "halt", i.e. limping; cripple, halt, lame [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5271.desc: [G5271] ὑποκρίνομαι hypokrínomai - middle voice from G5259 (ὑπό) and G2919 (κρίνω); to decide (speak or act) under a false part, i.e. (figuratively) dissemble (pretend); feign [BLB] [BibleHub]

G427.desc: [G427] ἄνευ áneu - a primary particle; without; without [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3881.desc: [G3881] παραλέγομαι paralégomai - from G3844 (παρά) and the middle voice of G3004 (λέγω) (in its original sense); (specially), to lay one's course near, i.e. sail past; pass, sail by [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1201.desc: [G1201] δεσμωτήριον desmōtḗrion - from a derivative of G1199 (δεσμόν) (equivalent to G1196 (δεσμέω)); a place of bondage, i.e. a dungeon; prison [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2971.desc: [G2971] κώνωψ kṓnōps - apparently a derivative of the base of G2759 (κέντρον) and a derivative of G3700 (ὀπτάνομαι); a mosquito (from its stinging proboscis); gnat [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4247.desc: [G4247] πρεσβῦτις presbŷtis - feminine of G4246 (πρεσβύτης); an old woman; aged woman [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3999.desc: [G3999] πεντάκις pentákis - multiplicative adverb from G4002 (πέντε); five times; five times [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1749.desc: [G1749] ἔνεδρον énedron - neuter of the same as G1747 (ἐνέδρα); an ambush, i.e. (figuratively) murderous design; lying in wait [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1056.desc: [G1056] Γαλιλαία Galilaía - of Hebrew origin (H01551); Galilæa (i.e. the heathen circle), a region of Palestine; Galilee [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3381.desc: [G3381] μήπως mḗpōs - from G3361 (μή) and G4458 (-πώς); lest somehow; lest (by any means, by some means, haply, perhaps) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4692.desc: [G4692] σπεύδω speúdō - probably strengthened from G4228 (πούς); to "speed" ("study"), i.e. urge on (diligently or earnestly); by implication, to await eagerly; (make, with) haste unto [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4727.desc: [G4727] στενάζω stenázō - from G4728 (στενός); to make (intransitively, be) in straits, i.e. (by implication) to sigh, murmur, pray inaudibly; with grief, groan, grudge, sigh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G536.desc: [G536] ἀπαρχή aparchḗ - from a compound of G575 (ἀπό) and G756 (ἄρχομαι); a beginning of sacrifice, i.e. the (Jewish) first-fruit (figuratively); first-fruits [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3134.desc: [G3134] μαρὰν ἀθά maràn athá - of Chaldee origin (meaning our Lord has come); maranatha, i.e. an exclamation of the approaching divine judgment; Maran-atha [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2520.desc: [G2520] καθήκω kathḗkō - from G2596 (κατά) and G2240 (ἥκω); to reach to, i.e. (neuter of present active participle, figuratively as adjective) becoming; convenient, fit [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5598.desc: [G5598] Ω Ō - the last letter of the Greek alphabet, i.e. (figuratively) the finality; Omega [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5098.desc: [G5098] τιμωρία timōría - from G5097 (τιμωρέω); vindication, i.e. (by implication) a penalty; punishment [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2680.desc: [G2680] κατασκευάζω kataskeuázō - from G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of G4632 (σκεῦος); to prepare thoroughly (properly, by external equipment; whereas G2090 (ἑτοιμάζω) refers rather to internal fitness); by implication, to construct, create; build, make, ordain, prepare [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4776.desc: [G4776] συγκαθίζω synkathízō - from G4862 (σύν) and G2523 (καθίζω); to give (or take) a seat in company with; (make) sit (down) together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G220.desc: [G220] ἀλέκτωρ aléktōr - from (to ward off); a cock or male fowl; cock [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3975.desc: [G3975] παχύνω pachýnō - from a derivative of G4078 (πήγνυμι) (meaning thick); to thicken, i.e. (by implication) to fatten (figuratively, stupefy or render callous); wax gross [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3582.desc: [G3582] ξέστης xéstēs - as if from (properly, to smooth; by implication, (of friction) to boil or heat); a vessel (as fashioned or for cooking) (or perhaps by corruption from the Latin sextarius, the sixth of a modius, i.e. about a pint), i.e. (specially), a measure for liquids or solids, (by analogy, a pitcher); pot [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3811.desc: [G3811] παιδεύω paideúō - from G3816 (παῖς); to train up a child, i.e. educate, or (by implication), discipline (by punishment); chasten(-ise), instruct, learn, teach [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4013.desc: [G4013] περιάγω periágō - from G4012 (περί) and G71 (ἄγω); to take around (as a companion); reflexively, to walk around; compass, go (round) about, lead about [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5477.desc: [G5477] Χαναάν Chanaán - of Hebrew origin (H03667); Chanaan (i.e. Kenaan), the early name of Palestine; Chanaan [BLB] [BibleHub]

G851.desc: [G851] ἀφαιρέω aphairéō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G138 (αἱρέομαι); to remove (literally or figuratively); cut (smite) off, take away [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1004.desc: [G1004] βόρβορος bórboros - of uncertain derivation; mud; mire [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3800.desc: [G3800] ὀψώνιον opsṓnion - neuter of a presumed derivative of the same as G3795 (ὀψάριον); rations for a soldier, i.e. (by extension) his stipend or pay; wages [BLB] [BibleHub]

G194.desc: [G194] ἄκρατος ákratos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G2767 (κεράννυμι); undiluted; without mixture [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4241.desc: [G4241] πρέπω prépō - apparently a primary verb; to tower up (be conspicuous), i.e. (by implication) to be suitable or proper (third person singular present indicative, often used impersonally, it is fit or right); become, comely [BLB] [BibleHub]

G287.desc: [G287] ἀμοιβή amoibḗ - from (to exchange); requital; requite [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1819.desc: [G1819] ἐξάπινα exápina - from G1537 (ἐκ) and a derivative of the same as G160 (αἰφνίδιος); of a sudden, i.e. unexpectedly; suddenly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1613.desc: [G1613] ἐκταράσσω ektarássō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G5015 (ταράσσω); to disturb wholly; exceedingly trouble [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2947.desc: [G2947] κυλιόω kylióō - from the base of G2949 (κῦμα) (through the idea of circularity; compare G2945 (κύκλῳ), G1507 (εἱλίσσω)); to roll about; wallow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2635.desc: [G2635] καταλαλέω katalaléō - from G2637 (κατάλαλος); to be a traducer, i.e. to slander; speak against (evil of) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3932.desc: [G3932] παρθενία parthenía - from G3933 (παρθένος); maidenhood; virginity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G276.desc: [G276] ἀμετάθετος ametáthetos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G3346 (μετατίθημι); unchangeable, or (neuter as abstract) unchangeability; immutable(-ility) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1674.desc: [G1674] Ἑλληνίς Hellēnís - feminine of G1672 (Ἕλλην); a Grecian (i.e. non-Jewish) woman; Greek [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1761.desc: [G1761] ἐνθύμησις enthýmēsis - from G1760 (ἐνθυμέομαι); deliberation; device, thought [BLB] [BibleHub]

G6.desc: [G6] Ἄβελ Ábel - of Hebrew origin (H01893); Abel, the son of Adam; Abel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1964.desc: [G1964] ἐπιορκέω epiorkéō - from G1965 (ἐπίορκος); to commit perjury; forswear self [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1559.desc: [G1559] ἐκδιώκω ekdiṓkō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G1377 (διώκω); to pursue out, i.e. expel or persecute implacably; persecute [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4221.desc: [G4221] ποτήριον potḗrion - neuter of a derivative of the alternate of G4095 (πίνω); a drinking-vessel; by extension, the contents thereof, i.e. a cupful (draught); figuratively, a lot or fate; cup [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3170.desc: [G3170] μεγαλύνω megalýnō - from G3173 (μέγας); to make (or declare) great, i.e. increase or (figuratively) extol; enlarge, magnify, shew great [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3015.desc: [G3015] λεπρός leprós - from the same as G3014 (λέπρα); scaly, i.e. leprous (a leper); leper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3478.desc: [G3478] Ναζαρέθ Nazaréth - of uncertain derivation; Nazareth or Nazaret, a place in Palestine; Nazareth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4908.desc: [G4908] συνετός synetós - from G4920 (συνίημι); mentally put (or putting) together, i.e. sagacious; prudent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2795.desc: [G2795] κινέω kinéō - from (poetic for , to go); to stir (transitively), literally or figuratively; (re-)move(-r), way [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3370.desc: [G3370] Μῆδος Mēdos - of foreign origin (compare H04074); a Median, or inhabitant of Media; Mede [BLB] [BibleHub]

G824.desc: [G824] ἄτοπος átopos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5117 (τόπος); out of place, i.e. (figuratively) improper, injurious, wicked; amiss, harm, unreasonable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G373.desc: [G373] ἀναπαύω anapaúō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G3973 (παύω); (reflexively) to repose (literally or figuratively (be exempt), remain); by implication, to refresh; take ease, refresh, (give, take) rest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G594.desc: [G594] ἀποδοχή apodochḗ - from G588 (ἀποδέχομαι); acceptance; acceptation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3543.desc: [G3543] νομίζω nomízō - from G3551 (νόμος); properly, to do by law (usage), i.e. to accustom (passively, be usual); by extension, to deem or regard; suppose, thing, be wont [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2125.desc: [G2125] εὐλαβέομαι eulabéomai - middle voice from G2126 (εὐλαβής); to be circumspect, i.e. (by implication) to be apprehensive; religiously, to reverence; (moved with) fear [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3652.desc: [G3652] Ὀλυμπᾶς Olympâs - probably a contraction from (Olympian-bestowed, i.e. heaven-descended); Olympas, a Christian; Olympas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3741.desc: [G3741] ὅσιος hósios - of uncertain affinity; properly, right (by intrinsic or divine character; thus distinguished from 1342, which refers rather to human statutes and relations; from G2413 (ἱερός), which denotes formal consecration; and from G40 (ἅγιος), which relates to purity from defilement), i.e. hallowed (pious, sacred, sure); holy, mercy, shalt be [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2682.desc: [G2682] κατασκήνωσις kataskḗnōsis - from G2681 (κατασκηνόω); an encamping, i.e. (figuratively) a perch; nest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2498.desc: [G2498] Ἰωσαφάτ Iōsaphát - of Hebrew origin (H03092); Josaphat (i.e. Jehoshaphat), an Israelite; Josaphat [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3419.desc: [G3419] μνημεῖον mnēmeîon - from G3420 (μνήμη); a remembrance, i.e. cenotaph (place of interment); grave, sepulchre, tomb [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4886.desc: [G4886] σύνδεσμος sýndesmos - from G4862 (σύν) and G1199 (δεσμόν); a joint tie, i.e. ligament, (figuratively) uniting principle, control; band, bond [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5441.desc: [G5441] φύλαξ phýlax - from G5442 (φυλάσσω); a watcher or sentry; keeper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2430.desc: [G2430] Ἰκόνιον Ikónion - perhaps from G1504 (εἰκών); image-like; Iconium, a place in Asia Minor; Iconium [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1316.desc: [G1316] διαχωρίζομαι diachōrízomai - from G1223 (διά) and the middle voice of G5563 (χωρίζω); to remove (oneself) wholly, i.e. retire; depart [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2019.desc: [G2019] ἐπιφωνέω epiphōnéō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G5455 (φωνέω); to call at something, i.e. exclaim; cry (against), give a shout [BLB] [BibleHub]

G162.desc: [G162] αἰχμαλωτεύω aichmalōteúō - from G164 (αἰχμάλωτος); to capture (like G163 (αἰχμαλωτίζω)); lead captive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2333.desc: [G2333] Θευδᾶς Theudâs - of uncertain origin; Theudas, an Israelite; Theudas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2078.desc: [G2078] ἔσχατος éschatos - a superlative probably from G2192 (ἔχω) (in the sense of contiguity); farthest, final (of place or time); ends of, last, latter end, lowest, uttermost [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5320.desc: [G5320] φανερῶς phanerōs - adverb from G5318 (φανερός); plainly, i.e. clearly or publicly; evidently, openly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4135.desc: [G4135] πληροφορέω plērophoréō - from G4134 (πλήρης) and G5409 (φορέω); to carry out fully (in evidence), i.e. completely assure (or convince), entirely accomplish; most surely believe, fully know (persuade), make full proof of [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5254.desc: [G5254] ὑπέχω hypéchō - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G2192 (ἔχω); to hold oneself under, i.e. endure with patience; suffer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1116.desc: [G1116] Γόμοῤῥα Gómorrha - of Hebrew origin (H06017); Gomorrha (i.e. Amorah), a place near the Dead Sea; Gomorrha [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1796.desc: [G1796] ἐνυβρίζω enybrízō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G5195 (ὑβρίζω); to insult; do despite unto [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5035.desc: [G5035] ταχύ tachý - neuter singular of G5036 (ταχύς) (as adverb); shortly, i.e. without delay, soon, or (by surprise) suddenly, or (by implication, of ease) readily; lightly, quickly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5171.desc: [G5171] τρυφάω trypháō - from G5172 (τρυφή); to indulge in luxury; live in pleasure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1956.desc: [G1956] ἐπιλύω epilýō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3089 (λύω); to solve further, i.e. (figuratively) to explain, decide; determine, expound [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2998.desc: [G2998] λατομέω latoméō - from the same as the first part of G2991 (λαξευτός) and the base of G5114 (τομώτερος); to quarry; hew [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5083.desc: [G5083] τηρέω tēréō - from (a watch; perhaps akin to G2334 (θεωρέω)); to guard (from loss or injury, properly, by keeping the eye upon; and thus differing from G5442 (φυλάσσω), which is properly to prevent escaping; and from G2892 (κουστωδία), which implies a fortress or full military lines of apparatus), i.e. to note (a prophecy; figuratively, to fulfil a command); by implication, to detain (in custody; figuratively, to maintain); by extension, to withhold (for personal ends; figuratively, to keep unmarried); by extension, to withhold (for personal ends; figuratively, to keep unmarried); hold fast, keep(- er), (pre-, re-)serve, watch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4059.desc: [G4059] περιτέμνω peritémnō - from G4012 (περί) and the base of G5114 (τομώτερος); to cut around, i.e. (specially) to circumcise; circumcise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4386.desc: [G4386] πρότερον próteron - neuter of G4387 (πρότερος) as adverb (with or without the article); previously; before, (at the) first, former [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4005.desc: [G4005] πεντηκοστή pentēkostḗ - feminine of the ordinal of G4004 (πεντήκοντα); fiftieth (G2250 (ἡμέρα) being implied) from Passover, i.e. the festival of "Pentecost"; Pentecost [BLB] [BibleHub]

G377.desc: [G377] ἀναπίπτω anapíptō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G4098 (πίπτω); to fall back, i.e. lie down, lean back; lean, sit down (to meat) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4028.desc: [G4028] περικαλύπτω perikalýptō - from G4012 (περί) and G2572 (καλύπτω); to cover all around, i.e. entirely (the face, a surface); blindfold, cover, overlay [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2253.desc: [G2253] ἡμιθανής hēmithanḗs - from a presumed compound of the base of G2255 (ἥμισυ) and G2348 (θνήσκω); half dead, i.e. entirely exhausted; half dead [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4871.desc: [G4871] συναλίζω synalízō - from G4862 (σύν) and (to throng); to accumulate, i.e. convene; assemble together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1223.desc: [G1223] διά diá - a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional); after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1658.desc: [G1658] ἐλεύθερος eleútheros - probably from the alternate of G2064 (ἔρχομαι); unrestrained (to go at pleasure), i.e. (as a citizen) not a slave (whether freeborn or manumitted), or (genitive case) exempt (from obligation or liability); free (man, woman), at liberty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G568.desc: [G568] ἀπέχω apéchō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G2192 (ἔχω); (actively) to have out, i.e. receive in full; (intransitively) to keep (oneself) away, i.e. be distant (literally or figuratively); be, have, receive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1220.desc: [G1220] δηνάριον dēnárion - of Latin origin; a denarius (or ten asses); pence, penny(-worth) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G305.desc: [G305] ἀναβαίνω anabaínō - from G303 (ἀνά) and the base of G939 (βάσις); to go up (literally or figuratively); arise, ascend (up), climb (go, grow, rise, spring) up, come (up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G923.desc: [G923] Βαρσαβᾶς Barsabâs - of Chaldee origin (H01247 and probably H06634); son of Sabas (or Tsaba); Bar-sabas, the name of two Israelites; Barsabas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2246.desc: [G2246] ἥλιος hḗlios - from (a ray; perhaps akin to the alternate of G138 (αἱρέομαι)); the sun; by implication, light; + east, sun [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4793.desc: [G4793] συγκρίνω synkrínō - from G4862 (σύν) and G2919 (κρίνω); to judge of one thing in connection with another, i.e. combine (spiritual ideas with appropriate expressions) or collate (one person with another by way of contrast or resemblance); compare among (with) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5318.desc: [G5318] φανερός phanerós - from G5316 (φαίνω); shining, i.e. apparent (literally or figuratively); neuter (as adverb) publicly, externally; abroad, + appear, known, manifest, open (+ -ly), outward (+ -ly) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1484.desc: [G1484] ἔθνος éthnos - probably from G1486 (ἔθω); a race (as of the same habit), i.e. a tribe; specially, a foreign (non-Jewish) one (usually, by implication, pagan); Gentile, heathen, nation, people [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4361.desc: [G4361] πρόσπεινος próspeinos - from G4314 (πρός) and the same as G3983 (πεινάω); hungering further, i.e. intensely hungry; very hungry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1646.desc: [G1646] ἐλάχιστος eláchistos - superlative of (short); used as equivalent to G3398 (μικρός); least (in size, amount, dignity, etc.); least, very little (small), smallest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G337.desc: [G337] ἀναιρέω anairéō - from G303 (ἀνά) and (the active of) G138 (αἱρέομαι); to take up, i.e. adopt; by implication, to take away (violently), i.e. abolish, murder; put to death, kill, slay, take away, take up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G598.desc: [G598] ἀποθλίβω apothlíbō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G2346 (θλίβω); to crowd (from every side); press [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1933.desc: [G1933] ἐπιεικής epieikḗs - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G1503 (εἴκω); appropriate, i.e. (by implication) mild; gentle, moderation, patient [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2023.desc: [G2023] ἐπιχορηγέω epichorēgéō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G5524 (χορηγέω); to furnish besides, i.e. fully supply, (figuratively) aid or contribute; add, minister (nourishment, unto) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2794.desc: [G2794] κίνδυνος kíndynos - of uncertain derivation; danger; peril [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5612.desc: [G5612] ὠρύομαι ōrýomai - middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to "roar"; roar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2867.desc: [G2867] κονιάω koniáō - from (dust; by analogy, lime); to whitewash; whiten [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4565.desc: [G4565] Σάρων Sárōn - of Hebrew origin (H08289); Saron (i.e. Sharon), a district of Palestine; Saron [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3895.desc: [G3895] παραπίπτω parapíptō - from G3844 (παρά) and G4098 (πίπτω); to fall aside, i.e. (figuratively) to apostatize; fall away [BLB] [BibleHub]

G883.desc: [G883] Ἀχαϊκός Achaïkós - from G882 (Ἀχαΐα); an Achaian; Achaicus, a Christian; Achaicus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G178.desc: [G178] ἀκατάκριτος akatákritos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G2632 (κατακρίνω); without (legal) trial; uncondemned [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5406.desc: [G5406] φονεύς phoneús - from G5408 (φόνος); a murderer (always of criminal (or at least intentional) homicide; which G443 (ἀνθρωποκτόνος) does not necessarily imply; while G4607 (σικάριος) is a special term for a public bandit); murderer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G813.desc: [G813] ἄτακτος átaktos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G5021 (τάσσω); unarranged, i.e. (by implication) insubordinate (religiously); unruly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2865.desc: [G2865] κομίζω komízō - from a primary (to tend, i.e. take care of); properly, to provide for, i.e. (by implication) to carry off (as if from harm; genitive case obtain); bring, receive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1112.desc: [G1112] γογγυσμός gongysmós - from G1111 (γογγύζω); a grumbling; grudging, murmuring [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5448.desc: [G5448] φυσιόω physióō - from G5449 (φύσις) in the primary sense of blowing; to inflate, i.e. (figuratively) make proud (haughty); puff up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4305.desc: [G4305] προμεριμνάω promerimnáō - from G4253 (πρό) and G3309 (μεριμνάω); to care (anxiously) in advance; take thought beforehand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2415.desc: [G2415] Ἱεροσολυμίτης Hierosolymítēs - from G2414 (Ἱεροσόλυμα); a Hierosolymite, i.e. inhabitant of Hierosolyma; of Jerusalem [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3604.desc: [G3604] Ὀζίας Ozías - of Hebrew origin (H05818); Ozias (i.e. Uzzijah), an Israelite; Ozias [BLB] [BibleHub]

G650.desc: [G650] ἀποστερέω aposteréō - from G575 (ἀπό) and (to deprive); to despoil; defraud, destitute, kept back by fraud [BLB] [BibleHub]

G816.desc: [G816] ἀτενίζω atenízō - from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a particle of union) and (to stretch); to gaze intently; behold earnestly (stedfastly), fasten (eyes), look (earnestly, stedfastly, up stedfastly), set eyes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1101.desc: [G1101] γλωσσόκομον glōssókomon - from G1100 (γλῶσσα) and the base of G2889 (κόσμος); properly, a case (to keep mouthpieces of wind-instruments in) i.e. (by extension) a casket or (specially) purse; bag [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4087.desc: [G4087] πικραίνω pikraínō - from G4089 (πικρός); to embitter (literally or figuratively); be (make) bitter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4941.desc: [G4941] Συντύχη Syntýchē - from G4940 (συντυγχάνω); an accident; Syntyche, a Christian female; Syntyche [BLB] [BibleHub]

G564.desc: [G564] ἀπερίτμητος aperítmētos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G4059 (περιτέμνω); uncircumcised (figuratively); uncircumcised [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1050.desc: [G1050] Γάϊος Gáïos - of Latin origin; Gaius (i.e. Caius), a Christian; Gaius [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1767.desc: [G1767] ἐννέα ennéa - a primary number; nine; nine [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3199.desc: [G3199] μέλω mélō - a primary verb; to be of interest to, i.e. to concern (only third person singular present indicative used impersonally, it matters); (take) care [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5595.desc: [G5595] ψωμίζω psōmízō - from the base of G5596 (ψωμίον); to supply with bits, i.e. (generally) to nourish; (bestow to) feed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3873.desc: [G3873] παράκειμαι parákeimai - from G3844 (παρά) and G2749 (κεῖμαι); to lie near, i.e. be at hand (figuratively, be prompt or easy); be present [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5029.desc: [G5029] τάχα tácha - as if neuter plural of G5036 (ταχύς) (adverbially); shortly, i.e. (figuratively) possibly; peradventure(-haps) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3849.desc: [G3849] παραβιάζομαι parabiázomai - from G3844 (παρά) and the middle voice of G971 (βιάζω); to force contrary to (nature), i.e. compel (by entreaty); constrain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3191.desc: [G3191] μελετάω meletáō - from a presumed derivative of G3199 (μέλω); to take care of, i.e. (by implication) revolve in the mind; imagine, (pre-)meditate [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5044.desc: [G5044] τεκνοτροφέω teknotrophéō - from a compound of G5043 (τέκνον) and G5142 (τρέφω); to be a childrearer, i.e. fulfil the duties of a female parent; bring up children [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4185.desc: [G4185] πολυτελής polytelḗs - from G4183 (πολύς) and G5056 (τέλος); extremely expensive; costly, very precious, of great price [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3590.desc: [G3590] ὄγδοος ógdoos - from G3638 (ὀκτώ); the eighth; eighth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5069.desc: [G5069] τετράδιον tetrádion - neuter of a presumed derivative of (a tetrad; from G5064 (τέσσαρες)); a quaternion or squad (picket) of four Roman soldiers; quaternion [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1706.desc: [G1706] ἐμπίπτω empíptō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G4098 (πίπτω); to fall on, i.e. (literally) to be entrapped by, or (figuratively) be overwhelmed with; fall among (into) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3991.desc: [G3991] πέμπτος pémptos - from G4002 (πέντε); fifth; fifth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G688.desc: [G688] Ἀραβία Arabía - of Hebrew origin (H06152); Arabia, a region of Asia; Arabia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3711.desc: [G3711] ὀργίλος orgílos - from G3709 (ὀργή); irascible; soon angry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3384.desc: [G3384] μήτηρ mḗtēr - apparently a primary word; a "mother" (literally or figuratively, immediate or remote); mother [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4848.desc: [G4848] συμπορεύομαι symporeúomai - from G4862 (σύν) and G4198 (πορεύομαι); to journey together; by implication, to assemble; go with, resort [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4432.desc: [G4432] πτωχεία ptōcheía - from G4433 (πτωχεύω); beggary, i.e. indigence (literally or figuratively); poverty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4176.desc: [G4176] πολιτεύομαι politeúomai - middle voice of a derivative of G4177 (πολίτης); to behave as a citizen (figuratively); let conversation be, live [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4557.desc: [G4557] σαρδόνυξ sardónyx - from the base of G4556 (σάρδιος) and (the nail of a finger; hence the "onyx" stone); a "sardonyx", i.e. the gem so called; sardonyx [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2617.desc: [G2617] καταισχύνω kataischýnō - from G2596 (κατά) and G153 (αἰσχύνομαι); to shame down, i.e. disgrace or (by implication) put to the blush; confound, dishonour, (be a-, make a-)shame(-d) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1303.desc: [G1303] διατίθεμαι diatíthemai - middle voice from G1223 (διά) and G5087 (τίθημι); to put apart, i.e. (figuratively) dispose (by assignment, compact, or bequest); appoint, make, testator [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2884.desc: [G2884] κόρος kóros - of Hebrew origin (H03734); a cor, i.e. a specific measure; measure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2051.desc: [G2051] ἐρίζω erízō - from G2054 (ἔρις); to wrangle; strive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1290.desc: [G1290] διασπορά diasporá - from G1289 (διασπείρω); dispersion, i.e. (specially and concretely) the (converted) Israelite resident in Gentile countries; (which are) scattered (abroad) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5624.desc: [G5624] ὠφέλιμος ōphélimos - from a form of G3786 (ὄφελος); helpful or serviceable, i.e. advantageous; profit(-able) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4051.desc: [G4051] περίσσευμα perísseuma - from G4052 (περισσεύω); a surplus, or superabundance; abundance, that was left, over and above [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1576.desc: [G1576] ἐκκλείω ekkleíō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2808 (κλείω); to shut out (literally or figuratively); exclude [BLB] [BibleHub]

G403.desc: [G403] ἀνάψυξις anápsyxis - from G404 (ἀναψύχω); properly, a recovery of breath, i.e. (figuratively) revival; revival [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1254.desc: [G1254] διακωλύω diakōlýō - from G1223 (διά) and G2967 (κωλύω); to hinder altogether, i.e. utterly prohibit; forbid [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3136.desc: [G3136] Μάρθα Mártha - probably of Chaldee origin (meaning mistress); Martha, a Christian woman; Martha [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3141.desc: [G3141] μαρτυρία martyría - from G3144 (μάρτυς); evidence given (judicially or genitive case); record, report, testimony, witness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5455.desc: [G5455] φωνέω phōnéō - from G5456 (φωνή); to emit a sound (animal, human or instrumental); by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation; call (for), crow, cry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G798.desc: [G798] ἄστρον ástron - neuter from G792 (ἀστήρ); properly, a constellation; put for a single star (natural or artificial); star [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2292.desc: [G2292] θαῤῥέω tharrhéō - another form for G2293 (θαρσέω); to exercise courage; be bold, X boldly, have confidence, be confident [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3140.desc: [G3140] μαρτυρέω martyréō - from G3144 (μάρτυς); to be a witness, i.e. testify (literally or figuratively); charge, give (evidence), bear record, have (obtain, of) good (honest) report, be well reported of, testify, give (have) testimony, (be, bear, give, obtain) witness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2362.desc: [G2362] θρόνος thrónos - from (to sit); a stately seat ("throne"); by implication, power or (concretely) a potentate; seat, throne [BLB] [BibleHub]

G150.desc: [G150] αἰσχρός aischrós - from the same as G153 (αἰσχύνομαι); shameful, i.e. base (specially, venal); filthy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3418.desc: [G3418] μνῆμα mnēma - from G3415 (μνάομαι); a memorial, i.e. sepulchral monument (burial-place); grave, sepulchre, tomb [BLB] [BibleHub]

G109.desc: [G109] ἀήρ aḗr - from (to breathe unconsciously, i.e. respire; by analogy, to blow); "air" (as naturally circumambient); air [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1407.desc: [G1407] δρέπανον drépanon - from (to pluck); a gathering hook (especially for harvesting); sickle [BLB] [BibleHub]

G878.desc: [G878] ἄφρων áphrōn - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5424 (φρήν); properly, mindless, i.e. stupid, (by implication) ignorant, (specially) egotistic, (practically) rash, or (morally) unbelieving; fool(-ish), unwise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2277.desc: [G2277] ἤτω ḗtō - third person singular imperative of G1510 (εἰμί); let him (or it) be; let … be [BLB] [BibleHub]

G475.desc: [G475] ἀντιδιατίθεμαι antidiatíthemai - from G473 (ἀντί) and G1303 (διατίθεμαι); to set oneself opposite, i.e. be disputatious; that oppose themselves [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3348.desc: [G3348] μετέχω metéchō - from G3326 (μετά) and G2192 (ἔχω); to share or participate; by implication, belong to, eat (or drink); be partaker, pertain, take part, use [BLB] [BibleHub]

G349.desc: [G349] ἀνακράζω anakrázō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G2896 (κράζω); to scream up (aloud); cry out [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5147.desc: [G5147] τρίβος tríbos - from (to "rub"; akin to , , and the base of G5131 (τράγος), G5134 (τραῦμα)); a rut or worn track; path [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3310.desc: [G3310] μερίς merís - feminine of G3313 (μέρος); a portion, i.e. province, share or (abstractly) participation; part (X -akers) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1265.desc: [G1265] διαμένω diaménō - from G1223 (διά) and G3306 (μένω); to stay constantly (in being or relation); continue, remain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3948.desc: [G3948] παροξυσμός paroxysmós - from G3947 (παροξύνω) ("paroxysm"); incitement (to good), or dispute (in anger); contention, provoke unto [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4874.desc: [G4874] συναναμίγνυμι synanamígnymi - from G4862 (σύν) and a compound of G303 (ἀνά) and G3396 (μίγνυμι); to mix up together, i.e. (figurative) associate with; (have, keep) company (with) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3073.desc: [G3073] Λυκία Lykía - probably remotely from G3074 (λύκος); Lycia, a province of Asia Minor; Lycia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2389.desc: [G2389] Ἰαννῆς Iannēs - of Egyptian origin; Jannes, an Egyptian; Jannes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2804.desc: [G2804] Κλαύδιος Klaúdios - of Latin origin; Claudius, the name of two Romans; Claudius [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4656.desc: [G4656] σκοτόω skotóō - from G4655 (σκότος); to obscure or blind (literally or figuratively); be full of darkness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5502.desc: [G5502] χερουβίμ cheroubím - plural of Hebrew origin (H03742); "cherubim" (i.e. cherubs or kerubim); cherubims [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2052.desc: [G2052] ἐριθεία eritheía - perhaps as the same as G2042 (ἐρεθίζω); properly, intrigue, i.e. (by implication) faction; contention(-ious), strife [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3432.desc: [G3432] μοιχός moichós - perhaps a primary word; a (male) paramour; figuratively, apostate; adulterer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G385.desc: [G385] ἀνασπάω anaspáō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G4685 (σπάω); to take up or extricate; draw up, pull out [BLB] [BibleHub]

G102.desc: [G102] ἀδύνατος adýnatos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G1415 (δυνατός); unable, i.e. weak (literally or figuratively); passively, impossible; could not do, impossible, impotent, not possible, weak [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3349.desc: [G3349] μετεωρίζω meteōrízō - from a compound of G3326 (μετά) and a collateral form of G142 (αἴρω) or perhaps rather G109 (ἀήρ) (compare "meteor"); to raise in mid-air, i.e. (figuratively) suspend (passively, fluctuate or be anxious); be of doubtful mind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4345.desc: [G4345] προσκληρόω prosklēróō - from G4314 (πρός) and G2820 (κληρόω); to give a common lot to, i.e. (figuratively) to associate with; consort with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1185.desc: [G1185] δελεάζω deleázō - from the base of G1388 (δόλος); to entrap, i.e. (figuratively) delude; allure, beguile, entice [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1231.desc: [G1231] διαγινώσκω diaginṓskō - from G1223 (διά) and G1097 (γινώσκω); to know thoroughly, i.e. ascertain exactly; (would) enquire, know the uttermost [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4969.desc: [G4969] σφάζω spházō - a primary verb; to butcher (especially an animal for food or in sacrifice) or (generally) to slaughter, or (specially), to maim (violently); kill, slay, wound [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2694.desc: [G2694] κατασύρω katasýrō - from G2596 (κατά) and G4951 (σύρω); to drag down, i.e. arrest judicially; hale [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2144.desc: [G2144] εὐπρόσδεκτος euprósdektos - from G2095 (εὖ) and a derivative of G4327 (προσδέχομαι); well-received, i.e. approved, favorable; acceptable(-ted) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2225.desc: [G2225] ζωογονέω zōogonéō - from the same as G2226 (ζῶον) and a derivative of G1096 (γίνομαι); to engender alive, i.e. (by analogy) to rescue (passively, be saved) from death; live, preserve [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3712.desc: [G3712] ὀργυιά orguiá - from G3713 (ὀρέγομαι); a stretch of the arms, i.e. a fathom; fathom [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1832.desc: [G1832] ἔξεστι éxesti - third person singular present indicative of a compound of G1537 (ἐκ) and G1510 (εἰμί); so also neuter present participle of the same (with or without some form of G1510 (εἰμί) expressed); impersonally, it is right (through the figurative idea of being out in public); be lawful, let, X may(-est) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3568.desc: [G3568] νῦν nŷn - a primary particle of present time; "now" (as adverb of date, a transition or emphasis); also as noun or adjective present or immediate; henceforth, + hereafter, of late, soon, present, this (time) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G389.desc: [G389] ἀναστενάζω anastenázō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G4727 (στενάζω); to sigh deeply; sigh deeply [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4094.desc: [G4094] πίναξ pínax - apparently a form of G4109 (πλάξ); a plate; charger, platter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4487.desc: [G4487] ῥῆμα rhēma - from G4483 (ῥέω); an utterance (individually, collectively or specially),; by implication, a matter or topic (especially of narration, command or dispute); with a negative naught whatever; + evil, + nothing, saying, word [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1913.desc: [G1913] ἐπιβιβάζω epibibázō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and a reduplicated derivative of the base of G939 (βάσις) (compare G307 (ἀναβιβάζω)); to cause to mount (an animal); set on [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5606.desc: [G5606] ὦμος ōmos - perhaps from the alternate of G5342 (φέρω); the shoulder (as that on which burdens are borne); shoulder [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1403.desc: [G1403] δοχή dochḗ - from G1209 (δέχομαι); a reception, i.e. convivial entertainment; feast [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3748.desc: [G3748] ὅστις hóstis - from G3739 (ὅς) and G5100 (τὶς); which some, i.e. any that; also (definite) which same; X and (they), (such) as, (they) that, in that they, what(-soever), whereas ye, (they) which, who(-soever) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2856.desc: [G2856] κολοβόω kolobóō - from a derivative of the base of G2849 (κολάζω); to dock, i.e. (figuratively) abridge; shorten [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5021.desc: [G5021] τάσσω tássō - a prolonged form of a primary verb (which latter appears only in certain tenses); to arrange in an orderly manner, i.e. assign or dispose (to a certain position or lot); addict, appoint, determine, ordain, set [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2707.desc: [G2707] καταφροντής kataphrontḗs - from G2706 (καταφρονέω); a contemner; despiser [BLB] [BibleHub]

G350.desc: [G350] ἀνακρίνω anakrínō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G2919 (κρίνω); properly, to scrutinize, i.e. (by implication) investigate, interrogate, determine; ask, question, discern, examine, judge, search [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2399.desc: [G2399] ἰδιώτης idiṓtēs - from G2398 (ἴδιος); a private person, i.e. (by implication) an ignoramus (compare "idiot"); ignorant, rude, unlearned [BLB] [BibleHub]

G214.desc: [G214] ἀλαλάζω alalázō - from ( a shout, "halloo"); to vociferate, i.e. (by implication) to wail; figuratively, to clang; tinkle, wail [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4161.desc: [G4161] ποίημα poíēma - from G4160 (ποιέω); a product, i.e. fabric (literally or figuratively); thing that is made, workmanship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5580.desc: [G5580] ψευδόχριστος pseudóchristos - from G5571 (ψευδής) and G5547 (Χριστός); a spurious Messiah; false Christ [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3479.desc: [G3479] Ναζαρηνός Nazarēnós - from G3478 (Ναζαρέθ); a Nazarene, i.e. inhabitant of Nazareth; of Nazareth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G978.desc: [G978] Βιθυνία Bithynía - of uncertain derivation; Bithynia, a region of Asia; Bithynia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3653.desc: [G3653] ὄλυνθος ólynthos - of uncertain derivation; an unripe (because out of season) fig; untimely fig [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3109.desc: [G3109] Μακεδονία Makedonía - from G3110 (Μακεδών); Macedonia, a region of Greece; Macedonia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4502.desc: [G4502] Ῥουβήν Rhoubḗn - of Hebrew origin (H07205); Ruben (i.e. Reuben), an Israelite; Reuben [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2220.desc: [G2220] ζυμόω zymóō - from G2219 (ζύμη); to cause to ferment; leaven [BLB] [BibleHub]

G325.desc: [G325] ἀναδίδωμι anadídōmi - from G303 (ἀνά) and G1325 (δίδωμι); to hand over; deliver [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3027.desc: [G3027] λῃστής lēistḗs - from (to plunder); a brigand; robber, thief [BLB] [BibleHub]

G448.desc: [G448] ἀνίλεως aníleōs - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2436 (ἵλεως); inexorable; without mercy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4675.desc: [G4675] σοῦ soû - genitive case of G4771 (σύ); of thee, thy; X home, thee, thine (own), thou, thy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3945.desc: [G3945] παρομοιάζω paromoiázō - from G3946 (παρόμοιος); to resemble; be like unto [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1067.desc: [G1067] γέεννα géenna - of Hebrew origin (H01516 and H02011); valley of (the son of) Hinnom; ge-henna (or Ge-Hinnom), a valley of Jerusalem, used (figuratively) as a name for the place (or state) of everlasting punishment; hell [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5552.desc: [G5552] χρύσεος chrýseos - from G5557 (χρυσός); made of gold; of gold, golden [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4619.desc: [G4619] σιτιστός sitistós - from a derivative of G4621 (σῖτος); grained, i.e. fatted; fatling [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5017.desc: [G5017] τάραχος tárachos - masculine from G5015 (ταράσσω); a disturbance, i.e. (popular) tumult; stir [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5184.desc: [G5184] Τύρος Týros - of Hebrew origin (H06865): Tyrus (i.e. Tsor), a place in Palestine ; Tyre [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4497.desc: [G4497] Ῥοβοάμ Rhoboám - of Hebrew origin (H07346); Roboam (i.e. Rechobam), an Israelite; Roboam [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2283.desc: [G2283] Θάμαρ Thámar - of Hebrew origin (H08559); Thamar (i.e. Tamar), an Israelitess; Thamar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G45.desc: [G45] ἄγκυρα ánkyra - from the same as G43 (ἀγκάλη); an "anchor" (as crooked); anchor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4751.desc: [G4751] στόμαχος stómachos - from G4750 (στόμα); an orifice (the gullet), i.e. (specially), the "stomach"; stomach [BLB] [BibleHub]

G294.desc: [G294] ἀμφιέννυμι amphiénnymi - from the base of G297 (ἀμφότερος) and (to invest); to enrobe; clothe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5243.desc: [G5243] ὑπερηφανία hyperēphanía - from G5244 (ὑπερήφανος); haughtiness; pride [BLB] [BibleHub]

G898.desc: [G898] βαθμός bathmós - from the same as G899 (βάθος); a step, i.e. (figuratively) grade (of dignity); degree [BLB] [BibleHub]

G944.desc: [G944] βάτραχος bátrachos - of uncertain derivation; a frog; frog [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5599.desc: [G5599] ὦ ō - a primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh; O [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1426.desc: [G1426] δυσφημία dysphēmía - from a compound of G1418 (δυσ-) and G5345 (φήμη); defamation; evil report [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1027.desc: [G1027] βροντή brontḗ - akin to (to roar); thunder; thunder(-ing) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5027.desc: [G5027] ταφή taphḗ - feminine from G2290 (θάπτω); burial (the act); X bury [BLB] [BibleHub]

G20.desc: [G20] ἀγαλλίασις agallíasis - from G21 (ἀγαλλιάω); exultation; specially, welcome; gladness, (exceeding) joy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G354.desc: [G354] ἀνάληψις análēpsis - from G353 (ἀναλαμβάνω); ascension; taking up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G152.desc: [G152] αἰσχύνη aischýnē - from G153 (αἰσχύνομαι); shame or disgrace (abstractly or concretely); dishonesty, shame [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2066.desc: [G2066] ἐσθής esthḗs - from (to clothe); dress; apparel, clothing, raiment, robe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5194.desc: [G5194] ὕαλος hýalos - perhaps from the same as G5205 (ὑετός) (as being transparent like rain); glass; glass [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2585.desc: [G2585] καπηλεύω kapēleúō - from (a huckster); to retail, i.e. (by implication) to adulterate (figuratively); corrupt [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3446.desc: [G3446] μόρφωσις mórphōsis - from G3445 (μορφόω); formation, i.e. (by implication), appearance (semblance or (concretely) formula); form [BLB] [BibleHub]

G517.desc: [G517] ἀόρατος aóratos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G3707 (ὁρατός); invisible; invisible (thing) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2533.desc: [G2533] Καϊάφας Kaïáphas - of Chaldee origin; the dell; Caiaphas (i.e. Cajepha), an Israelite; Caiaphas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4010.desc: [G4010] Πέργαμος Pérgamos - from G4444 (πύργος); fortified; Pergamus, a place in Asia Minor; Pergamos [BLB] [BibleHub]

G936.desc: [G936] βασιλεύω basileúō - from G935 (βασιλεύς); to rule (literally or figuratively); king, reign [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2360.desc: [G2360] θροέω throéō - from to wail; to clamor, i.e. (by implication) to frighten; trouble [BLB] [BibleHub]

G915.desc: [G915] βάρβαρος bárbaros - of uncertain derivation; a foreigner (i.e. non-Greek); barbarian(-rous) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1828.desc: [G1828] ἐξέλκω exélkō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G1670 (ἑλκύω); to drag forth, i.e. (figuratively) to entice (to sin); draw away [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4702.desc: [G4702] σπόριμος spórimos - from G4703 (σπόρος); sown, i.e. (neuter plural) a planted field; corn(-field) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5559.desc: [G5559] χρώς chrṓs - probably akin to the base of G5530 (χράομαι) through the idea of handling; the body (properly, its surface or skin); body [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5363.desc: [G5363] φιλανθρωπία philanthrōpía - from the same as G5364 (φιλανθρώπως); fondness of mankind, i.e. benevolence ("philanthropy"); kindness, love towards man [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2908.desc: [G2908] κρεῖσσον kreîsson - neuter of an alternate form of G2909 (κρείττων); (as noun) better, i.e. greater advantage; better [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4948.desc: [G4948] Σύρος Sýros - from the same as G4947 (Συρία); a Syran (i.e. probably Tyrian), a native of Syria; Syrian [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3689.desc: [G3689] ὄντως óntōs - adverb of the oblique cases of G5607 (ὤν); really; certainly, clean, indeed, of a truth, verily [BLB] [BibleHub]

G36.desc: [G36] ἀγενής agenḗs - from G1 (Α) (as negative particle) and G1085 (γένος); properly, without kin, i.e. (of unknown descent, and by implication) ignoble; base things [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3967.desc: [G3967] πατρικός patrikós - from G3962 (πατήρ); paternal, i.e. ancestral; of fathers [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4228.desc: [G4228] πούς poús - a primary word; a "foot" (figuratively or literally); foot(-stool) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2509.desc: [G2509] καθάπερ katháper - from G2505 (καθά) and G4007 (περ); exactly as; (even, as well) as [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5080.desc: [G5080] τήκω tḗkō - apparently a primary verb; to liquefy; melt [BLB] [BibleHub]

G352.desc: [G352] ἀνακύπτω anakýptō - from G303 (ἀνά) (in the sense of reversal) and G2955 (κύπτω); to unbend, i.e. rise; figuratively, be elated; lift up, look up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3200.desc: [G3200] μεμβράνα membrána - of Latin origin ("membrane"); a (written) sheep-skin; parchment [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3430.desc: [G3430] μοιχεία moicheía - from G3431 (μοιχεύω); adultery; adultery [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3524.desc: [G3524] νηφάλεος nēpháleos - from G3525 (νήφω); sober, i.e. (figuratively) circumspect; sober [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3448.desc: [G3448] μόσχος móschos - probably strengthened for (a shoot); a young bullock; calf [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4930.desc: [G4930] συντέλεια syntéleia - from G4931 (συντελέω); entire completion, i.e. consummation (of a dispensation); end [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3481.desc: [G3481] Ναθάν Nathán - of Hebrew origin (H05416); Nathan, an Israelite; Nathan [BLB] [BibleHub]

G10.desc: [G10] Ἀβιούδ Abioúd - of Hebrew origin (H031); Abihud, an Israelite; Abiud [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5381.desc: [G5381] φιλονεξία philonexía - from G5382 (φιλόξενος); hospitableness; entertain stranger, hospitality [BLB] [BibleHub]

G83.desc: [G83] ἀδηλότης adēlótēs - from G82 (ἄδηλος); uncertainty; X uncertain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4153.desc: [G4153] πνευματικῶς pneumatikōs - adverb from G4152 (πνευματικός); non-physically, i.e. divinely, figuratively; spiritually [BLB] [BibleHub]

G362.desc: [G362] ἀναμένω anaménō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G3306 (μένω); to await; wait for [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4603.desc: [G4603] σιδήρεος sidḗreos - from G4604 (σίδηρος); made of iron; (of) iron [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5041.desc: [G5041] τεκνογονέω teknogonéō - from a compound of G5043 (τέκνον) and the base of G1096 (γίνομαι); to be a child-bearer, i.e. parent (mother); bear children [BLB] [BibleHub]

G521.desc: [G521] ἀπαίδευτος apaídeutos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G3811 (παιδεύω); uninstructed, i.e. (figuratively) stupid; unlearned [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4110.desc: [G4110] πλάσμα plásma - from G4111 (πλάσσω); something moulded; thing formed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1814.desc: [G1814] ἐξάλλομαι exállomai - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G242 (ἅλλομαι); to spring forth ; leap up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G13.desc: [G13] Ἄγαβος Ágabos - of Hebrew origin (compare H02285); Agabus, an Israelite; Agabus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2702.desc: [G2702] καταφέρω kataphérō - from G2596 (κατά) and G5342 (φέρω) (including its alternate); to bear down, i.e. (figuratively) overcome (with drowsiness); specially, to cast a vote; fall, give, sink down [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2939.desc: [G2939] κτίστης ktístēs - from G2936 (κτίζω); a founder, i.e. God (as author of all things); Creator [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1803.desc: [G1803] ἕξ héx - a primary numeral; six; six [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2501.desc: [G2501] Ἰωσήφ Iōsḗph - of Hebrew origin (H03130); Joseph, the name of seven Israelites; Joseph [BLB] [BibleHub]

G730.desc: [G730] ἄῤῥην árrhēn - probably from G142 (αἴρω); male (as stronger for lifting); male, man [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4371.desc: [G4371] προσφάγιον prosphágion - neuter of a presumed derivative of a compound of G4314 (πρός) and G5315 (φάγω); something eaten in addition to bread, i.e. a relish (specially, fish; compare G3795 (ὀψάριον)); meat [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4985.desc: [G4985] σωματικῶς sōmatikōs - adverb from G4984 (σωματικός); corporeally or physically; bodily [BLB] [BibleHub]

G164.desc: [G164] αἰχμάλωτος aichmálōtos - from (a spear) and a derivative of the same as G259 (ἅλωσις); properly, a prisoner of war, i.e. (genitive case) a captive; captive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1969.desc: [G1969] ἐπιπλήσσω epiplḗssō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G4141 (πλήσσω); to chastise, i.e. (with words) to upbraid; rebuke [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2607.desc: [G2607] καταγινώσκω kataginṓskō - from G2596 (κατά) and G1097 (γινώσκω); to note against, i.e. find fault with; blame, condemn [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1468.desc: [G1468] ἐγκρατής enkratḗs - from G1722 (ἐν) and G2904 (κράτος); strong in a thing (masterful), i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) self-controlled (in appetite, etc.); temperate [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3497.desc: [G3497] Νεεμάν Neemán - of Hebrew origin (H05283); Neeman (i.e. Naaman), a Syrian; Naaman [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2463.desc: [G2463] ἶρις îris - perhaps from G2046 (ἐρέω) (as a symbol of the female messenger of the pagan deities); a rainbow ("iris"); rainbow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3456.desc: [G3456] μυκτηρίζω myktērízō - from a derivative of the base of G3455 (μυκάομαι) (meaning snout, as that whence lowing proceeds); to make mouths at, i.e. ridicule; mock [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5493.desc: [G5493] χείμαῤῥος cheímarrhos - from the base of G5494 (χειμών) and G4482 (ῥέω); a storm-runlet, i.e. winter-torrent; brook [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1464.desc: [G1464] ἐγκοπή enkopḗ - from G1465 (ἐγκόπτω); a hindrance; X hinder [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5189.desc: [G5189] τυφωνικός typhōnikós - from a derivative of G5188 (τύφω); stormy (as if smoky); tempestuous [BLB] [BibleHub]

G708.desc: [G708] Ἀρίσταρχος Arístarchos - from the same as G712 (ἄριστον) and G757 (ἄρχω); best ruling; Aristarchus, a Macedonian; Aristarchus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3667.desc: [G3667] ὁμοίωμα homoíōma - from G3666 (ὁμοιόω); a form; abstractly, resemblance; made like to, likeness, shape, similitude [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1810.desc: [G1810] ἐξαίφνης exaíphnēs - from G1537 (ἐκ) and the base of G160 (αἰφνίδιος); of a sudden (unexpectedly); suddenly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2834.desc: [G2834] Κνίδος Knídos - probably of foreign origin; Cnidus, a place in Asia Minor; Cnidus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3084.desc: [G3084] λυτρόω lytróō - from G3083 (λύτρον); to ransom (literally or figuratively); redeem [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1870.desc: [G1870] ἐπαισχύνομαι epaischýnomai - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G153 (αἰσχύνομαι); to feel shame for something; be ashamed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2966.desc: [G2966] κῶλον kōlon - from the base of G2849 (κολάζω); a limb of the body (as if lopped); carcase [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5175.desc: [G5175] Τρωγύλλιον Trōgýllion - of uncertain derivation; Trogyllium, a place in Asia Minor; Trogyllium [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1158.desc: [G1158] Δανιήλ Daniḗl - of Hebrew origin (H01840); Daniel, an Israelite; Daniel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3756.desc: [G3756] οὐ ou - a primary word; the absolute negative (compare G3361 (μή)) adverb; no or not; + long, nay, neither, never, no (X man), none, (can-)not, + nothing, + special, un(-worthy), when, + without, + yet but [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2254.desc: [G2254] ἡμῖν hēmîn - dative case plural of G1473 (ἐγώ); to (or for, with, by) us; our, (for) us, we [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5058.desc: [G5058] τελώνιον telṓnion - neuter of a presumed derivative of G5057 (τελώνης); a tax-gatherer's place of business; receipt of custom [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4300.desc: [G4300] προκυρόω prokyróō - from G4253 (πρό) and G2964 (κυρόω); to ratify previously; confirm before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G31.desc: [G31] ἀγγελία angelía - from G32 (ἄγγελος); an announcement, i.e. (by implication) precept; message [BLB] [BibleHub]

G508.desc: [G508] ἀνώγεον anṓgeon - from G507 (ἄνω) and G1093 (γῆ); above the ground, i.e. (properly) the second floor of a building; used for a dome or a balcony on the upper story; upper room [BLB] [BibleHub]

G622.desc: [G622] ἀπόλλυμι apóllymi - from G575 (ἀπό) and the base of G3639 (ὄλεθρος); to destroy fully (reflexively, to perish, or lose), literally or figuratively; destroy, die, lose, mar, perish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2284.desc: [G2284] θαμβέω thambéō - from G2285 (θάμβος); to stupefy (with surprise), i.e. astound; amaze, astonish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2581.desc: [G2581] Κανανίτης Kananítēs - of Chaldee origin (compare H07067); zealous; Cananites, an epithet; Canaanite (by mistake for a derivative from G5477 (Χαναάν)) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5518.desc: [G5518] χοῖνιξ choînix - of uncertain derivation; a chœnix or certain dry measure; measure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5458.desc: [G5458] φωστήρ phōstḗr - from G5457 (φῶς); an illuminator, i.e. (concretely) a luminary, or (abstractly) brilliancy; light [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5313.desc: [G5313] ὕψωμα hýpsōma - from G5312 (ὑψόω); an elevated place or thing, i.e. (abstractly) altitude, or (by implication) a barrier (figuratively); height, high thing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3506.desc: [G3506] νεύω neúō - apparently a primary verb; to "nod", i.e. (by analogy), signal; beckon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5025.desc: [G5025] ταύταις taútais - dative case and accusative case feminine plural respectively of G3778 (οὗτος); (to or with or by, etc.) these; hence, that, then, these, those [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3339.desc: [G3339] μεταμορφόω metamorphóō - from G3326 (μετά) and G3445 (μορφόω); to transform (literally or figuratively, "metamorphose"); change, transfigure, transform [BLB] [BibleHub]

G746.desc: [G746] ἀρχή archḗ - from G756 (ἄρχομαι); (properly abstract) a commencement, or (concretely) chief (in various applications of order, time, place, or rank); beginning, corner, (at the, the) first (estate), magistrate, power, principality, principle, rule [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1875.desc: [G1875] ἐπάν epán - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G302 (ἄν); a particle of indefinite contemporaneousness; whenever, as soon as; when [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4919.desc: [G4919] συνθρύπτω synthrýptō - from G4862 (σύν) and (to crumble); to crush together, i.e. (figuratively) to dispirit; break [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1299.desc: [G1299] διατάσσω diatássō - from G1223 (διά) and G5021 (τάσσω); to arrange thoroughly, i.e. (specially) institute, prescribe, etc.; appoint, command, give, (set in) order, ordain [BLB] [BibleHub]

G750.desc: [G750] ἀρχιποίμην archipoímēn - from G746 (ἀρχή) and G4166 (ποιμήν); a head shepherd; chief shepherd [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1948.desc: [G1948] ἐπικρίνω epikrínō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G2919 (κρίνω); to adjudge; give sentence [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3891.desc: [G3891] παρανομέω paranoméō - from a compound of G3844 (παρά) and G3551 (νόμος); to be opposed to law, i.e. to transgress; contrary to law [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4113.desc: [G4113] πλατεῖα plateîa - feminine of G4116 (πλατύς); a wide "plat" or "place", i.e. open square; street [BLB] [BibleHub]

G496.desc: [G496] ἀντιπίπτω antipíptō - from G473 (ἀντί) and G4098 (πίπτω) (including its alternate); to oppose; resist [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2629.desc: [G2629] κατακόπτω katakóptō - from G2596 (κατά) and G2875 (κόπτω); to chop down, i.e. mangle; cut [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4689.desc: [G4689] σπένδω spéndō - apparently a primary verb; to pour out as a libation, i.e. (figuratively) to devote (one's life or blood, as a sacrifice) ("spend"); (be ready to) be offered [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2983.desc: [G2983] λαμβάνω lambánō - a prolonged form of a primary verb, which is use only as an alternate in certain tenses; to take (in very many applications, literally and figuratively (properly objective or active, to get hold of; whereas G1209 (δέχομαι) is rather subjective or passive, to have offered to one; while G138 (αἱρέομαι) is more violent, to seize or remove)); accept, + be amazed, assay, attain, bring, X when I call, catch, come on (X unto), + forget, have, hold, obtain, receive (X after), take (away, up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G55.desc: [G55] ἁγνῶς hagnōs - adverb from G53 (ἁγνός); purely, i.e. honestly; sincerely [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5227.desc: [G5227] ὑπεναντίος hypenantíos - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G1727 (ἐναντίος); under (covertly) contrary to, i.e. opposed or (as noun) an opponent; adversary, against [BLB] [BibleHub]

G206.desc: [G206] ἄκρον ákron - neuter of an adjective probably akin to the base of G188 (ἀκμήν); the extremity; one end… other, tip, top, uttermost participle [BLB] [BibleHub]

G367.desc: [G367] Ἀνανίας Ananías - of Hebrew origin (H02608); Ananias, the name of three Israelites; Ananias [BLB] [BibleHub]

G251.desc: [G251] ἅλς háls - a primary word; "salt"; salt [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4582.desc: [G4582] σελήνη selḗnē - from (brilliancy; probably akin to the alternate of G138 (αἱρέομαι), through the idea of attractiveness); the moon; moon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1433.desc: [G1433] δωρέομαι dōréomai - middle voice from G1435 (δῶρον); to bestow gratuitously; give [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1786.desc: [G1786] ἐντόπιος entópios - from G1722 (ἐν) and G5117 (τόπος); a resident; of that place [BLB] [BibleHub]

G356.desc: [G356] ἀναλογία analogía - from a compound of G303 (ἀνά) and G3056 (λόγος); proportion; proportion [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1834.desc: [G1834] ἐξηγέομαι exēgéomai - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2233 (ἡγέομαι); to consider out (aloud), i.e. rehearse, unfold; declare, tell [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3801.lemma: ο ων και ο ην και ο ερχομενος
G3801.tlit: o on kai o ain kai o erchomenos
G3801.desc: [G3801] ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος ho ṑn kaí ho ēn kaí ho erchómenos - a phrase combining G3588 (ὁ) with the present participle and imperfect of G1510 (εἰμί) and the present participle of G2064 (ἔρχομαι) by means of G2532 (καί); the one being and the one that was and the one coming, i.e. the Eternal, as a divine epithet of Christ; which art (is, was), and (which) wast (is, was), and art (is) to come (shalt be) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2713.desc: [G2713] κατέναντι katénanti - from G2596 (κατά) and G1725 (ἔναντι); directly opposite; before, over against [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4375.desc: [G4375] προσφιλής prosphilḗs - from a presumed compound of G4314 (πρός) and G5368 (φιλέω); friendly towards, i.e. acceptable; lovely [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5341.desc: [G5341] φελόνης phelónēs - by transposition for a derivative probably of G5316 (φαίνω) (as showing outside the other garments); a mantle (surtout); cloke [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2443.desc: [G2443] ἵνα hína - probably from the same as the former part of G1438 (ἑαυτοῦ) (through the demonstrative idea; compare G3588 (ὁ)); in order that (denoting the purpose or the result); albeit, because, to the intent (that), lest, so as, (so) that, (for) to [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4465.desc: [G4465] ῥαβδοῦχος rhabdoûchos - from G4464 (ῥάβδος) and G2192 (ἔχω); a rod- (the Latin fasces) holder, i.e. a Roman lictor (constable or executioner); serjeant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3918.desc: [G3918] πάρειμι páreimi - from G3844 (παρά) and G1510 (εἰμί) (including its various forms); to be near, i.e. at hand; neuter present participle (singular) time being, or (plural) property; come, X have, be here, + lack, (be here) present [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4684.desc: [G4684] σπαταλάω spataláō - from (luxury); to be voluptuous; live in pleasure, be wanton [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3034.desc: [G3034] λιθάζω litházō - from G3037 (λίθος); to lapidate; stone [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4568.desc: [G4568] σάτον sáton - of Hebrew origin (H05429); a certain measure for things dry; measure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4303.desc: [G4303] προμαρτύρομαι promartýromai - from G4253 (πρό) and G3143 (μαρτύρομαι); to be a witness in advance i.e. predict; testify beforehand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5410.desc: [G5410] Φόρον Phóron - of Latin origin; a forum or market-place; only in comparative with G675 (Ἄππιος); a station on the Appian road; forum [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1235.desc: [G1235] διαγρηγορέω diagrēgoréō - from G1223 (διά) and G1127 (γρηγορεύω); to waken thoroughly; be awake [BLB] [BibleHub]

G894.desc: [G894] ἄψινθος ápsinthos - of uncertain derivation; wormwood (as a type of bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) calamity); wormwood [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1618.desc: [G1618] ἐκτενής ektenḗs - from G1614 (ἐκτείνω); intent; without ceasing, fervent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5062.desc: [G5062] τεσσαράκοντα tessarákonta - the decade of G5064 (τέσσαρες); forty; forty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4017.desc: [G4017] περιβλέπω periblépō - from G4012 (περί) and G991 (βλέπω); to look all around; look (round) about (on) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4624.desc: [G4624] σκανδαλίζω skandalízō - from G4625 (σκάνδαλον); to entrap, i.e. trip up (figuratively, stumble (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure); (make to) offend [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3763.desc: [G3763] οὐδέποτε oudépote - from G3761 (οὐδέ) and G4218 (ποτέ); not even at any time, i.e. never at all; neither at any time, never, nothing at any time [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3820.desc: [G3820] παλαιός palaiós - from G3819 (πάλαι); antique, i.e. not recent, worn out; old [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2470.desc: [G2470] ἴσος ísos - probably from G1492 (εἴδω) (through the idea of seeming); similar (in amount and kind); + agree, as much, equal, like [BLB] [BibleHub]

G670.desc: [G670] ἀποφορτίζομαι apophortízomai - from G575 (ἀπό) and the middle voice of G5412 (φορτίζω); to unload; unlade [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5208.desc: [G5208] ὕλη hýlē - perhaps akin to G3586 (ξύλον); a forest, i.e. (by implication) fuel; matter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4459.desc: [G4459] πῶς pōs - adverb from the base of G4226 (ποῦ); an interrogative particle of manner; in what way? (sometimes the question is indirect, how?); also as exclamation, how much!; how, after (by) what manner (means), that [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2927.desc: [G2927] κρυπτός kryptós - from G2928 (κρύπτω); concealed, i.e. private; hid(-den), inward(-ly), secret [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2615.desc: [G2615] καταδουλόω katadoulóō - from G2596 (κατά) and G1402 (δουλόω); to enslave utterly; bring into bondage [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1378.desc: [G1378] δόγμα dógma - from the base of G1380 (δοκέω); a law (civil, ceremonial or ecclesiastical); decree, ordinance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5412.desc: [G5412] φορτίζω phortízō - from G5414 (φόρτος); to load up (properly, as a vessel or animal), i.e. (figuratively) to overburden with ceremony (or spiritual anxiety); lade, by heavy laden [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1694.desc: [G1694] Ἐμμανουήλ Emmanouḗl - of Hebrew origin (H06005); God with us; Emmanuel, a name of Christ; Emmanuel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2077.desc: [G2077] ἔστω éstō - second person singular present imperative of G1510 (εἰμί); be thou; also , third person of the same; let them be; be [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2188.desc: [G2188] ἐφφαθά ephphathá - of Chaldee origin (H06606); be opened!; Ephphatha [BLB] [BibleHub]

G691.desc: [G691] ἀργέω argéō - from G692 (ἀργός); to be idle, i.e. (figuratively) to delay; linger [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4952.desc: [G4952] συσπαράσσω sysparássō - from G4862 (σύν) and G4682 (σπαράσσω); to rend completely, i.e. (by analogy) to convulse violently; throw down [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1448.desc: [G1448] ἐγγίζω engízō - from G1451 (ἐγγύς); to make near, i.e. (reflexively) approach; approach, be at hand, come (draw) near, be (come, draw) nigh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1005.desc: [G1005] βοῤῥᾶς borrhâs - of uncertain derivation; the north (properly, wind); north [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1183.desc: [G1183] δεκατόω dekatóō - from G1181 (δεκάτη); to tithe, i.e. to give or take a tenth; pay (receive) tithes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5296.desc: [G5296] ὑποτύπωσις hypotýpōsis - from a compound of G5259 (ὑπό) and a derivative of G5179 (τύπος); typification under (after), i.e. (concretely) a sketch (figuratively) for imitation; form, pattern [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1686.desc: [G1686] ἐμβάπτω embáptō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G911 (βάπτω); to whelm on, i.e. wet (a part of the person, etc.) by contact with a fluid; dip [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2791.desc: [G2791] Κιλικία Kilikía - probably of foreign origin; Cilicia, a region of Asia Minor; Cilicia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4665.desc: [G4665] σμάραγδος smáragdos - of uncertain derivation; the emerald or green gem so called; emerald [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3459.desc: [G3459] μύλων mýlōn - from G3458 (μύλος); a mill-house; mill [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3553.desc: [G3553] νόσημα nósēma - from G3552 (νοσέω); an ailment; disease [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2605.desc: [G2605] καταγγέλλω katangéllō - from G2596 (κατά) and the base of G32 (ἄγγελος); to proclaim, promulgate; declare, preach, shew, speak of, teach [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4325.desc: [G4325] προσδαπανάω prosdapanáō - from G4314 (πρός) and G1159 (δαπανάω); to expend additionally; spend more [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5298.desc: [G5298] ὑποχωρέω hypochōréō - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G5562 (χωρέω); to vacate down, i.e. retire quietly; go aside, withdraw self [BLB] [BibleHub]

G47.desc: [G47] ἁγνεία hagneía - from G53 (ἁγνός); cleanliness (the quality), i.e. (specially) chastity; purity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2165.desc: [G2165] εὐφραίνω euphraínō - from G2095 (εὖ) and G5424 (φρήν); to put (middle voice or passively, be) in a good frame of mind, i.e. rejoice; fare, make glad, be (make) merry, rejoice [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1108.desc: [G1108] γνῶσις gnōsis - from G1097 (γινώσκω); knowing (the act), i.e. (by implication) knowledge; knowledge, science [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3131.desc: [G3131] μάννα mánna - of Hebrew origin (H04478); manna (i.e. man), an edible gum; manna [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2151.desc: [G2151] εὐσεβέω eusebéō - from G2152 (εὐσεβής); to be pious, i.e. (towards God) to worship, or (towards parents) to respect (support); show piety, worship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2820.desc: [G2820] κληρόω klēróō - from G2819 (κλῆρος); to allot, i.e. (figuratively) to assign (a privilege); obtain an inheritance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5037.desc: [G5037] τέ té - a primary particle (enclitic) of connection or addition; both or also (properly, as correlation of G2532 (καί)); also, and, both, even, then, whether [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1584.desc: [G1584] ἐκλάμπω eklámpō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2989 (λάμπω); to be resplendent; shine forth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5114.desc: [G5114] τομώτερος tomṓteros - comparative of a derivative of the primary (to cut; more comprehensive or decisive than G2875 (κόπτω), as if by a single stroke; whereas that implies repeated blows, like hacking); more keen; sharper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3169.desc: [G3169] μεγαλοπρεπής megaloprepḗs - from G3173 (μέγας) and G4241 (πρέπω); befitting greatness or magnificence (majestic); excellent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1490.desc: [G1490] εἰ δὲ μή(γε) ei dè mḗ(ge) - from G1487 (εἰ), G1161 (δέ), and G3361 (μή) (sometimes with G1065 (γέ) added); but if not; (or) else, if (not, otherwise), otherwise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3393.desc: [G3393] μίασμα míasma - from G3392 (μιαίνω) ("miasma"); (morally) foulness (properly, the effect); pollution [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1409.desc: [G1409] Δρούσιλλα Droúsilla - a feminine diminutive of Drusus (a Roman name); Drusilla, a member of the Herodian family; Drusilla [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4600.desc: [G4600] σιαγών siagṓn - of uncertain derivation; the jaw-bone, i.e. (by implication) the cheek or side of the face; cheek [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1774.desc: [G1774] ἐνοικέω enoikéō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G3611 (οἰκέω); to inhabit (figuratively); dwell in [BLB] [BibleHub]

G25.desc: [G25] ἀγαπάω agapáō - perhaps from (much) (or compare G5689); to love (in a social or moral sense); (be-)love(-ed) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G12.desc: [G12] ἄβυσσος ábyssos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a variation of G1037 (βυθός); depthless, i.e. (specially) (infernal) "abyss"; deep, (bottomless) pit [BLB] [BibleHub]
