G1753.desc: [G1753] ἐνέργεια enérgeia - from G1756 (ἐνεργής); efficiency ("energy"); operation, strong, (effectual) working [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5267.desc: [G5267] ὑπόδικος hypódikos - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G1349 (δίκη); under sentence, i.e. (by implication) condemned; guilty [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3826.desc: [G3826] παμπληθεί pamplētheí - dative case (adverb) of a compound of G3956 (πᾶς) and G4128 (πλῆθος); in full multitude, i.e. concertedly or simultaneously; all at once [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1195.desc: [G1195] δεσμεύω desmeúō - from a (presumed) derivative of G1196 (δεσμέω); to be a binder (captor), i.e. to enchain (a prisoner), to tie on (a load); bind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5257.desc: [G5257] ὑπηρέτης hypērétēs - from G5259 (ὑπό) and a derivative of (to row); an under-oarsman, i.e. (generally) subordinate (assistant, sexton, constable); minister, officer, servant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4189.desc: [G4189] πονηρία ponēría - from G4190 (πονηρός); depravity, i.e. (specially), malice; plural (concretely) plots, sins; iniquity, wickedness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1795.desc: [G1795] ἐντυπόω entypóō - from G1722 (ἐν) and a derivative of G5179 (τύπος); to enstamp, i.e. engrave; engrave [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5295.desc: [G5295] ὑποτρέχω hypotréchō - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G5143 (τρέχω) (including its alternate); to run under, i.e. (specially), to sail past; run under [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1750.desc: [G1750] ἐνειλέω eneiléō - from G1772 (ἔννομος) and the base of G1507 (εἱλίσσω); to enwrap; wrap in [BLB] [BibleHub]

G285.desc: [G285] ἄμμος ámmos - perhaps from G260 (ἅμα); sand (as heaped on the beach); sand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1121.desc: [G1121] γράμμα grámma - from G1125 (γράφω); a writing, i.e. a letter, note, epistle, book, etc.; plural learning; bill, learning, letter, scripture, writing, written [BLB] [BibleHub]

G890.desc: [G890] ἄχρηστος áchrēstos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5543 (χρηστός); inefficient, i.e. (by implication) detrimental; unprofitable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1605.desc: [G1605] ἐκπλήσσω ekplḗssō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G4141 (πλήσσω); to strike with astonishment; amaze, astonish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3337.desc: [G3337] μεταλλάσσω metallássō - from G3326 (μετά) and G236 (ἀλλάσσω); to exchange; change [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4274.desc: [G4274] πρόδρομος pródromos - from the alternate of G4390 (προτρέχω); a runner ahead, i.e. scout (figuratively, precursor); forerunner [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2703.desc: [G2703] καταφεύγω katapheúgō - from G2596 (κατά) and G5343 (φεύγω); to flee down (away); flee [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4904.desc: [G4904] συνεργός synergós - from a presumed compound of G4862 (σύν) and the base of G2041 (ἔργον); a co-laborer, i.e. coadjutor; companion in labour, (fellow-)helper(-labourer, -worker), labourer together with, workfellow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1952.desc: [G1952] ἐπιλείπω epileípō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3007 (λείπω); to leave upon, i.e. (figuratively) to be insufficient for; fail [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2833.desc: [G2833] κνήθω knḗthō - from a primary (to scrape); to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to tickle; X itching [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2993.desc: [G2993] Λαοδίκεια Laodíkeia - from a compound of G2992 (λαός) and G1349 (δίκη); Laodicia, a place in Asia Minor; Laodicea [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4632.desc: [G4632] σκεῦος skeûos - of uncertain affinity; a vessel, implement, equipment or apparatus (literally or figuratively [specially, a wife as contributing to the usefulness of the husband]); goods, sail, stuff, vessel [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2324.desc: [G2324] θεράπων therápōn - apparently a participle from an otherwise obsolete derivative of the base of G2330 (θέρος); a menial attendant (as if cherishing); servant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4188.desc: [G4188] πόμα póma - from the alternate of G4095 (πίνω); a beverage; drink [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3562.desc: [G3562] νουνεχῶς nounechōs - adverb from a comparative of the accusative case of G3563 (νοῦς) and G2192 (ἔχω); in a mind-having way, i.e. prudently; discreetly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1772.desc: [G1772] ἔννομος énnomos - from G1722 (ἐν) and G3551 (νόμος); (subjectively) legal, or (objectively) subject to; lawful, under law [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2213.desc: [G2213] ζήτημα zḗtēma - from G2212 (ζητέω); a search (properly concretely), i.e. (in words) a debate; question [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4894.desc: [G4894] συνείδω syneídō - from G4862 (σύν) and G1492 (εἴδω); to see completely; used (like its primary) only in two past tenses, respectively meaning to understand or become aware, and to be conscious or (clandestinely) informed of; consider, know, be privy, be ware of [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2809.desc: [G2809] κλέμμα klémma - from G2813 (κλέπτω); stealing (properly, the thing stolen, but used of the act); theft [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3609.desc: [G3609] οἰκεῖος oikeîos - from G3624 (οἶκος); domestic, i.e. (as noun), a relative, adherent; (those) of the (his own) house(-hold) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3105.desc: [G3105] μαίνομαι maínomai - middle voice from a primary (to long for; through the idea of insensate craving); to rave as a "maniac"; be beside self (mad) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1143.desc: [G1143] δάκνω dáknō - a prolonged form of a primary root; to bite, i.e. (figuratively) thwart; bite [BLB] [BibleHub]

G454.desc: [G454] ἄνοια ánoia - from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G3563 (νοῦς); stupidity; by implication, rage; folly, madness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G812.desc: [G812] ἀτακτέω ataktéō - from G813 (ἄτακτος); to be (i.e. act) irregular; behave self disorderly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G735.desc: [G735] Ἄρτεμις Ártemis - probably from the same as G736 (ἀρτέμων); prompt; Artemis, the name of a Grecian goddess borrowed by the Asiatics for one of their deities; Diana [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2963.desc: [G2963] κυριότης kyriótēs - from G2962 (κύριος); mastery, i.e. (concretely and collectively) rulers; dominion, government [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3542.desc: [G3542] νομή nomḗ - feminine from the same as G3551 (νόμος); pasture, i.e. (the act) feeding (figuratively, spreading of a gangrene), or (the food) pasturage; X eat, pasture [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5253.desc: [G5253] ὑπερῷον hyperōion - neuter of a derivative of G5228 (ὑπέρ); a higher part of the house, i.e. apartment in the third story; upper chamber (room) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G375.desc: [G375] ἀναπέμπω anapémpō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G3992 (πέμπω); to send up or back; send (again) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G290.desc: [G290] ἀμπελών ampelṓn - from G288 (ἄμπελος); a vineyard; vineyard [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2038.desc: [G2038] ἐργάζομαι ergázomai - middle voice from G2041 (ἔργον); to toil (as a task, occupation, etc.), (by implication) effect, be engaged in or with, etc.; commit, do, labor for, minister about, trade (by), work [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1594.desc: [G1594] ἐκνήφω eknḗphō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G3525 (νήφω); (figuratively) to rouse (oneself) out of stupor; awake [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2181.desc: [G2181] Ἔφεσος Éphesos - probably of foreign origin; Ephesus, a city of Asia Minor; Ephesus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2821.desc: [G2821] κλῆσις klēsis - from a shorter form of G2564 (καλέω); an invitation (figuratively); calling [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1730.desc: [G1730] ἔνδειγμα éndeigma - from G1731 (ἐνδείκνυμι); an indication (concretely); manifest token [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4796.desc: [G4796] συγχαίρω synchaírō - from G4862 (σύν) and G5463 (χαίρω); to sympathize in gladness, congratulate; rejoice in (with) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5586.desc: [G5586] ψῆφος psēphos - from the same as G5584 (ψηλαφάω); a pebble (as worn smooth by handling), i.e. (by implication, of use as a counter or ballot) a verdict (of acquittal) or ticket (of admission); a vote; stone, voice [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4062.desc: [G4062] περιτρέπω peritrépō - from G4012 (περί) and the base of G5157 (τροπή); to turn around, i.e. (mentally) to craze; + make mad [BLB] [BibleHub]

G638.desc: [G638] ἀποπνίγω apopnígō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G4155 (πνίγω); to stifle (by drowning or overgrowth); choke [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2505.desc: [G2505] καθά kathá - from G2596 (κατά) and the neuter plural of G3739 (ὅς); according to which things, i.e. just as; as [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3491.desc: [G3491] ναῦς naûs - from or (to float); a boat (of any size); ship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5510.desc: [G5510] χιών chiṓn - perhaps akin to the base of G5490 (χάσμα) (G5465 (χαλάω)) or G5494 (χειμών) (as descending or empty); snow; snow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5191.desc: [G5191] ὑακίνθινος hyakínthinos - from G5192 (ὑάκινθος); "hyacinthine" or "jacinthine", i.e. deep blue; jacinth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2859.desc: [G2859] κόλπος kólpos - apparently a primary word; the bosom; by analogy, a bay; bosom, creek [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3592.desc: [G3592] ὅδε hóde - from G3588 (ὁ) and G1161 (δέ); the same, i.e. this or that one (plural these or those); often used as a personal pronoun; he, she, such, these, thus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3529.desc: [G3529] νίκη níkē - apparently a primary word; conquest (abstractly), i.e. (figuratively) the means of success; victory [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4331.desc: [G4331] προσεγγίζω prosengízō - from G4314 (πρός) and G1448 (ἐγγίζω); to approach near; come nigh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4181.desc: [G4181] πολυμερῶς polymerōs - adverb from a compound of G4183 (πολύς) and G3313 (μέρος); in many portions, i.e. variously as to time and agency (piecemeal); at sundry times [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4761.desc: [G4761] στρεβλόω streblóō - from a derivative of G4762 (στρέφω); to wrench, i.e. (specially), to torture (by the rack), but only figuratively, to pervert; wrest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5505.desc: [G5505] χιλιάς chiliás - from G5507 (χίλιοι); one thousand ("chiliad"); thousand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4180.desc: [G4180] πολυλογία polylogía - from a compound of G4183 (πολύς) and G3056 (λόγος); loquacity, i.e. prolixity; much speaking [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2428.desc: [G2428] ἱκετηρία hiketēría - from a derivative of the base of G2425 (ἱκανός) (through the idea of approaching for a favor); intreaty; supplication [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2191.desc: [G2191] ἔχιδνα échidna - of uncertain origin; an adder or other poisonous snake (literally or figuratively); viper [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1292.desc: [G1292] διάστημα diástēma - from G1339 (διΐστημι); an interval; space [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4279.desc: [G4279] προεπαγγέλλομαι proepangéllomai - middle voice from G4253 (πρό) and G1861 (ἐπαγγέλλω); to promise of old; promise before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2334.desc: [G2334] θεωρέω theōréō - from a derivative of G2300 (θεάομαι) (perhaps by addition of G3708 (ὁράω)); to be a spectator of, i.e. discern, (literally, figuratively (experience) or intensively (acknowledge)); behold, consider, look on, perceive, see [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5281.desc: [G5281] ὑπομονή hypomonḗ - from G5278 (ὑπομένω); cheerful (or hopeful) endurance, constancy; enduring, patience, patient continuance (waiting) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3694.desc: [G3694] ὀπίσω opísō - from the same as G3693 (ὄπισθεν) with enclitic of direction; to the back, i.e. aback (as adverb or preposition of time or place; or as noun); after, back(-ward), (+ get) behind, + follow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2510.desc: [G2510] καθάπτω katháptō - from G2596 (κατά) and G680 (ἅπτομαι); to seize upon; fasten on [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1507.desc: [G1507] εἱλίσσω heilíssō - a prolonged form of a primary but defective verb (of the same meaning); to coil or wrap; roll together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4240.desc: [G4240] πραΰτης praÿtēs - from G4239 (πραΰς); mildness, i.e. (by implication) humility; meekness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4126.desc: [G4126] πλέω pléō - probably a form of G4150 (πλύνω) (through the idea of plunging through the water); to pass in a vessel; sail [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3441.desc: [G3441] μόνος mónos - probably from G3306 (μένω); remaining, i.e. sole or single; by implication, mere; alone, only, by themselves [BLB] [BibleHub]

G866.desc: [G866] ἀφιλάργυρος aphilárgyros - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5366 (φιλάργυρος); unavaricious; without covetousness, not greedy of filthy lucre [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2043.desc: [G2043] ἐρείδω ereídō - of obscure affinity; to prop, i.e. (reflexively) get fast; stick fast [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3674.desc: [G3674] ὁμοῦ homoû - genitive case of (the same; akin to G260 (ἅμα)) as adverb; at the same place or time; together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2990.desc: [G2990] λανθάνω lanthánō - a prolonged form of a primary verb, which is used only as an alternate in certain tenses; to lie hid (literally or figuratively); often used adverbially, unwittingly; be hid, be ignorant of, unawares [BLB] [BibleHub]

G121.desc: [G121] ἄθωος áthōos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and probably a derivative of G5087 (τίθημι) (meaning a penalty); not guilty; innocent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1751.desc: [G1751] ἔνειμι éneimi - from G1772 (ἔννομος) and G1510 (εἰμί); to be within (neuter participle plural); such things as … have [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4877.desc: [G4877] συνάντησις synántēsis - from G4876 (συναντάω); a meeting with; meet [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3938.desc: [G3938] πάροδος párodos - from G3844 (παρά) and G3598 (ὁδός); a by-road, i.e. (actively) a route; way [BLB] [BibleHub]

G212.desc: [G212] ἀλαζονεία alazoneía - from G213 (ἀλαζών); braggadocio, i.e. (by implication) self-confidence; boasting, pride [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4142.desc: [G4142] πλοιάριον ploiárion - neuter of a presumed derivative of G4143 (πλοῖον); a boat; boat, little (small) ship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3383.desc: [G3383] μήτε mḗte - from G3361 (μή) and G5037 (τέ); not too, i.e. (in continued negation) neither or nor; also, not even; neither, (n-)or, so as much [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3765.desc: [G3765] οὐκέτι oukéti - from G3756 (οὐ) and G2089 (ἔτι); not yet, no longer; after that (not), (not) any more, henceforth (hereafter) not, no longer (more), not as yet (now), now no more (not), yet (not) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5523.desc: [G5523] Χοραζίν Chorazín - of uncertain derivation; Chorazin, a place in Palestine; Chorazin [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4747.desc: [G4747] στοιχεῖον stoicheîon - neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of G4748 (στοιχέω); something orderly in arrangement, i.e. (by implication) a serial (basal, fundamental, initial) constituent (literally), proposition (figuratively); element, principle, rudiment [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5169.desc: [G5169] τρύπημα trýpēma - from a derivative of the base of G5168 (τρυμαλιά); an aperture, i.e. a needle's eye; eye [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1304.desc: [G1304] διατρίβω diatríbō - from G1223 (διά) and the base of G5147 (τρίβος); to wear through (time), i.e. remain; abide, be, continue, tarry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4915.desc: [G4915] συνηλικιώτης synēlikiṓtēs - from G4862 (σύν) and a derivative of G2244 (ἡλικία); a co-aged person, i.e. alike in years; equal [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3852.desc: [G3852] παραγγελία parangelía - from G3853 (παραγγέλλω); a mandate; charge, command [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4267.desc: [G4267] προγινώσκω proginṓskō - from G4253 (πρό) and G1097 (γινώσκω); to know beforehand, i.e. foresee; foreknow (ordain), know (before) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1068.desc: [G1068] Γεθσημανῆ Gethsēmanē - of Chaldee origin (compare H01660 and H08081); oil-press; Gethsemane, a garden near Jerusalem; Gethsemane [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1401.desc: [G1401] δοῦλος doûlos - from G1210 (δέω); a slave (literal or figurative, involuntary or voluntary; frequently, therefore in a qualified sense of subjection or subserviency); bond(-man), servant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3591.desc: [G3591] ὄγκος ónkos - probably from the same as G43 (ἀγκάλη); a mass (as bending or bulging by its load), i.e. burden (hindrance); weight [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2114.desc: [G2114] εὐθυμέω euthyméō - from G2115 (εὔθυμος); to cheer up, i.e. (intransitively) be cheerful; neuter comparative (adverbially) more cheerfully; be of good cheer (merry) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5351.desc: [G5351] φθείρω phtheírō - probably strengthened from (to pine or waste); properly, to shrivel or wither, i.e. to spoil (by any process) or (generally) to ruin (especially figuratively, by moral influences, to deprave); corrupt (self), defile, destroy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G515.desc: [G515] ἀξιόω axióō - from G514 (ἄξιος); to deem entitled or fit; desire, think good, count (think) worthy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G530.desc: [G530] ἅπαξ hápax - probably from G537 (ἅπας); one (or a single) time (numerically or conclusively); once [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1376.desc: [G1376] διώκτης diṓktēs - from G1377 (διώκω); a persecutor; persecutor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2613.desc: [G2613] καταδικάζω katadikázō - from G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of G1349 (δίκη); to adjudge against, i.e. pronounce guilty; condemn [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4075.desc: [G4075] πετρώδης petrṓdēs - from G4073 (πέτρα) and G1491 (εἶδος); rock-like, i.e. rocky; stony [BLB] [BibleHub]

G731.desc: [G731] ἄῤῥητος árrhētos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and the same as G4490 (ῥητῶς); unsaid, i.e. (by implication) inexpressible; unspeakable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4485.desc: [G4485] ῥῆγμα rhēgma - from G4486 (ῥήγνυμι); something torn, i.e. a fragment (by implication and abstractly, a fall); ruin [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3460.desc: [G3460] Μύρα Mýra - of uncertain derivation; Myra, a place in Asia Minor; Myra [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1218.desc: [G1218] δῆμος dēmos - from G1210 (δέω); the public (as bound together socially); people [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1492.desc: [G1492] εἴδω eídō - a primary verb; used only in certain past tenses, the others being borrowed from the equivalent G3700 (ὀπτάνομαι) and G3708 (ὁράω); properly, to see (literally or figuratively); by implication, (in the perfect tense only) to know; be aware, behold, X can (+ not tell), consider, (have) know(-ledge), look (on), perceive, see, be sure, tell, understand, wish, wot [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5440.desc: [G5440] φυλακτήριον phylaktḗrion - neuter of a derivative of G5442 (φυλάσσω); a guard-case, i.e. "phylactery" for wearing slips of Scripture texts; phylactery [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2624.desc: [G2624] κατακληροδοτέω kataklērodotéō - from G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of a compound of G2819 (κλῆρος) and G1325 (δίδωμι); to be a giver of lots to each, i.e. (by implication) to apportion an estate; divide by lot [BLB] [BibleHub]

G570.desc: [G570] ἀπιστία apistía - from G571 (ἄπιστος); faithlessness, i.e. (negatively) disbelief (lack of Christian faith), or (positively) unfaithfulness (disobedience); unbelief [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5057.desc: [G5057] τελώνης telṓnēs - from G5056 (τέλος) and G5608 (ὠνέομαι); a tax-farmer, i.e. collector of public revenue; publican [BLB] [BibleHub]

G703.desc: [G703] ἀρέτη arétē - from the same as G730 (ἄῤῥην); properly, manliness (valor), i.e. excellence (intrinsic or attributed); praise, virtue [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5585.desc: [G5585] ψηφίζω psēphízō - from G5586 (ψῆφος); to use pebbles in enumeration, i.e. (generally) to compute; count [BLB] [BibleHub]

G599.desc: [G599] ἀποθνήσκω apothnḗskō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G2348 (θνήσκω); to die off (literally or figuratively); be dead, death, die, lie a-dying, be slain (X with) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4522.desc: [G4522] σαγήνη sagḗnē - from a derivative of (to equip) meaning furniture, especially a pack-saddle (which in the East is merely a bag of netted rope); a "seine" for fishing; net [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5089.desc: [G5089] τίλλω tíllō - perhaps akin to the alternate of G138 (αἱρέομαι), and thus to G4951 (σύρω); to pull off; pluck [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4160.desc: [G4160] ποιέω poiéō - apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do (in a very wide application, more or less direct); abide, + agree, appoint, X avenge, + band together, be, bear, + bewray, bring (forth), cast out, cause, commit, + content, continue, deal, + without any delay, (would) do(-ing), execute, exercise, fulfil, gain, give, have, hold, X journeying, keep, + lay wait, + lighten the ship, make, X mean, + none of these things move me, observe, ordain, perform, provide, + have purged, purpose, put, + raising up, X secure, shew, X shoot out, spend, take, tarry, + transgress the law, work, yield [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2887.desc: [G2887] κόσμιος kósmios - from G2889 (κόσμος) (in its primary sense); orderly, i.e. decorous; of good behaviour, modest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3733.desc: [G3733] ὄρνις órnis - probably from a prolonged form of the base of G3735 (ὄρος); a bird (as rising in the air), i.e. (specially), a hen (or female domestic fowl); hen [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4614.desc: [G4614] Σινᾶ Sinâ - of Hebrew origin (H05514); Sina (i.e. Sinai), a mountain in Arabia; Sina [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1394.desc: [G1394] δόσις dósis - from the base of G1325 (δίδωμι); a giving; by implication, (concretely) a gift; gift, giving [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1539.desc: [G1539] ἑκάστοτε hekástote - as if from G1538 (ἕκαστος) and G5119 (τότε); at every time; always [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3598.desc: [G3598] ὁδός hodós - apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress (the route, act or distance); figuratively, a mode or means; journey, (high-)way [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1319.desc: [G1319] διδασκαλία didaskalía - from G1320 (διδάσκαλος); instruction (the function or the information); doctrine, learning, teaching [BLB] [BibleHub]

G513.desc: [G513] ἀξίνη axínē - probably from (to break; compare G4486 (ῥήγνυμι)); an axe; axe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G640.desc: [G640] ἀπορία aporía - from the same as G639 (ἀπορέω); a (state of) quandary; perplexity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4294.desc: [G4294] προκαταρτίζω prokatartízō - from G4253 (πρό) and G2675 (καταρτίζω); to prepare in advance; make up beforehand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G51.desc: [G51] ἀγνόημα agnóēma - from G50 (ἀγνοέω); a thing ignored, i.e. shortcoming; error [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3868.desc: [G3868] παραιτέομαι paraitéomai - from G3844 (παρά) and the middle voice of G154 (αἰτέω); to beg off, i.e. deprecate, decline, shun; avoid, (make) excuse, intreat, refuse, reject [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2893.desc: [G2893] κουφίζω kouphízō - from (light in weight); to unload; lighten [BLB] [BibleHub]

G632.desc: [G632] ἀπονέμω aponémō - from G575 (ἀπό) and the base of G3551 (νόμος); to apportion, i.e. bestow; give [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1532.desc: [G1532] εἰστρέχω eistréchō - from G1519 (εἰς) and G5143 (τρέχω); to hasten inward; run in [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2057.desc: [G2057] Ἑρμᾶς Hermâs - probably from G2060 (Ἑρμῆς); Hermas, a Christian; Hermas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G187.desc: [G187] ἀκμάζω akmázō - from the same as G188 (ἀκμήν); to make a point, i.e. (figuratively) mature; be fully ripe [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2954.desc: [G2954] Κύπρος Kýpros - of uncertain origin; Cyprus, an island in the Mediterranean; Cyprus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2496.desc: [G2496] Ἰωράμ Iōrám - of Hebrew origin (H03141); Joram, an Israelite; Joram [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2110.desc: [G2110] εὐεργέτης euergétēs - from G2095 (εὖ) and the base of G2041 (ἔργον); a worker of good, i.e. (specially) a philanthropist; benefactor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1617.desc: [G1617] ἐκτενέστερον ektenésteron - neuter of the comparative of G1618 (ἐκτενής); more intently; more earnestly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1940.desc: [G1940] ἐπικαθίζω epikathízō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G2523 (καθίζω); to seat upon; set on [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1531.desc: [G1531] εἰσπορεύομαι eisporeúomai - from G1519 (εἰς) and G4198 (πορεύομαι); to enter (literally or figuratively); come (enter) in, go into [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3998.desc: [G3998] πενιχρός penichrós - prolongation from the base of G3993 (πένης); necessitous; poor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3584.desc: [G3584] ξηρός xērós - from the base of G3582 (ξέστης) (through the idea of scorching); arid; by implication, shrunken, earth (as opposed to water); dry land, withered [BLB] [BibleHub]

G930.desc: [G930] βασανιστής basanistḗs - from G928 (βασανίζω); a torturer; tormentor [BLB] [BibleHub]

G612.desc: [G612] ἀπόκρισις apókrisis - from G611 (ἀποκρίνομαι); a response; answer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1467.desc: [G1467] ἐγκρατεύομαι enkrateúomai - middle voice from G1468 (ἐγκρατής); to exercise self-restraint (in diet and chastity); can(-not) contain, be temperate [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2037.desc: [G2037] Ἔραστος Érastos - from (to love); beloved; Erastus, a Christian; Erastus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2028.desc: [G2028] ἐπονομάζω eponomázō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G3687 (ὀνομάζω); to name further, i.e. denominate; call [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2033.desc: [G2033] ἑπτά heptá - a primary number; seven; seven [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2712.desc: [G2712] κατείδωλος kateídōlos - from G2596 (κατά) (intensively) and G1497 (εἴδωλον); utterly idolatrous; wholly given to idolatry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5390.desc: [G5390] φιλοφρόνως philophrónōs - adverb from G5391 (φιλόφρων); with friendliness of mind, i.e. kindly; courteously [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5460.desc: [G5460] φωτεινός phōteinós - from G5457 (φῶς); lustrous, i.e. transparent or well-illuminated (figuratively); bright, full of light [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3397.desc: [G3397] μικρόν mikrón - masculine or neuter singular of G3398 (μικρός) (as noun); a small space of time or degree; a (little) (while) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5186.desc: [G5186] τυφλόω typhlóō - from G5185 (τυφλός); to make blind, i.e. (figuratively) to obscure; blind [BLB] [BibleHub]

G493.desc: [G493] Ἀντίπας Antípas - contracted for a compound of G473 (ἀντί) and a derivative of G3962 (πατήρ); Antipas, a Christian; Antipas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2825.desc: [G2825] κλίνη klínē - from G2827 (κλίνω); a couch (for sleep, sickness, sitting or eating); bed, table [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1008.desc: [G1008] βοτάνη botánē - from G1006 (βόσκω); herbage (as if for grazing); herb [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4576.desc: [G4576] σέβομαι sébomai - middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to revere, i.e. adore; devout, religious, worship [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1380.desc: [G1380] δοκέω dokéō - a prolonged form of a primary verb, (used only in an alternate in certain tenses; compare the base of G1166 (δεικνύω)) of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem (truthfully or uncertainly); be accounted, (of own) please(-ure), be of reputation, seem (good), suppose, think, trow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4808.desc: [G4808] συκῆ sykē - from G4810 (σῦκον); a fig-tree; fig tree [BLB] [BibleHub]

G52.desc: [G52] ἄγνοια ágnoia - from G50 (ἀγνοέω); ignorance (properly, the quality); ignorance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4014.desc: [G4014] περιαιρέω periairéō - from G4012 (περί) and G138 (αἱρέομαι) (including its alternate); to remove all around, i.e. unveil, cast off (anchor); figuratively, to expiate; take away (up) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2214.desc: [G2214] ζήτησις zḗtēsis - from G2212 (ζητέω); a searching (properly, the act), i.e. a dispute or its theme; question [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4319.desc: [G4319] προσαιτέω prosaitéō - from G4314 (πρός) and G154 (αἰτέω); to ask repeatedly (importune), i.e. solicit; beg [BLB] [BibleHub]

G503.desc: [G503] ἀντοφθαλμέω antophthalméō - from a compound of G473 (ἀντί) and G3788 (ὀφθαλμός); to face; bear up into [BLB] [BibleHub]

G451.desc: [G451] Ἄννα Ánna - of Hebrew origin (H02584); Anna, an Israelitess; Anna [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4381.desc: [G4381] προσωπολήπτης prosōpolḗptēs - from G4383 (πρόσωπον) and G2983 (λαμβάνω); an accepter of a face (individual), i.e. (specially), one exhibiting partiality; respecter of persons [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1683.desc: [G1683] ἐμαυτοῦ emautoû - genitive case compound of G1700 (ἐμοῦ) and G846 (αὐτός); of myself so likewise the dative case , and accusative case ; me, mine own (self), myself [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1328.desc: [G1328] διερμηνευτής diermēneutḗs - from G1329 (διερμηνεύω); an explainer; interpreter [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5397.desc: [G5397] φλύαρος phlýaros - from (to bubble); a garrulous person, i.e. prater; tattler [BLB] [BibleHub]

G40.desc: [G40] ἅγιος hágios - from (an awful thing) (compare G53 (ἁγνός), G2282 (θάλπω)); sacred (physically, pure, morally blameless or religious, ceremonially, consecrated); (most) holy (one, thing), saint [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1398.desc: [G1398] δουλεύω douleúō - from G1401 (δοῦλος); to be a slave to (literal or figurative, involuntary or voluntary); be in bondage, (do) serve(-ice) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1386.desc: [G1386] δόλιος dólios - from G1388 (δόλος); guileful; deceitful [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4339.desc: [G4339] προσήλυτος prosḗlytos - from the alternate of G4334 (προσέρχομαι); an arriver from a foreign region, i.e. (specially), an acceder (convert) to Judaism ("proselyte"); proselyte [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2770.desc: [G2770] κερδαίνω kerdaínō - from G2771 (κέρδος); to gain (literally or figuratively); (get) gain, win [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3413.desc: [G3413] Μιχαήλ Michaḗl - of Hebrew origin (H04317); Michael, an archangel; Michael [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1012.desc: [G1012] βουλή boulḗ - from G1014 (βούλομαι); volition, i.e. (objectively) advice, or (by implication) purpose; + advise, counsel, will [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2861.desc: [G2861] κολυμβήθρα kolymbḗthra - from G2860 (κολυμβάω); a diving-place, i.e. pond for bathing (or swimming); pool [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4685.desc: [G4685] σπάω spáō - a primary verb; to draw; draw (out) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5342.desc: [G5342] φέρω phérō - a primary verb (for which other, and apparently not cognate ones are used in certain tenses only; namely, ; and ; to "bear" or carry (in a very wide application, literally and figuratively, as follows); be, bear, bring (forth), carry, come, + let her drive, be driven, endure, go on, lay, lead, move, reach, rushing, uphold [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1053.desc: [G1053] Γαλατία Galatía - of foreign origin; Galatia, a region of Asia; Galatia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2705.desc: [G2705] καταφιλέω kataphiléō - from 2596 and 5368; to kiss earnestly; kiss [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1233.desc: [G1233] διάγνωσις diágnōsis - from G1231 (διαγινώσκω); (magisterial) examination ("diagnosis"); hearing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5230.desc: [G5230] ὑπέρακμος hypérakmos - from G5228 (ὑπέρ) and the base of G188 (ἀκμήν); beyond the "acme", i.e. figuratively (of a daughter) past the bloom (prime) of youth; + pass the flower of (her) age [BLB] [BibleHub]

G747.desc: [G747] ἀρχηγός archēgós - from G746 (ἀρχή) and G71 (ἄγω); a chief leader; author, captain, prince [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4362.desc: [G4362] προσπήγνυμι prospḗgnymi - from G4314 (πρός) and G4078 (πήγνυμι); to fasten to, i.e. (specially), to impale (on a cross); crucify [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2161.desc: [G2161] Εὔτυχος Eútychos - from G2095 (εὖ) and a derivative of G5177 (τυγχάνω); well- fated, i.e. fortunate; Eutychus, a young man; Eutychus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3120.desc: [G3120] μαλακός malakós - of uncertain affinity; soft, i.e. fine (clothing); figuratively, a catamite; effeminate, soft [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2839.desc: [G2839] κοινός koinós - probably from G4862 (σύν); common, i.e. (literally) shared by all or several, or (ceremonially) profane; common, defiled, unclean, unholy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3368.desc: [G3368] μηδέποτε mēdépote - from G3366 (μηδέ) and G4218 (ποτέ); not even ever; never [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3135.desc: [G3135] μαργαρίτης margarítēs - from (a pearl-oyster); a pearl; pearl [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2838.desc: [G2838] κοίμησις koímēsis - from G2837 (κοιμάω); sleeping, i.e. (by implication) repose; taking of rest [BLB] [BibleHub]

G698.desc: [G698] Ἀρεοπαγίτης Areopagítēs - from G697 (Ἄρειος Πάγος); an Areopagite or member of the court held on Mars' Hill; Areopagite [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5211.desc: [G5211] Ὑμεναῖος Hymenaîos - from (the god of weddings); "hymenæal"; Hymenæus, an opponent of Christianity; Hymenæus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G695.desc: [G695] ἀργυροκόπος argyrokópos - from G696 (ἄργυρος) and G2875 (κόπτω); a beater (i.e. worker) of silver; silversmith [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4784.desc: [G4784] συγκατατίθεμαι synkatatíthemai - middle from G4862 (σύν) and G2698 (κατατίθημι); to deposit (one's vote or opinion) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to accord with; consent [BLB] [BibleHub]

G176.desc: [G176] ἀκατάγνωστος akatágnōstos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a derivative of G2607 (καταγινώσκω); unblamable; that cannot be condemned [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2798.desc: [G2798] κλάδος kládos - from G2806 (κλάω); a twig or bough (as if broken off); branch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4282.desc: [G4282] προετοιμάζω proetoimázō - from G4253 (πρό) and G2090 (ἑτοιμάζω); to fit up in advance (literally or figuratively); ordain before, prepare afore [BLB] [BibleHub]

G741.desc: [G741] ἀρτύω artýō - from a presumed derivative of G142 (αἴρω); to prepare, i.e. spice (with stimulating condiments); season [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1980.desc: [G1980] ἐπισκέπτομαι episképtomai - middle voice from G1909 (ἐπί) and the base of G4649 (σκοπός); to inspect, i.e. (by implication) to select; by extension, to go to see, relieve; look out, visit [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4787.desc: [G4787] συγκινέω synkinéō - from G4682 (σπαράσσω) and G2795 (κινέω); to move together, i.e. (specially), to excite as a mass (to sedition); stir up [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2103.desc: [G2103] Εὔβουλος Eúboulos - from G2095 (εὖ) and G1014 (βούλομαι); good-willer; Eubulus, a Christian; Eubulus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5182.desc: [G5182] τυρβάζω tyrbázō - from (Latin turba, a crowd; akin to G2351 (θόρυβος)); to make "turbid", i.e. disturb; trouble [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3661.desc: [G3661] ὁμοθυμαδόν homothymadón - adverb from a compound of the base of G3674 (ὁμοῦ) and G2372 (θυμός); unanimously; with one accord (mind) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1935.desc: [G1935] ἐπιθανάτιος epithanátios - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G2288 (θάνατος); doomed to death; appointed to death [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4384.desc: [G4384] προτάσσω protássō - from G4253 (πρό) and G5021 (τάσσω); to pre-arrange, i.e. prescribe; before appoint [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1229.desc: [G1229] διαγγέλλω diangéllō - from G1223 (διά) and the base of G32 (ἄγγελος); to herald thoroughly; declare, preach, signify [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3156.desc: [G3156] Ματθαῖος Matthaîos - a shorter form of G3164 (μάχομαι); Matthæus (i.e. Matthitjah), an Israelite and a Christian; Matthew [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1922.desc: [G1922] ἐπίγνωσις epígnōsis - from G1921 (ἐπιγινώσκω); recognition, i.e. (by implication) full discernment, acknowledgement; (ac-)knowledge(-ing, - ment) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2852.desc: [G2852] κολαφίζω kolaphízō - from a derivative of the base of G2849 (κολάζω); to rap with the fist; buffet [BLB] [BibleHub]

G969.desc: [G969] βήρυλλος bḗryllos - of uncertain derivation; a "beryl"; beryl [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2670.desc: [G2670] καταποντίζω katapontízō - from G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of the same as G4195 (Πόντος); to plunge down, i.e. submerge; drown, sink [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3021.desc: [G3021] λευκαίνω leukaínō - from G3022 (λευκός); to whiten; make white, whiten [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2759.desc: [G2759] κέντρον kéntron - from (to prick); a point ("centre"), i.e. a sting (figuratively, poison) or goad (figuratively, divine impulse); prick, sting [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4944.desc: [G4944] συνωδίνω synōdínō - from G4862 (σύν) and G5605 (ὠδίνω); to have (parturition) pangs in company (concert, simultaneously) with, i.e. (figuratively) to sympathize (in expectation of relief from suffering); travail in pain together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5052.desc: [G5052] τελεσφορέω telesphoréō - from a compound of G5056 (τέλος) and G5342 (φέρω); to be a bearer to completion (maturity), i.e. to ripen fruit (figuratively); bring fruit to perfection [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4218.desc: [G4218] ποτέ poté - from the base of G4225 (πού) and G5037 (τέ); indefinite adverb, at some time, ever; afore-(any, some-)time(-s), at length (the last), (+ n- )ever, in the old time, in time past, once, when [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4293.desc: [G4293] προκαταγγέλλω prokatangéllō - from G4253 (πρό) and G2605 (καταγγέλλω); to anounce beforehand, i.e. predict, promise; foretell, have notice, (shew) before [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4940.desc: [G4940] συντυγχάνω syntynchánō - from G4862 (σύν) and G5177 (τυγχάνω); to chance together, i.e. meet with (reach); come at [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5495.desc: [G5495] χείρ cheír - perhaps from the base of G5494 (χειμών) in the sense of its congener the base of G5490 (χάσμα) (through the idea of hollowness for grasping); the hand (literally or figuratively (power); especially (by Hebraism) a means or instrument); hand [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1296.desc: [G1296] διαταγή diatagḗ - from G1299 (διατάσσω); arrangement, i.e. institution; instrumentality [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2674.desc: [G2674] καταριθμέω katarithméō - from G2596 (κατά) and G705 (ἀριθμέω); to reckon among; number with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G324.desc: [G324] ἀναδέχομαι anadéchomai - from G303 (ἀνά) and G1209 (δέχομαι); to entertain (as a guest); receive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5524.desc: [G5524] χορηγέω chorēgéō - from a compound of G5525 (χορός) and G71 (ἄγω); to be a dance-leader, i.e. (generally) to furnish; give, minister [BLB] [BibleHub]

G644.desc: [G644] ἀποσκίασμα aposkíasma - from a compound of G575 (ἀπό) and a derivative of G4639 (σκιά); a shading off, i.e. obscuration; shadow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2926.desc: [G2926] κρύπτη krýptē - feminine of G2927 (κρυπτός); a hidden place, i.e. cellar ("crypt"); secret [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4753.desc: [G4753] στράτευμα stráteuma - from G4754 (στρατεύομαι); an armament, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops (more or less extensive or systematic); army, soldier, man of war [BLB] [BibleHub]

G956.desc: [G956] βέλος bélos - from G906 (βάλλω); a missile, i.e. spear or arrow; dart [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2962.desc: [G2962] κύριος kýrios - from (supremacy); supreme in authority, i.e. (as noun) controller; by implication, Master (as a respectful title); God, Lord, master, Sir [BLB] [BibleHub]

G534.desc: [G534] ἀπάρτι apárti - from G575 (ἀπό) and G737 (ἄρτι); from now, i.e. henceforth (already); from henceforth [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3633.desc: [G3633] οἴομαι oíomai - middle voice apparently from G3634 (οἷος); to make like (oneself), i.e. imagine (be of the opinion); suppose, think [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5550.desc: [G5550] χρόνος chrónos - of uncertain derivation; a space of time (in general, and thus properly distinguished from G2540 (καιρός), which designates a fixed or special occasion; and from G165 (αἰών), which denotes a particular period) or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay; + years old, season, space, (X often-)time(-s), (a) while [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5112.desc: [G5112] τολμηρότερον tolmēróteron - neuter of the compound of a derivative of the base of 5111 (as adverb); more daringly, i.e. with greater confidence than otherwise; the more boldly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5389.desc: [G5389] φιλοτιμέομαι philotiméomai - middle voice from a compound of G5384 (φίλος) and G5092 (τιμή); to be fond of honor, i.e. emulous (eager or earnest to do something); labour, strive, study [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4921.desc: [G4921] συνιστάω synistáō - from G4862 (σύν) and G2476 (ἵστημι) (including its collateral forms); to set together, i.e. (by implication) to introduce (favorably), or (figuratively) to exhibit; intransitively, to stand near, or (figuratively) to constitute; approve, commend, consist, make, stand (with) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G181.desc: [G181] ἀκαταστασία akatastasía - from G182 (ἀκατάστατος); instability, i.e. disorder; commotion, confusion, tumult [BLB] [BibleHub]

G197.desc: [G197] ἀκριβέστερον akribésteron - neuter of the comparative of the same as G196 (ἀκριβέστατος); (adverbially) more exactly; more perfect(-ly) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G504.desc: [G504] ἄνυδρος ánydros - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5204 (ὕδωρ); waterless, i.e. dry; dry, without water [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2160.desc: [G2160] εὐτραπελία eutrapelía - from a compound of G2095 (εὖ) and a derivative of the base of G5157 (τροπή) (meaning well-turned, i.e. ready at repartee, jocose); witticism, i.e. (in a vulgar sense) ribaldry; jesting [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1583.desc: [G1583] ἐκλαλέω eklaléō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2980 (λαλέω); to divulge; tell [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5236.desc: [G5236] ὑπερβολή hyperbolḗ - from G5235 (ὑπερβάλλω); a throwing beyond others, i.e. (figuratively) supereminence; adverbially (with G1519 (εἰς) or G2596 (κατά)) pre- eminently; abundance, (far more) exceeding, excellency, more excellent, beyond (out of) measure [BLB] [BibleHub]

G940.desc: [G940] βασκαίνω baskaínō - akin to G5335 (φάσκω); to malign, i.e. (by extension) to fascinate (by false representations); bewitch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5216.desc: [G5216] ὑμῶν hymōn - genitive case of G5210 (ὑμεῖς); of (from or concerning) you; ye, you, your (own, -selves) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2269.desc: [G2269] Ἠσαῦ Ēsaû - of Hebrew origin (H06215); Esau, an Edomite; Esau [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2451.desc: [G2451] Ἰουδαϊκός Ioudaïkós - from G2453 (Ἰουδαῖος); Judaïc, i.e. resembling a Judæan; Jewish [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5382.desc: [G5382] φιλόξενος philóxenos - from G5384 (φίλος) and G3581 (ξένος); fond of guests, i.e. hospitable; given to (lover of, use) hospitality [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5224.desc: [G5224] ὑπάρχοντα hypárchonta - neuter plural of present participle active of G5225 (ὑπάρχω) as noun; things extant or in hand, i.e. property or possessions; goods, that which one has, things which (one) possesseth, substance, that hast [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1200.desc: [G1200] δεσμοφύλαξ desmophýlax - from G1199 (δεσμόν) and G5441 (φύλαξ); a jailer (as guarding the prisoners); jailor, keeper of the prison [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4760.desc: [G4760] στρατόπεδον stratópedon - from the base of G4756 (στρατιά) and the same as G3977 (πεδινός); a camping-ground, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops; army [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4866.desc: [G4866] συναθλέω synathléō - from G4862 (σύν) and G118 (ἀθλέω); to wrestle in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to seek jointly; labour with, strive together for [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2107.desc: [G2107] εὐδοκία eudokía - from a presumed compound of G2095 (εὖ) and the base of G1380 (δοκέω); satisfaction, i.e. (subjectively) delight, or (objectively) kindness, wish, purpose; desire, good pleasure (will), X seem good [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2676.desc: [G2676] κατάρτισις katártisis - from G2675 (καταρτίζω); thorough equipment (subjectively); perfection [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2755.desc: [G2755] κενόδοξος kenódoxos - from G2756 (κενός) and G1391 (δόξα); vainly glorifying, i.e. self-conceited; desirous of vain-glory [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2858.desc: [G2858] Κολοσσαεύς Kolossaeús - from G2857 (Κολοσσαί); a Colossæan, (i.e. inhabitant of Colossæ; Colossian [BLB] [BibleHub]

G736.desc: [G736] ἀρτέμων artémōn - from a derivative of G737 (ἄρτι); properly, something ready (or else more remotely from G142 (αἴρω) (compare G740 (ἄρτος)); something hung up), i.e. (specially) the topsail (rather foresail or jib) of a vessel; mainsail [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5020.desc: [G5020] ταρταρόω tartaróō - from (the deepest abyss of Hades); to incarcerate in eternal torment; cast down to hell [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3917.desc: [G3917] πάρδαλις párdalis - feminine of (a panther); a leopard; leopard [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4100.desc: [G4100] πιστεύω pisteúō - from G4102 (πίστις); to have faith (in, upon, or with respect to, a person or thing), i.e. credit; by implication, to entrust (especially one's spiritual well-being to Christ); believe(-r), commit (to trust), put in trust with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G849.desc: [G849] αὐτόχειρ autócheir - from G846 (αὐτός) and G5495 (χείρ); self-handed, i.e. doing personally; with … own hands [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5326.desc: [G5326] φάντασμα phántasma - from G5324 (φαντάζω); (properly concrete) a (mere) show ("phantasm"), i.e. spectre; spirit [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5331.desc: [G5331] φαρμακεία pharmakeía - from G5332 (φαρμακεύς); medication ("pharmacy"), i.e. (by extension) magic (literally or figuratively); sorcery, witchcraft [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1747.desc: [G1747] ἐνέδρα enédra - feminine from G1722 (ἐν) and the base of G1476 (ἑδραῖος); an ambuscade, i.e. (figuratively) murderous purpose; lay wait [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5400.desc: [G5400] φόβητρον phóbētron - neuter of a derivative of G5399 (φοβέω); a frightening thing, i.e. terrific portent; fearful sight [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5241.desc: [G5241] ὑπερεντυγχάνω hyperentynchánō - from G5228 (ὑπέρ) and G1793 (ἐντυγχάνω); to intercede in behalf of; make intercession for [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1601.desc: [G1601] ἐκπίπτω ekpíptō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G4098 (πίπτω); to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient; be cast, fail, fall (away, off), take none effect [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1604.desc: [G1604] ἐκπλήρωσις ekplḗrōsis - from G1603 (ἐκπληρόω); completion; accomplishment [BLB] [BibleHub]

G661.desc: [G661] ἀποτίνω apotínō - from G575 (ἀπό) and G5099 (τίνω); to pay in full; repay [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4723.desc: [G4723] στείρος steíros - a contraction from G4731 (στερεός) (as stiff and unnatural); "sterile"; barren [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3916.desc: [G3916] παραχρῆμα parachrēma - from G3844 (παρά) and G5536 (χρῆμα) (in its original sense); at the thing itself, i.e. instantly; forthwith, immediately, presently, straightway, soon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2397.desc: [G2397] ἰδέα idéa - from G1492 (εἴδω); a sight (comparative figuratively "idea"), i.e. aspect; countenance [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5090.desc: [G5090] Τιμαῖος Timaîos - probably of Chaldee origin (compare H02931); Timæus (i.e. Timay), an Israelite; Timæus [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2895.desc: [G2895] κράββατος krábbatos - probably of foreign origin; a mattress; bed [BLB] [BibleHub]

G729.desc: [G729] ἄῤῥαφος árrhaphos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of the same as G4476 (ῥαφίς); unsewed, i.e. of a single piece; without seam [BLB] [BibleHub]

G579.desc: [G579] ἀπόβλητος apóblētos - from G577 (ἀποβάλλω); cast off, i.e. (figuratively) such as to be rejected; be refused [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1073.desc: [G1073] γέμω gémō - a primary verb; to swell out, i.e. be full; be full [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3195.desc: [G3195] μέλλω méllō - a strengthened form of G3199 (μέλω) (through the idea of expectation); to intend, i.e. be about to be, do, or suffer something (of persons or things, especially events; in the sense of purpose, duty, necessity, probability, possibility, or hesitation); about, after that, be (almost), (that which is, things, + which was for) to come, intend, was to (be), mean, mind, be at the point, (be) ready, + return, shall (begin), (which, that) should (after, afterwards, hereafter) tarry, which was for, will, would, be yet [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2467.desc: [G2467] ἴσημι ísēmi - assumed by some as the base of certain irregular forms of G1492 (εἴδω); to know; know [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1982.desc: [G1982] ἐπισκιάζω episkiázō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and a derivative of G4639 (σκιά); to cast a shade upon, i.e. (by analogy) to envelop in a haze of brilliancy; figuratively, to invest with preternatural influence; overshadow [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2197.desc: [G2197] Ζαχαρίας Zacharías - of Hebrew origin (H02148); Zacharias (i.e. Zechariah), the name of two Israelites; Zacharias [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3175.desc: [G3175] μεγιστᾶνες megistânes - plural from G3176 (μέγιστος); grandees; great men, lords [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1340.desc: [G1340] διϊσχυρίζομαι diïschyrízomai - from G1223 (διά) and a derivative of G2478 (ἰσχυρός); to stout it through, i.e. asservate; confidently (constantly) affirm [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2027.desc: [G2027] ἐποκέλλω epokéllō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and (to urge); to drive upon the shore, i.e. to beach a vessel; run aground [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3980.desc: [G3980] πειθαρχέω peitharchéō - from a compound of G3982 (πείθω) and G757 (ἄρχω); to be persuaded by a ruler, i.e. (genitive case) to submit to authority; by analogy, to conform to advice; hearken, obey (magistrates) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1573.desc: [G1573] ἐκκακέω ekkakéō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2556 (κακός); to be (bad or) weak, i.e. (by implication) to fail (in heart); faint, be weary [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1456.desc: [G1456] ἐγκαίνια enkaínia - neuter plural of a presumed compound from G1722 (ἐν) and G2537 (καινός); innovatives, i.e. (specially) renewal (of religious services after the Antiochian interruption); dedication [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3924.desc: [G3924] παρεκτός parektós - from G3844 (παρά) and G1622 (ἐκτός); near outside, i.e. besides; except, saving, without [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2464.desc: [G2464] Ἰσαάκ Isaák - of Hebrew origin (H03327); Isaac (i.e. Jitschak), the son of Abraham; Isaac [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5288.desc: [G5288] ὑποστέλλω hypostéllō - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G4724 (στέλλω); to withhold under (out of sight), i.e. (reflexively) to cower or shrink, (figuratively) to conceal (reserve); draw (keep) back, shun, withdraw [BLB] [BibleHub]

G240.desc: [G240] ἀλλήλων allḗlōn - Genitive plural from G243 (ἄλλος) reduplicated; one another; each other, mutual, one another, (the other), (them-, your-)selves, (selves) together (sometimes with G3326 (μετά) or G4314 (πρός)) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2616.desc: [G2616] καταδυναστεύω katadynasteúō - from G2596 (κατά) and a derivative of G1413 (δυνάστης); to exercise dominion against, i.e. oppress; oppress [BLB] [BibleHub]

G419.desc: [G419] ἀνεξερεύνητος anexereúnētos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of G1830 (ἐξερευνάω); not searched out, i.e. (by implication) inscrutable; unsearchable [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1429.desc: [G1429] δωδεκάφυλον dōdekáphylon - from G1427 (δώδεκα) and G5443 (φυλή); the commonwealth of Israel; twelve tribes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2256.desc: [G2256] ἡμιώριον hēmiṓrion - from the base of G2255 (ἥμισυ) and G5610 (ὥρα); a half-hour; half an hour [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3662.desc: [G3662] ὁμοιάζω homoiázō - from G3664 (ὅμοιος); to resemble; agree [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5.desc: [G5] Ἀββᾶ Abbâ - of Chaldee origin (H02); father as a vocative; Abba [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5593.desc: [G5593] ψυχρός psychrós - from G5592 (ψύχος); chilly (literally or figuratively); cold [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3334.desc: [G3334] μετακινέω metakinéō - from G3326 (μετά) and G2795 (κινέω); to stir to a place elsewhere, i.e. remove (figuratively); move away [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1717.desc: [G1717] ἐμφανής emphanḗs - from a compound of G1722 (ἐν) and G5316 (φαίνω); apparent in self; manifest, openly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4649.desc: [G4649] σκοπός skopós - from (to peer about ("skeptic"); perhaps akin to G4626 (σκάπτω) through the idea of concealment; compare G4629 (σκέπασμα)); a watch (sentry or scout), i.e. (by implication) a goal; mark [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1100.desc: [G1100] γλῶσσα glōssa - of uncertain affinity; the tongue; by implication, a language (specially, one naturally unacquired); tongue [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2258.desc: [G2258] ἦν ēn - imperfect of G1510 (εἰμί); I (thou, etc.) was (wast or were); + agree, be, X have (+ charge of), hold, use, was(-t), were [BLB] [BibleHub]

G769.desc: [G769] ἀσθένεια asthéneia - from G772 (ἀσθενής); feebleness (of mind or body); by implication, malady; morally, frailty; disease, infirmity, sickness, weakness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5404.desc: [G5404] φοῖνιξ phoînix - of uncertain derivation; a palm-tree; palm (tree) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1486.desc: [G1486] ἔθω éthō - a primary verb; to be used (by habit or conventionality); neuter perfect participle usage; be custom (manner, wont) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4770.desc: [G4770] Στωϊκός Stōïkós - from G4745 (στοά); a "Stoic" (as occupying a particular porch in Athens), i.e. adherent of a certin philosophy; Stoick [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1129.desc: [G1129] γυμνασία gymnasía - from G1128 (γυμνάζω); training, i.e. (figuratively) asceticism; exercise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5148.desc: [G5148] τριετία trietía - from a compound of G5140 (τρεῖς) and G2094 (ἔτος); a three years' period (triennium); space of three years [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4168.desc: [G4168] ποίμνιον poímnion - neuter of a presumed derivative of G4167 (ποίμνη); a flock, i.e. (figuratively) group (of believers); flock [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1580.desc: [G1580] ἐκκομίζω ekkomízō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G2865 (κομίζω); to bear forth (to burial); carry out [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2889.desc: [G2889] κόσμος kósmos - probably from the base of G2865 (κομίζω); orderly arrangement, i.e. decoration; by implication, the world (in a wide or narrow sense, including its inhabitants, literally or figuratively (morally)); adorning, world [BLB] [BibleHub]

G680.desc: [G680] ἅπτομαι háptomai - reflexive of G681 (ἅπτω); properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. to touch (in many implied relations); touch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2287.desc: [G2287] θανατήφορος thanatḗphoros - from (the feminine form of) G2288 (θάνατος) and G5342 (φέρω); death-bearing, i.e. fatal; deadly [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1843.desc: [G1843] ἐξομολογέω exomologéō - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G3670 (ὁμολογέω); to acknowledge or (by implication, of assent) agree fully; confess, profess, promise [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4244.desc: [G4244] πρεσβυτέριον presbytérion - neuter of a presumed derivative of G4245 (πρεσβύτερος); the order of elders, i.e. (specially), Israelite Sanhedrin or Christian "presbytery"; (estate of) elder(-s), presbytery [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2747.desc: [G2747] Κεγχρεαί Kenchreaí - probably from kegchros (millet); Cenchreæ, a port of Corinth; Cencrea [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3071.desc: [G3071] Λυκαονία Lykaonía - perhaps remotely from G3074 (λύκος); Lycaonia, a region of Asia Minor; Lycaonia [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1460.desc: [G1460] ἐγκατοικέω enkatoikéō - from G1722 (ἐν) and G2730 (κατοικέω); to settle down in a place, i.e. reside; dwell among [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4621.desc: [G4621] σῖτος sîtos - of uncertain derivation; grain, especially wheat; corn, wheat [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4666.desc: [G4666] σμύρνα smýrna - apparently strengthened for G3464 (μύρον); myrrh; myrrh [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4962.desc: [G4962] συστρέφω systréphō - from G4862 (σύν) and G4762 (στρέφω); to twist together, i.e. collect (a bundle, a crowd); gather [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2521.desc: [G2521] κάθημαι káthēmai - from G2596 (κατά); and (to sit; akin to the base of G1476 (ἑδραῖος)); to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside; dwell, sit (by, down) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1541.desc: [G1541] ἑκατονταέτης hekatontaétēs - from G1540 (ἑκατόν) and G2094 (ἔτος); centenarian; hundred years old [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3814.desc: [G3814] παιδίσκη paidískē - feminine diminutive of G3816 (παῖς); a girl, i.e. (specially), a female slave or servant; bondmaid(-woman), damsel, maid(-en) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4201.desc: [G4201] Πόρκιος Pórkios - of Latin origin; apparently swinish; Porcius, a Roman; Porcius [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1888.desc: [G1888] ἐπαυτοφώρῳ epautophṓrōi - from G1909 (ἐπί) and G846 (αὐτός) and (the dative case singular of) a derivative of (a thief); in theft itself, i.e. (by analogy) in actual crime; in the very act [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5096.desc: [G5096] Τίμων Tímōn - from G5092 (τιμή); valuable; Timon, a Christian; Timon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G112.desc: [G112] ἄθεος átheos - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G2316 (θεός); godless; without God [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2979.desc: [G2979] λακτίζω laktízō - from adverb (heelwise); to recalcitrate; kick [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2404.desc: [G2404] Ἱεράπολις Hierápolis - from G2413 (ἱερός) and G4172 (πόλις); holy city; Hierapolis, a place in Asia Minor; Hierapolis [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4885.desc: [G4885] συναυξάνω synauxánō - from G4862 (σύν) and G837 (αὐξάνω); to increase (grow up) together; grow together [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3729.desc: [G3729] ὁρμάω hormáō - from G3730 (ὁρμή); to start, spur or urge on, i.e. (reflexively) to dash or plunge; run (violently), rush [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4102.desc: [G4102] πίστις pístis - from G3982 (πείθω); persuasion, i.e. credence; moral conviction (of religious truth, or the truthfulness of God or a religious teacher), especially reliance upon Christ for salvation; abstractly, constancy in such profession; by extension, the system of religious (Gospel) truth itself; assurance, belief, believe, faith, fidelity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2788.desc: [G2788] κιθάρα kithára - of uncertain affinity; a lyre; harp [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3858.desc: [G3858] παραδέχομαι paradéchomai - from G3844 (παρά) and G1209 (δέχομαι); to accept near, i.e. admit or (by implication) delight in; receive [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1271.desc: [G1271] διάνοια diánoia - from G1223 (διά) and G3563 (νοῦς); deep thought, properly, the faculty (mind or its disposition), by implication, its exercise; imagination, mind, understanding [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2992.desc: [G2992] λαός laós - apparently a primary word; a people (in general; thus differing from G1218 (δῆμος), which denotes one's own populace); people [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3330.desc: [G3330] μεταδίδωμι metadídōmi - from G3326 (μετά) and G1325 (δίδωμι); to give over, i.e. share; give, impart [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4104.desc: [G4104] πιστόω pistóō - from G4103 (πιστός); to assure; assure of [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3619.desc: [G3619] οἰκοδομή oikodomḗ - feminine (abstract) of a compound of G3624 (οἶκος) and the base of G1430 (δῶμα); architecture, i.e. (concretely) a structure; figuratively, confirmation; building, edify(-ication, -ing) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1515.desc: [G1515] εἰρήνη eirḗnē - probably from a primary verb (to join); peace (literally or figuratively); by implication, prosperity; one, peace, quietness, rest, + set at one again [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2516.desc: [G2516] καθέζομαι kathézomai - from G2596 (κατά) and the base of G1476 (ἑδραῖος); to sit down; sit [BLB] [BibleHub]

G291.desc: [G291] Ἀμπλίας Amplías - contracted for Latin ampliatus (enlarged); Amplias, a Roman Christian; Amplias [BLB] [BibleHub]

G870.desc: [G870] ἀφόβως aphóbōs - adverb from a compound of G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G5401 (φόβος); fearlessly; without fear [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5188.desc: [G5188] τύφω týphō - apparently a primary verb; to make a smoke, i.e. slowly consume without flame; smoke [BLB] [BibleHub]

G174.desc: [G174] ἀκάνθινος akánthinos - from G173 (ἄκανθα); thorny; of thorns [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4229.desc: [G4229] πρᾶγμα prâgma - from G4238 (πράσσω); a deed; by implication, an affair; by extension, an object (material); business, matter, thing, work [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1498.desc: [G1498] εἴην eíēn - optative (i.e. English subjunctive) present of G1510 (εἰμί) (including the other person); might (could, would, or should) be; mean, + perish, should be, was, were [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5546.desc: [G5546] Χριστιανός Christianós - from G5547 (Χριστός); a Christian, i.e. follower of Christ; Christian [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2450.desc: [G2450] Ἰουδαΐζω Ioudaḯzō - from G2453 (Ἰουδαῖος); to become a Judæan, i.e. "Judaize"; live as the Jews [BLB] [BibleHub]

G803.desc: [G803] ἀσφάλεια aspháleia - from G804 (ἀσφαλής); security (literally or figuratively); certainty, safety [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1918.desc: [G1918] ἐπιγαμβρεύω epigambreúō - from G1909 (ἐπί) and a derivative of G1062 (γάμος); to form affinity with, i.e. (specially) in a levirate way; marry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G441.desc: [G441] ἀνθρωπάρεσκος anthrōpáreskos - from G444 (ἄνθρωπος) and G700 (ἀρέσκω); man-courting, i.e. fawning; men-pleaser [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2628.desc: [G2628] κατακολουθέω katakolouthéō - from G2596 (κατά) and G190 (ἀκολουθέω); to accompany closely; follow (after) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2569.desc: [G2569] καλοποιέω kalopoiéō - from G2570 (καλός) and G4160 (ποιέω); to do well, i.e. live virtuously; well doing [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4224.desc: [G4224] πότος pótos - from the alternate of G4095 (πίνω); a drinking-bout or carousal; banqueting [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3353.desc: [G3353] μέτοχος métochos - from G3348 (μετέχω); participant, i.e. (as noun) a sharer; by implication, an associate; fellow, partaker, partner [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1984.desc: [G1984] ἐπισκοπή episkopḗ - from G1980 (ἐπισκέπτομαι); inspection (for relief); by implication, superintendence; specially, the Christian "episcopate"; the office of a "bishop", bishoprick, visitation [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3379.desc: [G3379] μήποτε mḗpote - from G3361 (μή) and G4218 (ποτέ); not ever; also if (or lest) ever (or perhaps); if peradventure, lest (at any time, haply), not at all, whether or not [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5138.desc: [G5138] τραχύς trachýs - perhaps strengthened from the base of G4486 (ῥήγνυμι) (as if jagged by rents); uneven, rocky (reefy); rock, rough [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3043.desc: [G3043] λίνον línon - probably a primary word; flax, i.e. (by implication) "linen"; linen [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1906.desc: [G1906] ἐπερώτημα eperṓtēma - from G1905 (ἐπερωτάω); an inquiry; answer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4757.desc: [G4757] στρατιώτης stratiṓtēs - from a presumed derivative of the same as G4756 (στρατιά); a camper-out, i.e. a (common) warrior (literally or figuratively); soldier [BLB] [BibleHub]

G462.desc: [G462] ἀνόσιος anósios - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G3741 (ὅσιος); wicked; unholy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G580.desc: [G580] ἀποβολή apobolḗ - from G577 (ἀποβάλλω); rejection; figuratively, loss; casting away, loss [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5604.desc: [G5604] ὠδίν ōdín - akin to G3601 (ὀδύνη); a pang or throe, especially of childbirth; pain, sorrow, travail [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2725.desc: [G2725] κατήγορος katḗgoros - from G2596 (κατά) and G58 (ἀγορά); against one in the assembly, i.e. a complainant at law; specially, Satan; accuser [BLB] [BibleHub]

G190.desc: [G190] ἀκολουθέω akolouthéō - from G1 (Α) (as a particle of union) and (a road); properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. to accompany (specially, as a disciple); follow, reach [BLB] [BibleHub]

G244.desc: [G244] ἀλλοτριεπίσκοπος allotriepískopos - from G245 (ἀλλότριος) and G1985 (ἐπίσκοπος); overseeing others' affairs, i.e. a meddler (specially, in Gentile customs); busybody in other men's matters [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4092.desc: [G4092] πίμπρημι pímprēmi - a reduplicated and prolonged form of a primary ; which occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses); to fire, i.e. burn (figuratively and passively, become inflamed with fever); be (X should have) swollen [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5334.desc: [G5334] φάσις phásis - from G5346 (φημί) (not the same as "phase", which is from G5316 (φαίνω)); a saying, i.e. report; tidings [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4505.desc: [G4505] ῥύμη rhýmē - prolongation from G4506 (ῥύομαι) in its original sense; an alley or avenue (as crowded); lane, street [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3104.desc: [G3104] Μαϊνάν Maïnán - probably of Hebrew origin; Mainan, an Israelite; Mainan [BLB] [BibleHub]

G791.desc: [G791] ἀστεῖος asteîos - from (a city); urbane, i.e. (by implication) handsome; fair [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1708.desc: [G1708] ἐμπλοκή emplokḗ - from G1707 (ἐμπλέκω); elaborate braiding of the hair; plaiting [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5217.desc: [G5217] ὑπάγω hypágō - from G5259 (ὑπό) and G71 (ἄγω); to lead (oneself) under, i.e. withdraw or retire (as if sinking out of sight), literally or figuratively; depart, get hence, go (a-)way [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3031.desc: [G3031] λιβανωτός libanōtós - from G3030 (λίβανος); frankincense, i.e. (by extension) a censer for burning it; censer [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2620.desc: [G2620] κατακαυχάομαι katakaucháomai - from G2596 (κατά) and G2744 (καυχάομαι); to exult against (i.e. over); boast (against), glory, rejoice against [BLB] [BibleHub]

G648.desc: [G648] ἀποστεγάζω apostegázō - from G575 (ἀπό) and a derivative of G4721 (στέγη); to unroof; uncover [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2523.desc: [G2523] καθίζω kathízō - another (active) form for G2516 (καθέζομαι); to seat down, i.e. set (figuratively, appoint); intransitively, to sit (down); figuratively, to settle (hover, dwell); continue, set, sit (down), tarry [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2175.desc: [G2175] εὐωδία euōdía - from a compound of G2095 (εὖ) and a derivative of G3605 (ὄζω); good-scentedness, i.e. fragrance; sweet savour (smell, -smelling) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5077.desc: [G5077] τεφρόω tephróō - from (ashes); to incinerate, i.e. consume; turn to ashes [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4714.desc: [G4714] στάσις stásis - from the base of G2476 (ἵστημι); a standing (properly, the act), i.e. (by analogy) position (existence); by implication, a popular uprising; figuratively, controversy; dissension, insurrection, X standing, uproar [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3883.desc: [G3883] παραλλαγή parallagḗ - from a compound of G3844 (παρά) and G236 (ἀλλάσσω); transmutation (of phase or orbit), i.e. (figuratively) fickleness; variableness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3791.desc: [G3791] ὀχλέω ochléō - from G3793 (ὄχλος); to mob, i.e. (by implication) to harass; vex [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5482.desc: [G5482] χάραξ chárax - from (to sharpen to a point; akin to G1125 (γράφω) through the idea of scratching); a stake, i.e. (by implication) a palisade or rampart (military mound for circumvallation in a siege); trench [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2134.desc: [G2134] εὐνουχίζω eunouchízō - from G2135 (εὐνοῦχος); to castrate (figuratively, live unmarried); make…eunuch [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2638.desc: [G2638] καταλαμβάνω katalambánō - from G2596 (κατά) and G2983 (λαμβάνω); to take eagerly, i.e. seize, possess, etc. (literally or figuratively); apprehend, attain, come upon, comprehend, find, obtain, perceive, (over-)take [BLB] [BibleHub]

G400.desc: [G400] ἀναφωνέω anaphōnéō - from G303 (ἀνά) and G5455 (φωνέω); to exclaim; speak out [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4374.desc: [G4374] προσφέρω prosphérō - from G4314 (πρός) and G5342 (φέρω) (including its alternate); to bear towards, i.e. lead to, tender (especially to God), treat; bring (to, unto), deal with, do, offer (unto, up), present unto, put to [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1471.desc: [G1471] ἔγκυος énkyos - from G1722 (ἐν) and the base of G2949 (κῦμα); swelling inside, i.e. pregnant; great with child [BLB] [BibleHub]

G460.desc: [G460] ἀνόμως anómōs - adverb from G459 (ἄνομος); lawlessly, i.e. (specially) not amenable to (the Jewish) law; without law [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3326.desc: [G3326] μετά metá - a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; "amid" (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between G575 (ἀπό) or G1537 (ἐκ) and G1519 (εἰς) or G4314 (πρός); less intimate than G1722 (ἐν) and less close than G4862 (σύν)); after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2583.desc: [G2583] κανών kanṓn - from (a straight reed, i.e. rod); a rule ("canon"), i.e. (figuratively) a standard (of faith and practice); by implication, a boundary, i.e. (figuratively) a sphere (of activity); line, rule [BLB] [BibleHub]

G544.desc: [G544] ἀπειθέω apeithéō - from G545 (ἀπειθής); to disbelieve (wilfully and perversely); not believe, disobedient, obey not, unbelieving [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5398.desc: [G5398] φοβερός phoberós - from G5401 (φόβος); frightful, i.e. (objectively) formidable; fearful, terrible [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1630.desc: [G1630] ἔκφοβος ékphobos - from G1537 (ἐκ) and G5401 (φόβος); frightened out of one's wits; sore afraid, exceedingly fear [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4910.desc: [G4910] συνευωχέω syneuōchéō - from G4862 (σύν) and a derivative of a presumed compound of G2095 (εὖ) and a derivative of G2192 (ἔχω) (meaning to be in good condition, i.e. (by implication) to fare well, or feast); to entertain sumptuously in company with, i.e. (middle voice or passive) to revel together; feast with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3664.desc: [G3664] ὅμοιος hómoios - from the base of G3674 (ὁμοῦ); similar (in appearance or character); like, + manner [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5228.desc: [G5228] ὑπέρ hypér - a primary preposition; "over", i.e. (with the genitive case) of place, above, beyond, across, or causal, for the sake of, instead, regarding; with the accusative case superior to, more than; (+ exceeding, abundantly) above, in (on) behalf of, beyond, by, + very chiefest, concerning, exceeding (above, -ly), for, + very highly, more (than), of, over, on the part of, for sake of, in stead, than, to(-ward), very [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2570.desc: [G2570] καλός kalós - of uncertain affinity; properly, beautiful, but chiefly (figuratively) good (literally or morally), i.e. valuable or virtuous (for appearance or use, and thus distinguished from G18 (ἀγαθός), which is properly intrinsic) ; X better, fair, good(-ly), honest, meet, well, worthy [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2969.desc: [G2969] κωμόπολις kōmópolis - from G2968 (κώμη) and G4172 (πόλις); an unwalled city; town [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5336.desc: [G5336] φάτνη phátnē - from (to eat); a crib (for fodder); manager, stall [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2301.desc: [G2301] θεατρίζω theatrízō - from G2302 (θέατρον); to expose as a spectacle; make a gazing stock [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1410.desc: [G1410] δύναμαι dýnamai - of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible; be able, can (do, + -not), could, may, might, be possible, be of power [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3595.desc: [G3595] ὁδηγός hodēgós - from G3598 (ὁδός) and G2233 (ἡγέομαι); a conductor (literally or figuratively (teacher)); guide, leader [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2898.desc: [G2898] κρανίον kraníon - diminutive of a derivative of the base of G2768 (κέρας); a skull ("cranium"); Calvary, skull [BLB] [BibleHub]

G50.desc: [G50] ἀγνοέω agnoéō - from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G3539 (νοιέω); not to know (through lack of information or intelligence); by implication, to ignore (through disinclination); (be) ignorant(-ly), not know, not understand, unknown [BLB] [BibleHub]

G5259.desc: [G5259] ὑπό hypó - a primary preposition; under, i.e. (with the genitive case) of place (beneath), or with verbs (the agency or means, through); (with the accusative case) of place (whither (underneath) or where (below) or time (when (at)); among, by, from, in, of, under, with [BLB] [BibleHub]

G927.desc: [G927] βαρύτιμος barýtimos - from G926 (βαρύς) and G5092 (τιμή); highly valuable; very precious [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1243.desc: [G1243] διαίρεσις diaíresis - from G1244 (διαιρέω); a distinction or (concretely) variety; difference, diversity [BLB] [BibleHub]

G56.desc: [G56] ἀγνωσία agnōsía - from G1 (Α) (as negative particle) and G1108 (γνῶσις); ignorance (properly, the state); ignorance, not the knowledge [BLB] [BibleHub]

G891.desc: [G891] ἄχρι áchri - akin to G206 (ἄκρον) (through the idea of a terminus); (of time) until or (of place) up to; as far as, for, in(-to), till, (even, un-)to, until, while [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2837.desc: [G2837] κοιμάω koimáō - from G2749 (κεῖμαι); to put to sleep, i.e. (passively or reflexively) to slumber; figuratively, to decease; (be a-, fall a-, fall on) sleep, be dead [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4889.desc: [G4889] σύνδουλος sýndoulos - from G4862 (σύν) and G1401 (δοῦλος); a co-slave, i.e. servitor or ministrant of the same master (human or divine); fellowservant [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4292.desc: [G4292] προκαλέομαι prokaléomai - middle voice from G4253 (πρό) and G2564 (καλέω); to call forth to oneself (challenge), i.e. (by implication) to irritate; provoke [BLB] [BibleHub]

G3350.desc: [G3350] μετοικεσία metoikesía - from a derivative of a compound of G3326 (μετά) and G3624 (οἶκος); a change of abode, i.e. (specially), expatriation; X brought, carried(-ying) away (in-)to [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2903.desc: [G2903] κράτιστος krátistos - superlative of a derivative of G2904 (κράτος); strongest, i.e. (in dignity) very honorable; most excellent (noble) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G167.desc: [G167] ἀκαθαρσία akatharsía - from G169 (ἀκάθαρτος); impurity (the quality), physically or morally; uncleanness [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4342.desc: [G4342] προσκαρτερέω proskarteréō - from G4314 (πρός) and G2594 (καρτερέω); to be earnest towards, i.e. (to a thing) to persevere, be constantly diligent, or (in a place) to attend assiduously all the exercises, or (to a person) to adhere closely to (as a servitor); attend (give self) continually (upon), continue (in, instant in, with), wait on (continually) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2810.desc: [G2810] Κλεόπας Kleópas - probably contracted from (compound of G2811 (κλέος) and G3962 (πατήρ)); Cleopas, a Christian; Cleopas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1309.desc: [G1309] διαφεύγω diapheúgō - from G1223 (διά) and G5343 (φεύγω); to flee through, i.e. escape; escape [BLB] [BibleHub]

G713.desc: [G713] ἀρκετός arketós - from G714 (ἀρκέω); satisfactory; enough, suffice (-ient) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4235.desc: [G4235] πρᾷος prâios - a form of G4239 (πραΰς), used in certain parts; gentle, i.e. humble; meek [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4208.desc: [G4208] ποῤῥωτέρω porrhōtérō - adverb comparative of G4206 (πόῤῥω); further, i.e. a greater distance; farther [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4609.desc: [G4609] Σίλας Sílas - contraction for G4610 (Σιλουανός); Silas, a Christian; Silas [BLB] [BibleHub]

G897.desc: [G897] Βαβυλών Babylṓn - of Hebrew origin (H0894); Babylon, the capitol of Chaldæa (literally or figuratively (as a type of tyranny)); Babylon [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1389.desc: [G1389] δολόω dolóō - from G1388 (δόλος); to ensnare, i.e. (figuratively) adulterate; handle deceitfully [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4203.desc: [G4203] πορνεύω porneúō - from G4204 (πόρνη); to act the harlot, i.e. (literally) indulge unlawful lust (of either sex), or (figuratively) practise idolatry; commit (fornication) [BLB] [BibleHub]

G4629.desc: [G4629] σκέπασμα sképasma - from a derivative of (a covering; perhaps akin to the base of G4649 (σκοπός) through the idea of noticeableness); clothing; raiment [BLB] [BibleHub]

G2773.desc: [G2773] κερματιστής kermatistḗs - from a derivative of G2772 (κέρμα); a handler of coins, i.e. money-broker; changer of money [BLB] [BibleHub]

G1368.desc: [G1368] διϋλίζω diÿlízō - from G1223 (διά) and (to filter); to strain out; strain at (probably by misprint) [BLB] [BibleHub]
